12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview

0-S-1-   08261106 E N-K BOLFMT = ACCORDBC  (Copy Accord)
                    N-K-1 BolFmt = AccordBC   for Accord with Bar Codes.   See Attached Sample.
                    Integer Value = 1 will summarize tags.   Integer Value = 0 will print each Tag#
                    The VIEW FORM is used to definespecific customers to use new Bill of Lading Format.
                    Character types AccordBC and Integer Value = 0
                    The AccordBC will print the bar code that print when checking the toggle box
                    Print Bar Code by Item Number.  The user WILL NOT need to check the toggle box.
                    The AccordBC form will automatically print the BarCode for each item starting on the 1st page.
                    This form will not print a 2nd page just for bar codes like the toggle box which prints.
                    
                    If a customer has the AccordBC defined, the attached bill of lading will print with a bar code
                    for each item, but this will be summarized by FG item and PO#.
                    
                    For example, 
                    It there are 10 tags for item 6x6x6 on bill of lading and each tag has 50 cases and 250 per case.
                    
                    Integer value = 0 will print each tag.
                    Integer value = 1 will summarize onto 1 line shows 500 cases at 250 for total of 125,00 boxes.
                    
                    Accord format should also summarize the BOL lines by item/PO. 
                    So if 4 tags were for 6x6x6 for PO# ABC
                    and  6 tags were for 6x6x6 for PO# XYZ
                    The print would summarize by Item and PO#.
                    Line 1 would show item 6x6x6, PO ABC for 200 Cases at 250 per case for a total of and 50,000.
                    Line 2 would show item 6x6x6, PO XYZ for 300 Cases at 250 per case for a total of and 75,000.  
0-S-3-   05081206 E N-K BOLFMT = LoyLang
                    1) Print Freight Terms from the O-S-1 Bill of Lading Folder.
                    2) Print the Freight Terms from the O-S-1 Bill of Lading Folder.  
                    3) Print the Freight FOB Terms from the Release Folder.  If the FOB on O-U-1 Release Folder      
                    is blank, then this will pull from the O-U-1 View Order Screen.
                    
                    
                    Currentl the fields above pulls from the Customer file.  See attachment.
0-T-3-   05081203 E N-K RELPRINT = LoyLang

                    2)  Print the Carrier from the O-T-1 Release Folder.  
                          This currently pulls from the Customer file.  
                    3)  Print the Freight FOB Terms from the Release Folder. 
                          If this is blank, then this will pull from  the O-U-1 View Folder Screen.   
                          If multiple release numbers exist on the release  then this will pull from the 1st Release 
                    on the Release.   
                    
                    See attachment.

A-C-4-   09271110 E N-K AuditDir - Change logic for AC4 to save to disk
                    The N-K-1 AuditDir  parameter is used to save the AUDIT TRAILS to Disk Drive.
                    For example A-U-4 already has this logic.
                    This replaced the files being saved to the RCODE directory.
                    N-K-1 AuditDir Character Value houses the name of the Folder to save the data files.
                    For Example, ASI stores other posting reports know as Audit Trails to the following Disk Drive.
                    P:\ASI10Test\Rco1010\Audit 001\AUDIT TRAILS
                    
                    Change Logic for the A-C-4 Miscellaneous Cash Receipts posting Register  to save to the Disk Driv
                    e folder defined under the character value when posting = YES.  
                    Program name is ar/r-mise&p.r
                    
                    This is ONLY Save to Disk when the user clicks YES to Post will this save to Disk.

A-F-1-   03021012 E Push Pin in O-U-1 by Order #  (Shared Mod)
                    Add an Order# to the Push Pin File.
                    You will be able to add customer notes without Orders.
                    You will be able to add customer notes with orders.
                    Both will be viewed in Order Entry. 
                    Please note, Advantzware allows multiple line items.
                    It is possible to have a separate customer PO for each Line item.
                    Hence, you may need to add Many Purchase Order Attachments for one order. 
                    
                    For Example, Attachements added via A-F-1 with Notes such as 
                    Must Ship All Order COD will not have an Order Number
                    Must Place PO on all Orders will not have an Order Number
                    They will show on all orders via the Push Pin.
                    
                    In addition, a specific order you can attached a PO and enter the Order Number.
                    When adding the attachement via O-U-1, the order will transfer to the attachement.
                    When clicking the push pin in Order Entry, O-Q-1 or O-U-1 only notes for that specific order will
                     appear plus any attachement that DO NOT have an Order Number attached.

A-F-1-   03111005 E Push Pin in O-U-1 by Order #  (Shared Mod)
                    Add an Order# to the Push Pin File.
                    You will be able to add customer notes without Orders.
                    You will be able to add customer notes with orders.
                    Both will be viewed in Order Entry. 
                    Please note, Advantzware allows multiple line items.
                    It is possible to have a separate customer PO for each Line item.
                    Hence, you may need to add Many Purchase Order Attachments for one order. 
                    
                    For Example, Attachements added via A-F-1 with Notes such as 
                    Must Ship All Order COD will not have an Order Number
                    Must Place PO on all Orders will not have an Order Number
                    They will show on all orders via the Push Pin.
                    
                    In addition, a specific order you can attached a PO and enter the Order Number.
                    When adding the attachement via O-U-1, the order will transfer to the attachement.
                    When clicking the push pin in Order Entry, O-Q-1 or O-U-1 only notes for that specific order will
                     appear plus any attachement that DO NOT have an Order Number attached.
                    
                    
                    
A-F-1-   04011005 E Push Pin Notes for ONLY customer, not Order
                    The OU1 Push Pin works perfectly in that it shows customer attachment as well as attachments spec
                    ific to that order.
                    
                    The AF1 Push Pin should NOT show attachments for any orders.
                    The AF1 Push Pin will only show attachments for the customer.
                    
                    
                    For Example, Order 202027 has an attachment.
                    The customer ABCPAC should not show this attachment in the customer file.
                    
                    This is new logic based on user conference how all customers want this to work.
                    Pushpin notes added in the order, will only show in that order (order number is attached)
                    Pushpin notes added in the Customer file, will only show notes without an order#
                    Pushpin notes added in the Customer file, will show on all orders for that customer.

                    To recalculate the high balance, the (up to days old) field in the AQ2 screen will be used.
                    
                    2.Add logic (toggle box) to Customer totals (Recalc Acct Balance) button.  If checked, it will re
                    calculate the High Balance field using the NK-High Balance integer value.  If "*" entered it will
                     do all customers.

A-F-3-   05031202 E ImportBudget.PDF (Import of salesmen budgget)
                    Budgets Tab:    New Button  Purge Purge Existing Budgets? 
                    Add Program Security for this new Button.  (Discuss with Yoousn if you need help with Security)
                    YES, will remove all budget from all salesman matrixs.
                    Then when they click the IMPORT BUDGETS, only budgets from Excel will be imported.
                    The exiting IMPORT BUDGETS Button will not be changed.
                    This overwrites budgets but does not change budgets that are not imported.  
                    See attachment
                    Email from Colin:
                    From earlier experiences with this upload program, I believe that it may need a "clear-out" optio
                    n to wipe out pre-existing current year budget data from all customer a/cs. My reasoning for this
                     is that I'm not sure what happens if there's prior data for customer ABC Ltd, with whom we no lo
                    nger do business. There is, therefore, no new data to go into that customer a/c, so what happens 
                    to their pre-existing budget data?  (My concern is that it would remain, and thereby become incor
                    rect for the new year, which s/be zero for ABC Ltd.)
                    Colin

A-F-8-   11111104 E New Load Button to Import Freight Rates from Excel
                    New Load Button to Import Freight Rates from Excel.  (See Similar Logic from G-F-6)
                    See Attached Files for how Excel Columns will transfer to Carrier.  The Excel Format Attached mus
                    t be used for Import.  The LOAD button will be on the A-F-8 Carrier Screen via the VIEW Folder.  
                    Hence the rates will be loaded into that Carrier.
                    1) The First Zip Code will not be imported.
                          However, the first Zip Code should match the G-F-1 Company File zip code.
                          If they do not match, Program should STOP and Prompt "Incorrect Company Defined"
                    2)  The 2nd Zip Code will be loaded on the MATRIX Folder.
                    3)  The CLASS will be loaded to the Delivery Zone.
                    4)  MC1 (Minimim Charge)  will be loaded onto the Min Rate Field.
                    5)  L5C (Less the 500)  the Rate will be load to the 1st Rate Field.
                    6)  M1M (More than 1000)  The Rate will be load to the 2nd Rate Field.
                    7)  M2M (More than 2000)  The Rate will be load to the 3rd Rate Field.
                    8)  M5M (More than 5000)  The Rate will be load to the 4th Rate Field.
                    9)  M10M (More than 10,000)  The Rate will be load to the 5th Rate Field.
                    
                    Program will pompt for ______________________  Excel File

                    e total cost, and then take the corresponding % from that value.

A-R-5-   09181408 E N-K CustomerList  View Form Character Value = AR5 Logical Value = Yes
                    Example A
                    N-K-1 CustomerList View Control Logical Value = YES.
                    View Form Customer Code =  ___________
                    View Form Character Value = AR5
                    View Form Logical Value = Yes
                    The Above settings will force the AR5 Age Accounts Receivable Report by User ID.
                    The N-U  User ID File has a CUSTOMER Tab.
                    The Customers defined on the Customer Tab will be preseleted by user ID.
                    For example,
                    A sales persons user ID can assign only his customers in the user ID file.
                    When the A/R Agingg report is run, only his cusomers will print on the report.
                    Example B
                    N-K-1 CustomerList View Control Logical Value = YES.
                    View Form Customer Code =  IBM1000
                    View Form Character Value = AR5
                    View Form Logical Value = Yes
		    The Above settings will force the AR5 Age Accounts Receivable Report to Only show the cusomer IBM
                    10000 regardless of userID.
                    Example C
                    N-K-1 CustomerList View Control Logical Value = NO.   This will show all customers.

A-R-5-   10181104 E Payment Trend Average:  New field to AR Aging Report
                    A-R-5 report will print  Average Days to Pay From A-F-1 Totals Folder and Trend Days
                    This will simply compare the A-F-1 Totals Folder field called Average Days to Pay  less the newly
                     calculated Days to Pay from the Days Entered by Customer.
                    N-K-1 AGEDAYS  integer value is used to calculate the  Field = Average Days to Pay in the A-F-1 T
                    otals Folder when cash receipts are posted.  For example, if this were 365 then the overall days 
                    to pay would be based on invoices within the last 365 days.
                    Add New field on A-R-5 Print Screen called  "Days for Recent Trend?"  =  999  (for example 90)
                    (See Attached print dialog screen for the A-R-5 report ).  
                    If this is Zero, new Logic will not calculate to save time printing Report.
                    If TREND DAYS  = 90, then program would use payments received in the last 90 days.
                    The Program will calculate the number of days between invoice date and payment date.
                    The total number of days of all invoices paid will be divided by the total number of invoices.
                    Lets assume the A-F-1 Totals Folder shows Average Days to Pay = 50
                    If the new calculation of the Recent Trend Days to Pay = 45 days then the 
                    Recent Payment Trend = 45 - 50 = -5  which would print on the A-R-5 Aging Report
                    Recent Payment Trend Formula = Recent Trend Days to Pay - Overall Average Days to Pay
                    The end result is that right there on the A/R detail report, you will be able to see customers te
                    rms, the average days to pay for the last year (or however it is defined in the N-K-1 AGEDAYS) co
                    mpared to the 90 day trend (or whatever is defined in the trend length of time in the print dialo
                    g screen).    So for example: A person reviewing the aging would see 1% 10, Net 30   ADTP 45  TRE
                    ND  -5 and know that a customers terms are 1% 10, net 30 and their average days to pay is 45 days
                     for the last year and that in the last 90 days, they are paying 5 days faster than the recent ye
                    ars average.

                    See Attached.

                    This logic will give the ability to run the AR Aged Receivable report for multiple selected compa
                    nies with the company Range Added to Report Heading.

D-R-3-   04271201 E Toggle Box = Print Tons or Qty
                    New Toggle Boxes   Print QTY / Tons/ MSF   
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page:  20

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    Existing Logic prints the quantity of sheets or blanks posted to the machine by job.
                    New Toggle Boxs will calculate total Tons or MSF of board based on the machine feed type. 
                    
                    Roll Fed and Sheet Fed Calculation Formula is as Follows:
                    Quantity x  Board Sheet Lenght x Width (Material Type = B Issued to Job) = Square Feet
                    Square Feet / 144,000 = Total MSF.   (This will print if Toggle Box = MSF)
                    Total MSF  x Basis Weight (Weight per MSF ) = Total Pounds.
                    Total Pounds / 2000 Lbs = Tons.  (This will print if Toggle Box = TON)
                    
                    Please note, this report must find the Board Material issued to the Job via the Job Material file
                    .
                    Machine data collection is by FORM number.
                    The Job's Board materials issued to the JOB will have a FORM number.
                    This Board material will have the Width and Length for that FORM in the J-U-1 Job File.
                    Find the Board Width x Lenght times Data Collection Quantity Produced.
                    Please Note, Waste isn't reported in Effeciency Reports so will be excluded from MSF & Tons
                    
                    Blank Fed Machines such as GL department.
                    This will not use the Sheet Size from the Job File.   
                    Calculation will use the Finished Goods Items Square Inches from the I-F-1 Totals Folder.
                    MSF = Blank Square Feet x Machine Quantity Produced / 1000 = Total MSF  
                    Tons = MSF x Boards Basis Weight / 2000 = Tons.  (This will print if Toggle Box = TON)
                    
                    
                    
                    
D-R-4-   05241004 E Exclude Old MR Hours?  Quoted $75

                    subsequent times of running a transaction.
                    
                    So if a job has run prior to the date range being entered on the selection parameters, do not sho
                    w standard MR  hours if this has already been entered previously.  They would still show the actu
                    al mr hours being entered in this time frame.

E-A-E-   12220906 E Folding  - Spec Folder
                    See Attached
E-A-E-C  01111204 E N-K CEMenu
                    CEMENU - Which Estimating Menu? (Foldware, Corrware, or Both. The character value is used to dete
                    rmine the estimating menu options. Folding carton estimating will be set to Foldware, corrugated 
                    estimating will be set to Corrware and plants processing both types will set this to BOTH.  When 
                    the character value is set to Corrware, the logical value may be used to dictate allow adding est
                    imates on the first screen or header screen of order entry.  
                    
                    Logical Value = NO. If the logical value is NO, then the corrugated estimate number may be added 
                    only to the line item data entry screen.  This will force users to always enter the estimate numb
                    er on the line item screen, which will allow mulitple estimates/jobs per order including stock bo
                    xes, supplies and just in times items previously produced on other jobs. 
                    
                    Logical Value = YES. When the logical value is YES, then corrugated estimates may be added to the
                     first order entry screen or to the line item screen. When estimates are added to the View folder
                    , then multiple estimates/jobs cannot by added to this order. Hence only one order per job may be
                     entered.
                    
                    Accord's CEMenu is set to Foldware and No
E-A-E-C  01181103 E Corrugated Estimates - date field
                    When you are adding a corrugated estimate the date of that day needs to be automatically imported
                     by default.
                    
                    Example is if todays date is 11/25/2044 then that date should be in the date field automatically.
                      You should have to type it in.
E-A-E-F  01181104 E Folding Estimates - date field
                    When you are adding a folding estimate the date of that day needs to be automatically imported by
                     default.
                    
                    Example is if todays date is 11/25/2044 then that date should be in the date field automatically.
                      You should have to type it in.

                    See Attached for steps
                    Add Job Stds button to the LAYOUT folder with its functionality
                    Job Standards button is not on layout screen
                    
                    This Button should ONLY work for INTERNAL employees.
                    Customers (External Users)  should not see this button.
                    ie.  Login as IBM should not see this button on any folder in estimating.

E-A-N-   03291018 E N-K Notepad - Notepad instead of standard screen output.
                    N-K Notepad  -   Reports to output to Microsoft Notepad instead of standard text format.
                    This allows the user to view more lines and to scroll up, down and sideways and to print form the
                     notepad software.
                    
                    Logical Value = YES will Load Reports directly to Notepad using the logic below..
                    
                    Logical Value = NO will not Load to Notepad.
                    
                    
                    Also, be aware that because of the "NO-WAIT" option, any code that follows the users going to the
                     current window for output, that code will immediately run.   Some programs ask about posting, et
                    c. after the user closes the output screen.  
                    These kind of prompts will fire immediately regardless of whether they close the notepad.

                    The screen shot will be the bill of lading form.
                    Think of a FED X delivery.
                    You must sign a signature.
                    I envision the truck driver using a TABLET PC .
                    This will show an image of the Bill of Lading printed via our software via N-K-1 BolFmt.
                    
                    Your software will only have a field for signature.
                    The signature will be an OVERLAY of the bill of lading from.
                    The SEND button will create a .PDF or .JPG of the form and signature.
                    
                    Currently they sign the bill of lading on a piece of laser paper .
                    Our customers then SCAN the entire page via a scanner.
                    This new file is saved as the bill of lading number.JPG or .PDF
                    We currently save this under the network drive based on N-K-1 BOLSIGN 
                    Character Value = D:\Rcode\SIGNED_BOLS\
                    This is then view via ASI ANYWARE simply displayed this scaned image.
                    
                    
                    This new logic via Tablet PC will make this a paperless transaction and eliminate the step of sca
                    nning the manually signed bill of lading document..

E-A-S-S  03121309 E Sharp Shooter Finished Good CONSOLIDATE Button
                    Rewrite Sharp Shooter Finished Goods CONSOLIDATE GOODS Button for ASI Anyware.
                    This programs allows the user to combine units (Cases or bundles of boxes) from one tag to anothe
                    r tag for the same finished goods item and job number.
                    
                    For example, 
                    Pallet Tag# 1 has 20 Cases of 500 boxes per Case.
                    Pallet Tag# 2 has 10 Cases of 500 boxes per Case.
                    A full Pallet may have 50 cases.
                    The box manufacturer does not want to ship full pallet loads.
                    Consolidate tags allows combining cases onto one pallet.
                    
                    User will Scan Tag#2 and program imports 10 cases.
                    User then scans Tag#1 and program transfers the 10 cases to Tag#1.
                    Net Result after Posting.
                    Tag# 1 has 30 Cases in the I-f-1 Bins Folder.
                    Tag#2 has 0 Cases in the I-F-1 Bins Folder.

E-C- -   02151103 E N-K CECPURWAS logical value = yes  Farmout tab to calculate without wa
                    Corrugated Estimating to Search FARM Folder Costs With or Without Machine Waste?
                    
                    Waste = Make Ready waste and Run Spoilage.
                    For purchased items, the FARM folder houses the cost for the purchased Finished Goods.   
                    The machine routing on the Prep/Route Folder may include make ready waste and run spoilage when c
                    alculating the total quantity to purchase.    For example, the FARM folder had quantities and cos
                    ts were $500 for 1 M, $300 for 5 M and $200 for 10 M and $100 for 999,999 M.  If we quoted estima
                    te quantities of 1000, 5000, 10000 and w had a 10% waste for the BUYOUT Machine representing the 
                    vendor waste, then the estimate would calculate sheets as 1100, 5500 and 11,000. 
                    
                    Logical value = YES, the waste IS NOT included in the calculated quantity required to purchase fi
                    nished goods when searching the FARM folder for the correct cost.    
                    If we ignore the waste the cost for 1M would be $500, 2M would be $300 and 10M as $200.
                    
                    Logical Value = NO.  Print Folder WILL include the calculated waste for the machines on the routi
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page:  43

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    ng folder.   The cost for 1M would be $300 as this would be over 1M and find the 5M cost.
                    The cost for 5M would be $200 as this would be over 5M and would find the cost for 10M.
                    The 10M cost would be $100 as this would find the 999,999 M cost.
E-C- -   02221117 E N-K CECSCRN = DECIMAL   Logical Value = Yes to Validate Dimensions
                    Corrugated Estimatng.  N-K-1 CECSCRN = Character Value = Decimals Only.
                    Logical Value = Yes will Validate Decimals to Right of Decimals.    
                    For Example.   Box dimenision may be 12.125 x 12.75 x 15.03125     If they typed 15..0325  the .0
                    325 is not valid.   Program would change this to .03125
                    Attached file shows only valid digits to right of decimal.     
                    
                    Program a table that matches this file.  The decimal number must be equal to one of these numbers
                     when Logical Value = Yes when Character Value = Decimal.
                                               
                    There are only 64 valid decimals numbers if user is using 64ths of an inch     
                    For example, if users types .014125, System will display, invalid Dimension.
                    If they type .015  it must be .015265
                    If they type .03  it must be .03125
                    If they type .07 it must be .078125
                    F1 Lookup on dimensions would be very usesful but only for digits to right of decimal.
                    And only when N-K-1 CECScrn = Decimals. 
E-C- -   02271203 E New TOTAL UP Field for the Gross Sheet Size
                    New Database Field:  Total Number Up.
                    See Attached.
                    
                    Our software calculates the Total Number Up on the Die and Total Number Out on the Gross Sheet vi
                    a the AutoCalc Button.
                    
                    The LAYOUT folder has a field that displays the total number out.
                    This is calculated by the Gross Sheet W x L x D.
                    However, the FOAM machine can cut like a jig saw and can cut dimensions we cannot calculate.    T
                    hey need the ability to manually type the total number out.
                    This will be used to calculate the total number of sheets on the PRINT folder.
                    
                    New Mod for OVERRIDE Button that requires a field to manually type Total Out.
                    This can default to the L X W x D, however user can change.
                    For example 3 x 2 x 1   = 6
                    User may type 7 Out.
                    The Esitmate Print Folder must calculate with the 101 rather than the 100.
E-C- -   02281208 E Expand Layout Width and Length to 9999.99
                    Estimate Layout Folder only allows 999.99 on Side to Side field.
                    See if we can expand this by 1 digit.
E-C- -   03081204 E New Toggle Box -Calc Board Cost per Blank ($75/Hour)
                    Estimate Print Folder - Calculate Button.  (See Attached)
                    New Toggle Box - Calc Board Cost per Blank
                    Currently, the program calculates the cost of board based on the GROSS Sheet.
                    Formula is Gross Sheet L X W x D / 144 x Sheets Required x Cost per BF or MSF.
                    
                    However, foam may be purchased in a BUN with a size of 48 x 108 x 40.
                    They may only need 5 pieces with a size of 48 x 108 x 2.
                    If they sliced 5 pieces off the block of foam.
                    They would have a foam piece of 48x108 x 30 remaining in inventory.
                    This piece of foam can be used on another job.
                    
                    This toggle box will allow the estimator to put the Stocked BUN of 48x108x 40 on the Layout Folde
                    r.    Toggle box will look at the blank size for calculating the cost of the board.
                    Formula will be 
                    Blank size of 48x108x2 / 144 times Estimate Quantity.
                    
                    
                    See ASI Estimate 9471 for Blank size 27.06x5.04x2.04 
                    Foam Bun is 55x125x35 with 120 out.
                    Only 5 blanks will be cut and bun will be returned to inventory.
                    For Example,  (27.375x5.25x2.25) / 144 x 5  = 11.22 BF x BF Cost 
                    Per M = Total Cost / Est Qty x 1000
E-C- -   03091106 E N-K CEMISC  Change simon code default on misc screen to be an "S"  cha

                    cluded.  They would like this to default to an "S" for seperate.  
                    This would take an N-K-1 flag to show the default.

E-C- -   05031303 E Cad/Artios default to  N-K SetPrint
                    CAD/Artios import will set the estimate type based on the N-K-1 SePrint Logical Value.
                    
                    Existing Logic when manually adding a SET Estimate.
                    N-K-1 parameter SetPrint logical value determines the type of set that is created.
                    Logical Value = YES, then set are created as UNASSEMBLED. 
                    Logical Value = NO, then the set will be defined as ASSEMBLED. 
                    Logical Value = ?  will create set estimates as assembled with Parts.

E-C- -   06091407 E WildCard Search by Style
                    See Attached.

E-C- -   06111209 E New Set Database Field called Set? on Estimate and Spec Tab
                    New Database Field called Set on the Estimate / Spec Folder?
                    This field will be used for Two Piece Boxes inside a Set.  
                    
                    For Example, ASI Estimate 9603 is a set for 1000 items.
                    The 1st item is a two piece box with a quantity per set = 2.
                    However, this means that you need two sheets that are glued together to make 1 box.
                    The 2nd item is a pad with a quantity per set = 2.
                    This item simply requires 2 pads for each Set.
                    
                    When you add an order for this set, if N-K-1 OEShip logical value = YES, then the set item and bo
                    th components are listed separately on the order.  This allows each component to ship separately.
                         The order will show 1000 sets, 2000 RSC's and 2000 Pads.
                    The reality is that the 2000 RSC's are glued together to make 1000 Boxes.
                    Hence they can only ship 1000 boxes.
                    
                    The program needs to know when to multiple the quantity per set times the set's order quantity.
                    If the new database field "Set" is YES, then the order quantity of the component will treated the
                     Qty per Set = 1.    For example, the RSC would have 2PC = YES and Pads = NO.
                    So the set order quantty = 1000 would yield a RSC order Quantity of 1000 and pads = 2000.
E-C- -   06121206 E Partition Styles = P
                    New Formual for Slot height.
                    We set our tolerances a little too tight.
                    Sorry for the confusion.
                                 Blank Width (Partition Height) under 4 inches - divide height by 2 and add .0625
                                 Blank Width (Partition Height) over 4 inches - divided height by 2 and add .125.
                    
                    Test with ASI Estimate 9562
                    The Blank Width = Partition Height = 4.3125
                    So 4.3125 / 2 + .125
                    
                    ASI Estimate 9563 the Height = 1 Inch.
                    Therefore the Slot Height = 1/ 2 + .0625

E-C- -   06191206 E New Set Database Field called Set? on Estimate and Spec Tab
                    New Database Field called Set on the Estimate / Spec Folder?
                    This field will be used for Two Piece Boxes inside a Set.  
                    
                    For Example, ASI Estimate 6603 is a set for 1000 items.
                    The 1st item is a two piece box with a quantity per set = 2.
                    However, this means that you need two sheets that are glued together to make 1 box.
                    The 2nd item is a pad with a quantity per set = 2.
                    This item simply requires 2 pads for each Set.
                    
                    When you add an order for this set, if N-K-1 OEShip logical value = YES, then the set item and bo
                    th components are listed separately on the order.  This allows each component to ship separately.
                         The order will show 1000 sets, 2000 RSC's and 2000 Pads.
                    The reality is that the 2000 RSC's are glued together to make 1000 Boxes.
                    Hence they can only ship 1000 boxes.
                    
                    The program needs to know when to multiple the quantity per set times the set's order quantity.
                    If the new database field "Set" is YES, then the order quantity of the component will treated the
                     Qty per Set = 1.    For example, the RSC would have 2PC = YES and Pads = NO.
                    So the set order quantty = 1000 would yield a RSC order Quantity of 1000 and pads = 2000.

E-C- -   07281004 E Corrugated Estimate  -  Default Broker Comm% to pull from AF1
                    Corrugated Estimate Only
                    PRINT Folder - Calculate Button.   
                    Click override GS&A
                    A toggle box field exists for Broker Comm%
                    The customer file field called Broker Comm% will transfer to this Field.
                    If this is zero, the Broker Commission will transfer from the estimate control file via E-B Menu.
                    
                    Likewise, if the GS&A Toggle box is not checked, the Broker Commission will still be used.
                    
                    Please note: once the GS&A broker commisssion has be added or changed, all future estimate calcul
                    ations will use this percentage.   Therefore the customer and control file will only be used when
                     this field is not modified.
                    
                    Please do not confuse this field with the commission field by salesman.  The commission by salesm
                    an will still work the way it always has.

E-C- -   08161009 E Default by style file for searching for size
                    Currect logic will first look at the fields called L and W from artios, if this has a size in it 
                    then use that size, if blank then use the blank size field.
                    Due to the new version of artios they are using this size is filled in more often then not, but t
                    hey no longer want it to always use this size.
                    New logic will be if the style is one of (5PF,5PFN,COM,FOL,FTB,FTT,HSC,RSC,RSCFOL) Then is the L,
                    W fields is filled in use that field.
                    If not one of these styles then do not look at the fields called L and W and just go to the blank
                     size field and pull that into the estimate

E-C- -   09161405 E New Sell Price Field on Prep Tab
                    Insert sale price field into Prep File and the Estimate Prep Tab.
                    N-K-1 CePrepPrice 
                    Character Value dictates the calculation based on Cost Markup or Profit Markup.
                    
                    1)  Add New Sell Price Field in the E-B Prep File
                    2)  Add New Sell Price Field in the Estimate Prep Tab.
                    3)  Add New Sell Price Field in the Quotes Prep Tab
                    4)  Estimator types Cost and Markup% and Program will calculate the Sell Price.
                    5)  Estimator changes the Markup% and Program will calcualte the Sell Price.
                    6)  Estimator changes the SELL price and the Program calculates the Markup.
                          The Cost is fixed so this will recalculate the Markup.
                    7)  Add Prep Code to the Estimate will impor the Cost, Markup and Sell Price.
                    8)  E-B Prep File, adding cost and markup will calculate Sell Price.
                    9)  Quotes created from Esimate will update the Quotes Sell Price.
                    10)  Add Estimate will transfer the Quotes Sell Price to the Orders Misc Tab.
                    11)  Add Misc Charge to Order will transfer the Preps Sell Price and Cost to the Misc Tab.

E-C- -   10211413 E WildCard Search on AUTOFIND options in Corrugated Estimates
                    Add   *WildCard* Search to All AutoFind Options.
                    F1on the Estimate Browser does not.
                    Click E-F Folding Estimate.
                    
                    1)  Etc.  Add to All F1 Lookups on Estimate Browser.
                          For Example.
                    a  Press F1 on Style,  Click Autofind by Name.  Type *Tray*   this finds nothing.
                          Under Click E-B-2  Folding Carton Styles  *WildCard* search for Style Description on the   
                                Auto Find Box was added and works perfectly.
                          For example, type *Tray*   this finds all styles with Tray in the Description.
                    b)   Likewise.  Click SPEC Tab.  Click F1 on Style.  Click Autofind by Name.  Type *Tray*
                           Move logic from E-B-2 to Speck Tab Style File.
                    c)  F1 on Estimate#.   Click AutoFind by Customer Name.  Type *Food*
                         This should find Hershey Foods.
                          Add This to All Auto Finds.

E-C- -   11111103 E N-K CEDeliveryZone
                    N-K-1 CEDeliveryZone
                    The existing logic to calculate freight uses the carrier, delivery zone and estimates shipping we
                    ight to search the A-F-8 Carrier Freight Matrix by MSF, Pallet or weight per 100 pounds (Wt/100).
                       The carrier file freight rates for that delivery zone is then multiplied by the estimate quant
                    ity for cost estimate and will use the quantity shipped on the bill of lading to calculate the BO
                    L freight cost.  Once the quantity and weight is determined, the freight rate table is used to ca
                    lculate the freight cost.  
                    
                    Character Value = SHIPTO File.   
                    This is the existing logic whereby the devlivery zone from the customer's SHIPTO file is transfer
                    red to the INKS/PACK folder of the esitmate. This is the carrier and zone used to calculate freig
                    ht cost.
                    
                    Character Value = FreightClass.  
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page:  50

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    When ADDing an estimate, the BOARD code's Freight Class will be transferred to the INKS/PACKS Tab
                     Delivery Zone to calcualte the freight cost.  The software calculates the freight cost based on 
                    carrier, delivery zone and weight. This logic will allow differnt delivery zones (aka freight cla
                    ssifications) for  chipBoard folding cartom such as 55 materials versus corrugated flute material
                     versus Foam such as 65.  Please note, this parameter setting requires the A-F-8 carrier matrix t
                    o have the Freight Classifications defined as Delivery Zones for each Carrier.  For example, the 
                    carrier FEDX will have a delivery of 55 to classify chipboard freight and a delivery zone of 65 f
                    or corrugated materials.

E-C- -   11181004 E New SET logic for Partitions.  (See Estimate 8320
                    New SET logic for Partitions.  New database fields will  automatically calculate Long and Short P
                    artition from the SET SCREEN.   
                    The Set Screen will have new database fields (See Attached).
                    Style Heading with Field next to Width and Length.
                    Board Code with Field next to Width and Length.
                    Number of Cells (Panels,  Inside Cell and Outside Cell Field next to Width and Length. 
                    Forms?  1  This will create two parts with either one form or two forms.
                    The Set Length will add a new blank (Long Partition) with the Length from the Set Length and the 
                    Width from the Set Height.
                    The Set Width will build a Short Partition with the Length from the Set Width and the Width from 
                    the Set Height.
                    The Style File will have the number of Cells (ASI Calls this Panels).
                    So if the Set length is 12 inches and Total Cells is 4 then system will calculate each cell (Pane
                    l) as 3, 3, 3, 3.   (Please note, number of + Signs +1 will be default Total Number of Cells.
                    The first and last cells (Panels) are called the Outside Cell (New Database Field).
                    All the other cells are called Inside Cells, (New Database Field)
                    Estimator may change the Number of Cells, Outside Cell or Inside Cell.
                    For example, Outside may be 2, and inside would be 4.  Thus the panels will be 2,4,4,2 on the SPE
                    C Folder for the Blank Length for the LONG Partition.
                    Estimator can change panels as needed on the SPEC folder of the estimate.

                    Character Value = Blank   (No Changes to Existing Logic.

                    Corruguated estimates when pressing CACULATE button, the option to APPEND or PURGE buttons displa
                    y.  APPEND will retain the existing calculations that appear on the PRINT tab.
                    The PURGE option will delete the existing calculations and display only the newly calculated quan
                    tities.  When Character Value = Prompt on Purge, the program will display popup message:
                    Warning, all existing calculated quantiites will be deleted.   OK  or CANCEL.

                    CANCEL will Abort procudure.

                    This is a WARNING prompt Only.

                    SET Totals Section of the Print Out.

                    This must also calculate when changing the Sell Price/M
                    This must also calcualte when changing the Gross Margin %
                    This must also calcualte when changing the Net Margin%.

E-F- -   03121319 E Layer Pads Field to Calculate per Pallet
                    ASI estimate 8294 and 8290 both have the item Layer Pad.
                    Existing Logic on Inks/Pack folder of Estimate
                               A)   Allows defining number of layer pads per carton.
                               B)   Allows defining number of case dividers per carton.
                    This does ot define layer pads per pallet.
                    Prystup needs to calculate Pads and Divider per Pallet
                    
                    MOD Required
                    1)  Change Label Qty to Qty Per
                    2)  New 1 Character Database Field under Qty Per next to Qty  
                          Valid Options are C for Case or P for Pallet.
                    When new Field is a P for Pallet.
                    The finished goods item does not use corrugated cartons, the layer pad and/or divider,
                    (material types = 5 & 6 in the raw materials file).  The estimator will defined the number of lay
                    er pads per pallet.  
                    For Example, The Qty were 5 per Pallet.
                    The Estimate Qty / Pallet Count times Pads per Pallet is the Total Number of Pads.
                    Same Logic for Dividers
                    The Estimate Qty / Pallet Count times Dividers per Pallet is the Total Number of Pads.
                    Qty x Cost = Total Cost
                    
                    All Estimate Printouts must be Modified.
E-F- -   03221102 E New N-K CEPREPPRICE Mark up on Prep charges causes est problems. Needs
                    I am trying something new and I am looking at how we charge for plates and form charges.  Right n
                    ow, we have the prep charges going in as a cost with no markup.  This isn't really accurate as th
                    e cost we have in here includes contribution and is not reflected in the gross margin when viewin
                    g the ?what if? screen.  So I wanted to see what the margins would do if we put in the cost with 
                    a markup and I get a problem.  See screen shots below and associate .pdf?s of estimates.  I have 
                    also included a screen shot of a prep file.
                    
                    ESP: Problem is he set markup at 100%.  Formula being used is prep cost/ (1 - markup% / 100) whic
                    h is dividing by 0 which is invalid.
                    
                    New N-K-1 parameter CEPREPPRICE.  Char value = Profit will use formula stated above.  Char value 
                    = Cost Markup will have the following formula (Cost * markup %) + Cost.  Applies to prep charges 
                    and miscellaneous charges (-mkup).

E-F- -   03311006 E ADD TANDEM Button to Auto Calculate Plate and Fountain Changes
                    All the items housed in the master estimate will have identical die number, style, length, width 
                    and depth dimensions.  Essentially, the only difference is the print copy of each box. 
                    The master estimate will have the unique inks for each item as well as normal machine routing and
                     sell price.   
                    
                    To Duplicate Mod
                    Add new order and click the ADD TANDEM button on the View Order.
                    Type Customer HER1000 and type estimate 2512.
                    Select Vanilla, Chocolate and Strawberry.  This will create a new estimate, order and job.
                    The Printing Press will Import the MR and Run Speeds.
                    However, the Plate Change and Fountain Changes for Forms 2 to 99 are zero.
                    Calculate the number of Plate Changes only equal to the number of INKS on the INK Folder.
                    Do not compare the ink codes from one from to the next form.
                    
                    Please note, when adding a new item to an order, the new item is added to the estimate defined on
                     the order.  When the routing is added for this item the plate changes must also be added to the 
                    new item and the standards rebuilt to recalc the cost.
                    
                    Even if INK CODE is identical, the plate may still need to be changed.
                    
                    
E-F- -   04071109 E New N-K CEPREPPRICE Mark up on Prep charges causes est problems. Needs
                    I am trying something new and I am looking at how we charge for plates and form charges.  Right n
                    ow, we have the prep charges going in as a cost with no markup.  This isn't really accurate as th
                    e cost we have in here includes contribution and is not reflected in the gross margin when viewin
                    g the 'what if? screen.  So I wanted to see what the margins would do if we put in the cost with 
                    a markup and I get a problem.  See screen shots below and associate .pdf?s of estimates.  I have 
                    also included a screen shot of a prep file.
                    
                    ESP: Problem is he set markup at 100%.  Formula being used is prep cost/ (1 - markup% / 100) whic
                    h is dividing by 0 which is invalid.
                    
                    N-K-1 parameter CEPREPPRICE.  
                    
                    Char value = Profit will use formula being used is prep cost/ (1 - markup% / 100) 
                    In other words, this calculates a true profit based on cost.
                    For example, a Cost of $90 with a 10% markup will equal $100 Sell Price.
                    
                    Char value = Cost Markup will have the following formula (Cost * markup %) + Cost.  
                    In other words, this is a markup over cost. 
                    For example, a Cost of $90 with a 10% markup will equal $99 Sell Price.
                    
                    
                    
                    
E-F- -   07031403 E C Flute Shrink% / Take Up % on Estimate Layout Tab / BOM Button
                    Folding Estimates = Layout Tab = BOM Button.
                    See Attached.
                    Add new FLUTE = C  to change the logic to calculate the Medium Length.
                    C Flute will use a Takeup Factor of 1.4507 which is multiplied by the Sheet Length.
                    
                    The middle / medium board is Board Length x 1.4507.

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    Set has 1 200B RSC, 3 Length Partitions of 200C and 5 Width Partitions of ECT32.
                    If 200B increased 8%, 200C 9% and ECT32 10%.
                    Normally, price increase is done 1 time for perhaps by 9.5%.
                    So if quote was $500 per 1000 the New Price is $546 
                    However, if the Global price is done 3 times for 8%,9% & 10%, the Quote increases 27%
                    If you run this 3 times.  Sell Price is $663.58    $546 vs $663 is the Issue
                    User should not Run Multiple Times on Same Estimate.
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
E-G- -   10171203 E Global Price change by Unit of Measure  (Shared Mod)
                    Rounding to the BUCK for sell prices defined per Each results in undesired results.
                    For example, round any sell price from .01 to .90 will result in new Sell Price of $1.00.
                    Thus rounding up to next dollar should not be used.
                    
                    New Toggle Box so both updates will occur simultaneously.
                    Round UOM = EA .
                    Round Up to ____ Penny     __X__ Dime   ______ Buck
                    
                    Existing Toggle will be used for all other Unit of Measures
                    Round UOM = M, LOT, CASE, MSF
                    Round Up to ____ Penny     _____ Dime   ____X__ Buck
                    
                    For Example, the current Logic when Rounding by Dollar
                    The Rounding Method will round up to the nearest Penny, Dime or Buck.
                    10% increase on $255 /M, round to PENNY, new sell price would =$280.50
                    10% increase on $255 /M, round to DIME, new sell price would = $280.50 
                    10% increase on $255 /M, round to BUCK, new sell price would = $281.00
                    10% increase on .255 EA, round to PENNY, new sell price would =.2805 = $.29
                    10% increase on .255 EA, round to DIME, new sell price would = $.30   
                    The Above are perfect.
                    However,
                    10% increase on .255 EA, round to BUCK, new sell price would = $1.00
                    
                    
E-G- -   10241202 E Global Price Change - new radio option - no rounding
                    New option added to "Round To" radio buttons = "No Rounding".
                    New prices will retain all decimal places after the price change % is applied.  
                    For example, an old price of 0.12 with a 10% increase will result in a new price of 0.132 and wil
                    l not be rounded.
                    
                    Existing rounding should remain the same:
                    To the penny would be 0.14
                    To the dime would be 0.20
                    To the buck would be 1.00

E-Q- -   04271202 E N-K QUOPRINT = LoyLangBSF  (Copy LoyLang)
                    N-K-QuoPrint = LoyLangBSF  (This is a Quote Form Change Only)
                    This will be added to the View Form by unique customer.
                    When Customer is on View Form and character value = LoyLangBSF and 
                    Finished Goods Product Category = PADS THEN.
                    The Sell Price and UOM on the Quote will be replaced by Sell Price and UOM per BSF
                    BSF = Blank Square Feet.
                    
                    Price per Board Square Foot is calculated as
                    Selling Price / Blank Square Feet. Blank SF = 4.401   (Spec Folder Blank Square Feet)
                    This is found in the Spec Folder for quotes and I-F-1 Totals Folder for invoicing.
                    
                    Quote File will house the price per each.  The Quote form Form will print the Sell Price per BSF 
                    in place of the Selling Price on the Quote Form.  Only EA and M will be Converted to BSF.
                    Sell Price per BSF = Items Sell Price /divided by Blank Square Feet.   
                    
                    Sell Price per M = 
                    ((Sell Price Ea x Qty / (Qty/1000)  / Blank Square Ft)
                    
                    For Example: 
                    Sell Price of $1354.14 / 4.401 = $307.69 
                    Sell Price of $1.35414 x 5000 / (5000/1000) / 4.401 = $307.97

                    rrun / under run of up to 10%. Order quantities of 20,000 and below are

E-Q- -   06181201 E Quote File Price Matrix Update -  New Toggle Box
                    Quote File   "Update Price Matrix" Button.    
                    See attachment for sample.
                    Two New Toggle Boxes:   Transfer Quote Qty  ___      Transfer Quote Qty minus 1  ___  
                    Current Logic transfers exact Quantity.   Transfer Quote Qty  ___
                    For example    Quote quantities are 
                    $2.00   for Qty   300          is transferred as $2.00   for 300 to price matrix
                    $1.75   for Qty   500          is transferred as $1.75   for 500 to price matrix
                    $1.50   for Qty   1000        is transferred as $1.50   for 1000 to price matrix
                    $1.25   for Qty   5000        is transferred as $1.25   for 5000 to price matrix
                    Plus  $1.25 for      999999  is created. 
                    
                    New Toggle Transfer Quote Qty minus 1 would work as follows:
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page:  60

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    $2.00   for Qty   300   is transferred as $  0.00 as Qty  = 299 to price matrix
                    $2.00   for Qty   300   is transferred as $  2.00 as Qty  = 499 to price matrix
                    $1.75   for Qty   500   is transferred as $  1.75 as Qty  = 999 to price matrix
                    $1.50   for Qty   1000 is transferred as $  1.50 as Qty  = 4999 to price matrix
                    $1.25   for Qty   5000 is transferred as $  1.25 as Qty  = 9999999 to price matrix
                    
                    This makes the order entry import the sell price up to the next quantity break less 1 box.
                    If they order less than 300 the sell price = ZERO

E-Q- -   10011408 E Update Quote Prep Charges on Misc Tab to update Estimate Prep Tab
                    The Order pulls the MISC cost, quantity, sell price etc from the Estimates PREP Tab.
                    If the quote MISC tab is changed,
                    Then the Quote cost and price does not match the Estimate.
                    Since the Order imports the Estimate data there is a mismatch.
                    
                    ASI Solution.
                    Quote Misc SAVE button 
                    Search for matching S/B and Prep Code.
                    If estimate matches the Quotes S/B and Prep Code,
                    then SAVE button will write the Cost, Markup, Sell Price and Amotization back to Estimate Prep
                    fields.

G-F-2-   09171402 E Utility to change one level of an account number to differnt number.
                    util/FindReplaceAccNum.r
                    After copying over general ledger account numbers from one company into a new company, they want 
                    the abiltiy to run a utility that would allow them to change the beginning 2 digits of each accou
                    nt number in GF2 from whatever it is to another number.  For example: if their account number is 
                    01-2011-000 and ALL their account numbers start with 01, they want the utility to change all the 
                    01 beginning account level to 03.
                    
                    Utility should company specific  and first check to see if any data has been posted to any of the
                     account numbers.  If so a message should appear that utility cannot be run.  DO NOT run if that 
                    is the case.

                    For example A-U-4 already has this logic.

                    P:\ASI10Test\Rco1010\Audit 001\AUDIT TRAILS

                    rive folder defined under the character value when posting = Yes.

                    This is ONLY Save to Disk when the user clicks YES to Post !

H-R-1-6  08221103 E How to add a new menu item
                    Added H-R-16 report to menu items  16 Sales Comparison/Sales Rep
                    
                    1)  Open up all three menu items in dev
                          This is how the program name will be linked to the menu items.
                          a)  P:\pco1010\
                                1)  menu.lst
                                2)  menu.fol
                                3)  menu.cor
                    
                    2)  Open ASI, and decide where you are entering the new menu item.  
                         For example the last menu item entered under sales (H-R-15) was sales by period.  
                         So enter this new report under H-R-16 
                    
                    3)  Add the file name to all three menu items
                    
                    4)  Go to system program master in ASI, and add the new program name, title and directory.
                    
                    5)  Dump program master in help desk

                          The user will type in valid Sales Reps from the A-F-3 File.
                           F1 lookup will show valid Sales Reps.
                           Each Sales Rep ID will be separated by a Comma.

                          The Report will only show the Sales Reps listed on the Popup List.

                    The Report can default to the entire list of Reps.
                    Run the Report fo the Entire List of Reps.
                    Then Remove the Line Item for the Reps not listed on the POPUP List.

I- - -   06011007 E Help Leo of Metro on his Crystal Reports
                    Andres,
                    Here are the remaining problems that need to be worked out:
                    
                    846 Inventory Inquiry Report
                    ?	WIP Quantity ? We need to supply a daily WIP total in this report. Currently we are using a for
                    mula that subtracts Qty on Hand from Order Qty but this number is not correct. Perhaps the ?Produ
                    ction Balance? total (from the Browse Order screen) would work here?
                    ?	Inventory InFlow ? This is basically a daily total of FG Receipts (finished goods received into
                     inventory for the current day)
                    ?	Inventory OutFlow ? Daily total of FG Shipments
                    
                    850 Purchase Order Report
                    ?	Show Active PO #s Only -- The only problem on this report is that we should only be showing pur
                    chase orders that are still active, i.e., that we are still shipping on. We do not want to displa
                    y POs that have been fulfilled.
                    
                    852 Product Activity Data Report
                    ?	?Planned Quantity? Total ? We need to show the quantity remaining to be produced on a given ord
                    er. (Would the ?Production Balance? total work here, as well, I wonder?)
                    
                    856 Ship Notice/Manifest Report
                    ?	Show Active PO #s Only ? See above.
                    ?	Shipment Qty ? We need to show quantity of FG shipped for the current date only, same as Invent
                    ory OutFlow above.
                    ?	Shipment Date ? Shipment date. (Should only display if there has been a shipment on today?s dat
                    e.)
                    
                    (Just a reminder: All of these reports are daily reports so they are meant to show only transacti
                    ons for the current day the report is run.)
                    That?s it. Once you have a plan let me know when we can work together and I will email you a link
                     to connect.
                    Thanks, Andres!
                    Leo

I- - -   07071105 E N-K FGHistoryDate (Default date on Finished Goods History)
                    N-K FGHistoryDate (Default date on Finished Goods History)
                    
                    Logical Value = Yes will use the Date Value field as a default date.
                    Logical Value = No will not use the Date Value field as a default date.
                    
                    Date Value =  Default date on Finished Goods History.  If the date of 01/01/2011 is entered, then
                     the date in the Finished Goods File (I-F-1)  History Folder will default to this date.
                    When user clicks HISTORY folder, the program will load this date then display only transactions f
                    rom that date and newer.    
                    These dates are found under I- F- 1 "History" tab and I - Q - 1

I-F-1-   01191320 E RECALC COST button enhance to have N-Y-12 Logic
                    Premier creates new FG item almost every day.
                    Until FG Receipts are created, the Cost is Zero in the View Item File.
                    Orders added for this item will import cost from VIEW cost which is ZERO.
                    Other times the cost is wrong or left blank when the receipt is added.
                    
                    The RECALC COST button recalculates the cost on the VIEW Tab based on the cost of each Job or Pur
                    chase Order that are on Hand in the Bins / Jobs Folder.
                    Howeve, if the Costs are bad in the Bins/Jobs Folder, Recalc does not fix the Problem.
                    The N-Y-12 Utility moves the Costs from the HISTORY folder to the BIns/Jobs Folder.
                    Then the ReCalc Cost button must be RUN.
                    
                    Rick Rightor does not have access to the N-Y-12 program.
                    Fixing FG items with Bad Costs is a two step Process.
                    Run N-Y-12
                    Then find Item and Press ReCalc Button.
                    
                    
                    Moving N-Y-12 to ReCalc button provides a ONE STEP fix to resolve Cost issues.

I-F-1-   04071405 E New Toggle Box on  Bins/Jobs Tab called "Show Bins with Qty = 0
                    New toggle Box.  Show Bins if Qty = 0.  This will default to Not Display.
                    
                    All customers should run N-F-10 and Recalc Button and NOT Delete Zero Qty Bins.
                    However, the new Toggle Box will default to UnChecked.
                    This will HIDE the Bins with ZERO on Hand.
                    Except, OPEN Jobs.  They will still Display.
                    
                    Reason for new Toggle Box.
                    The calculated Bins table is needed to put the proper cost on reports.
                    This table is also needed to transfer costs to a posted invoice.
                    For example, 
                    A csutomer receives and shipped a product such as ATT-2297 for Job 205938
                    The Tags are received and shipped and show zero on Hand.
                    If the Recalc Qtyt is run and the DELETE zero Qty Bins is Run. the Tags are Removed.
                    When Customers runs  I-R-2 for a date after the Receeipt but Before the Shipment.
                    The Bin/Tags would appear o the Report.
                    The Problem is the Cost cannot be found in the Bins Table.
                    Then the Program imports the Average Cost form the VIEW Table which is Wrong.
                    Keeping the Bins Table Open will Ensure the Cost is Correct on IR2 and other Programs.

                    Thus Open Jobs with Zero on Hand will import new Orders.

                    5)  Plate Number  (Find field on I-F-1, View Item Folder)

                    7)  Sheet Size

                    To find Number Up, Sheet Size and Board Caliper.

                    Up to 80  characters, System would allow all existing Output Options but default to Portrait.

I-P-T-A  10161305 E New IPAD Signed BOL App - Data File Generation with Tester
                    ASI to Download BOL data for use by truck driver using IPAD.
                    New Ipad App with Signature will allow scanning and signing BOL.
                    The Truck Driver will present ASI Bill of Lading with Bar Coded BOL#.
                    Driver will Scan BOL# the 
                    Present Ipad for Customer to Sign on Drews Signature App.
                    ASI will then reassemble the ASI Bill of Lading and Combine the Signature.
                    The combined BOL with Signature will display when Printing or Emailing.
                    
                    Apple Ipad Signature upon Truck Delivery to Auto Generated Signed BOL
                    Apple Ipad App for Signature on Bill of Lading.
                    This will only capture the signature.
                    ASI programming will then merge the signature with the printed Bill of Lading Form.
                    The requires placing the Signature in the Space Alotted on the Bill of Lading Form.
                    Each Form must be programmed separately.
                    Once merging the signature with the printed Bill of Lading.
                    Program will Save the file under the N-K-1 BOLSIGN  folder.
                    The Folder is listed on the Description Field.
                    
                    Once this is Done.
                    Batch emailing Invoices can attach the signed bill of lading via the IPAD Signature App.
                    Batch Emailing Logic is Task# 01191317.

I-R-1-   10021210 E ReOrder Advice by Warehouse ($20,000)  Must Run util/crtfgloc.r
                    REORDER ADVISE REPORT BY WAREHOUSE  and Database Changes by Warehouse- 
                    New Toggle Box   ___ ReOrder Level by Whse     This will be the new Report as Follows:
                    Premier has 15 locations and the same FG Items that are stocked in all 15 locations.  Shipment vo
                    lume are unique by location.   For example, Louisville may ship 50,000 12x12x12 boxes per month s
                    o may have Reorder Level of 10,000, whereas Tennesee may only ship 10,000 per month so may have R
                    eorder Level of 2,000.   Existing INVENTORY folder only has one Reorder level, one Minimum Qty, o
                    ne One Hand Balance, One On Order, One Allocated and One Qty Available, etc..   New database tabl
                    e will house reOrder levels and balances by warehouse.  Every program that updates on order, on h
                    and, allocated and available must be changed to also update the new Warehouse Table. 
                    1)  Add Shipto Warehouse  to O-U-1 Release Folder, which will import from A-F-1 Shipto File Wareh
                    ouse.   
                    2) Adding, changing and deleting item in O-U-1 ITEM folder now updates QTY ALLOCATED field in I-F
                    -1 INVENTORY.  Add, Change, Delete buttons on O-U-1 Releases will update Quantity Allocated by Wa
                    rehouse based on Scheduled Quantity.
                    3) Posting finished goods receipts, transfers and adjustments will update new Whse Table.
                    4) Purchase Orders for Finished Goods must update On Order by new I-F-1 Whse Table.  
                        PO for Drop Shippments to Customer Ship TO will house the WHSE Location to Update.
                    5) Bill of lading POST program currently reduces the I-F-1 INVENTORY folder but must  also       
                         reduce the On Hand Quanity of the new Warehouse Table based on Whs and Bin on O-S1.  However
                    , this must also reduce the Quantity Allocated by Warehouse based on the O-U-1 Release Tab as thi
                    s was the warehouse originally Allocated.
                    6) The warehouse location must be added to the Vendor File for FG Receipts by PO .
                    7) Finally, Copy I-R-1 and create new Reorder vice report by Warehouse to show items below     th
                    e Reorder Level just for that warehouse.  For examaple if Louisville Whse is below 10000,     ite
                    m 12x12x12 will print on the report when Sorting by Louisville.   Likewise, if Tennesee is     be
                    low 2000, then item 12x12x12 will print on the Reorder Report when sorting by Tennessee.

                    Both Reports will have new options   (See Attached)
                    1  Print Column Heading Rep as 1st field of every line on report
                    2. Print Customer Name as 2nd field of every line on report
                    3, Days Old Column will print Column Heading in two Lines to Save Space for REP
                         Days
                         Old
                    4. Print  Sales Rep SubTotals _____    NO will not print Salesperson subtotals
                    5. Print Grand Totals  ______   Yes will print Grand Totals Value Only at Bottom.
                         Every Age Column will Print the Value Only.
                         Every Column as Value will Show Percentage under each Column
                         Grand total line2 prints ratio of each aging column vs grand selling value as a %
                    
                    User ID = ZZZ  will login, run IR12 and set all standard Report Options.
                    All Other Users that Select STANDARD Report will see ZZZ Report Options, However
                    They will not be able to Update the following IR12 toggles:
                    1. Beginning Customer#    Ending Customer#.     Standard Default wll be _____ To zzzzzzzz

                    zzzzz

                    zzzzz

I-R-1-2  11171001 E Add the customer part#, items and also last sale date to the I-R-12 re
                    Customer would like the option to add the customer part # from IF1 View Item tab to the report.
                    Report must sort first by customer (after sorting by sales rep which it already does)
                    Add radio set for second sort, by item # or customer part #.
                    
                    Add toggle box to add item's last ship date to the report.  
                    The item's last ship date will come from the finished good item's most recent shipment.  
                    Look at IF1 history tab, most recent transaction "S".  
                    FIND LAST fg-rcpth NO-LOCK
                                   WHERE fg-rcpth.company   EQ cocode
                                     AND fg-rcpth.i-no      EQ itemfg.i-no
                                     AND fg-rcpth.rita-code EQ "S" NO-ERROR.  fg-rcpth.trans-date is ship date.

I-U-1-   01191318 E N-K FGRecptPassWord Security Password - Add Receipt without Job# or PO
                    N-K-1 FGRecptPassWord
                    Password for override of requirement to enter a job # or PO# in I-U-1
                    
                    N-K-1 FGRecpt 
                    Logical value = NO does not validate PO# or Job# on the I-U-1 Receipt Screen.
                    Logical value = YES forces a PO# or Job# on the I-U-1 Receipt Screen.
                    Premier wants to set this flag to YES.
                    However, there are exceptions when they do not want to require either Job# or PO#.
                    
                    New NK1 FGRecptPassWord
                    New Logic to Prompt for Password to all adding FG Receipt without PO# or Job#
                    Logical Value = Yes will prompt for Password when N-K-1 FGRecpt Logical value = Yes.
                    Character Value = Password.
                    
                    If User adds Receipt without Job# or Password, program will prompt for Password.
                    Record will not be added unless Valid Password is entered.
I-U-1-   02111402 E N-K FGSetAssembly  Logic for Assembled Set Components
                    N-K-1 FGSetAssembly =  New Assembled Set Receipt Logic.  Menu Keys I-F-1 Finished Goods File:  To
                    ggle Box Set Header?  and Assembled?  are both Checked.
                    Reason for the Business Logic.  Components are produced at Plant A then Transferred to Plant B fo
                    r assembly.  Pallet Tags are stored in various bin locations in Plant B.   Pallet Tags must be tr
                    ansferred to the Plant Floor Bin called Assembly.   Only the tags transferred to Assembly should 
                    be subtracted from On hand when the Set Receipts are Received On Hand.
                    
                    Character Value = ASSEMBLY  is the Bin Location of all Set Components that are consummed and Disp
                    layed on the FG Receipts SET PARTS Tab.  For each Warehouse that assembles SETS and use the N-K-1
                     FGSetAssembly logoc must have a bin location called ASSEMBLY.   This will be the bin location th
                    at set components are consummed when receiving Sets.
                    
                    Logical Value = No will use existing Logic that pulls random inventory.
                    Logical Value = YES will turn on this new logic for Adding receipts for assembled sets.
                    Both O-U-7 Loadtag creation and  I-U-1 Set Receipts will Recieve the Set to the warehouse and bin
                     location based on existing logic.   However, the Components Warehouse will default to the Sets W
                    arehouse.   But, the components Bin Location will first search on hand Pallet Tags from the Bin L
                    ocation called ASSEMBLY.   If there is insufficent component inventory in the Assembly Bin Locati
                    on, the program will import existing bin Locations.     However, I-U-5 Inventory Posting will not
                     post set receipts or components unless all components have the Assembly Bin locations.  The I-U-
                    5 Posting report will show the message,  "Component Assembly Bin Location is Required"  and they 
                    will not Post until Componetns Bin = Assembly.
