I-U-1-   05131401 E Set Parts Tab  - Receiving Screens - Add Select Bins/Tags Button
                    Selecting the appropriate bins/tags from which to relieve component inventory when receiving a se
                    t header is a time consuming process.   This modification will create a "Select Bins/Tags" button
                    , similar to the function that is available in OS1 and OT1.
                    
                    Component bins will be automatically selected when a set header is received in I-U-1.  The N-K-1 
                    FGSETASSEMBLY logic will pull from bin locations specified in the character value of this NK1 whi
                    ch may be used to pull component from a staging area location called ASSEMBLY.  This mod would be
                     in addition to the automatic bin selection process and will allow the user to change component b
                    in/tag locations quickly and easily.
                    
                    When the user selects one of the lines in the Set Parts tab and hits the Select Bin/Tags button, 
                    a multi-select browse window will pop-up, listing all on-hand bins for the selected component ite
                    m.  The window should have a running tally of the total qty selected next to the total qty needed
                    .  All validation that exists in the OS1 "Select Bin/Tags" button should apply to this new button
                    .
                    
                    Note:  This button should only apply to Assembled Sets.  Furthermore, for Assembled with Parts re
                    ceipts, only purchased components should allow this selection, since manufactured items have a "w
                    ash" transaction of receipt and reduction in inventory.
I-U-1-   06151208 E N-K FGPOTAG# to Automatically Assign Tag#
                    N-K FGPOTAG# to Automatically Assign Tag#
                    Parameter for I-U-1 Finished Goods Receipts for Purchase Orders.
                    Copy logic for assigning the Tag# from O-U-7 when checking the Toggle Box "Purchased Item Receipt
                    " then Creating the Load Tag.
                    
                    Logical Value = NO  will not assign a Tag number to the I-U-1 Receipt.
                    Logical Value = YES will assign a Tag number  to the I-U-1 Receipt.   
                    
                    When manually adding a finished goods receipt with a purchase order number.  
                    Format will the FG Item Code for total of 15 characters plus Sequential Number exactly like O-U-7
                     creates Tags for PO's.
                    
                    For example, add receipt for PO 101658 via O-U-7 and check the toggle box on the top right called
                     "Purchased Item Receipt".   This  will create the tag number 10X10X10       00157.  The program 
                    will assign a unique tag number for each receipt transaction line rather than by the pallet.  Fir
                    st 15 characters will be FG Item code with spaces.  Next 5 numbers will a sequential number.

I-U-1-   08091107 E N-K RFIDTAG   To Import RFID Receipt from 3rd Party Vendor File
                    New N-K-1 RFIDTAG parameter.
                    REALVIEW is the product that tracks the RFID monitor and generates the text files my program proc
                    esses.  
                    ***************** Create desktop icon *******************
                    Target:  C:\Progress\OpenEdge\bin\prowin32.exe -pf .\nosweat.pf -basekey INI -ininame .\progress.
                    ini  -p ./rfid/desktop.p
                    Start In:  p:\asi10test\rco1010
                    *************************************************************
                    Logical Value = YES will be used to turn logic on to search for RFID tag.
                    Character Value Field = House the Location of the Text File to Import.
                    
                    Load Tag creation will create a finished goods load tags which will have a new field called RFID 
                    Tag.  AS I Task# 11221003 is required to modify Load Tag program to create a unique 12 digit RFID
                     tag#.   This will then provide a new RFID Tag# as a cross reference to our internal bar coded ID
                     code.  The ASI internal bar code number is the index to the Loadtag file.
                    The ASI Loadtag file has all the necessary data including Finished Goods Item Code, Job#, Order#,
                     Customer code, PO#, Item Name, Item Description, Number of Units, Quantity per Unit, Cases per P
                    allet, etc.   The 3rd Party Software by Miles Technology will create a text file that includes th
                    e transaction type, RFID number, warehouse and location.  (See Attached)
                    This text file will have a transaction type of R for Receipt and T for Transfer.
                    This will be assigned based on the zone that RFID Reader is located. 
                    A new ASI program will be written to load finished goods receipt records from a text file downloa
                    ded by the RFID Scanner / Software.
                    
                    This text file will be read automatically when a new record is added.
                    If the transaction is a RECEIPT, this record will be written into the Advantzware I-U-1 menu scre
                    en, then simultaneously posted.  
                    Automatic posting programs exist via the O-U-7 in conjunction with N-K-1 SSPOSTFG logic.

I-U-1-   09241301 E Default date for new receipt to the receipt date of last added receipt
                    Default the Date to the Date of the last Sequence Numbered Receipt.
                    If no other unposted receipt transactions exist, the current date will appear when pressing the A
                    DD Button.     If an unposted receipt record exists the date of the last receipt added will be th
                    e date of the new transaction when the ADD button is pressed.
                    For example,  on January 3rd, transactions may need to be added for December 31.
                    User adds a receipt and date defaults to January 3, but this is changed to December 31.
                    ADD button of all new transactions will default to December 31. 
                    
I-U-1-   10101406 E N-K FGSetAssembly  -  Limit to only ASSEMBLY bins
                    N-K-1 FGSetAssembly Logical = YES.
                    This mod will change the logic used to select component bins when receiving an assembled set head
                    er in I-U-1, SharpShooter, and OU7 (when Set Header receipts are automatically created - NOTE: Pr
                    emier does not activate this option).
                    
                    When FGSetAssembly is YES, *ONLY* components that are in the specified assembly bin (FGSetAssembl
                    y char value) and in a warehouse that matches the warehouse of the set header receipt should be c
                    onsidered on-hand for the purposes of relieving component inventory.  No other bin locations shou
                    ld ever appear on the Set Parts tab in IU1 or SS.
                    
                    Additionally, upon receiving and saving a set header today, a pop-up will launch, warning the use
                    r that there is insufficient component inventory.
                    This exists today, however a new improved pop-up will display each component showing:
                    Component ID, Component Name, Qty/Set, Required Qty, Qty On-hand
                    Components with insufficient inventory will be highlighted in yellow.
                    
                    When FGSetAssembly is YES, there will be NO option to create a set header receipt for a qty less 
                    than what is being originally received.  Hitting OK on the message will simply NOT save the recei
                    pt line and return the user back to the receipt application, ready to add (IU1) or scan (SS) the 
                    next receipt.

I-U-1-   12131305 E Update J-U-1 FARM Tab via Finished Goods Receipts for PO with Job
                    FG Receipts with Vendor PO will also transfer the JOB# from the PO Line.
                    Posting FG Receipts will Update FARM Tab on the Job File
                    Test Job 207197 for Estimate 11524 which has 1 Farmed Item and 2 Manufactured.
                    Posting FG Receipts The New Farm Tab will have the Following Fields
                    
                    Total Actual Cost,   (Total Receipts for Job#  Cost EA )
                    Actual Cost/M          (Calculated as Total Cost / 1000) 
                    Please note, Receipts can occur over multiple days so the Total Cost will constantly change.
                    A separate Table will list all the Receipts for the FARM Item.

I-U-2-   08191107 E N-K RFIDTAG   To Import RFID Transfer from 3rd Party Vendor File
                    New N-K-1 RFIDTAG parameter.
                    REALVIEW is the product that tracks the RFID monitor and generates the text files my program proc
                    esses.  
                    ***************** Create desktop icon *******************
                    Target:  C:\Progress\OpenEdge\bin\prowin32.exe -pf .\nosweat.pf -basekey INI -ininame .\progress.
                    ini  -p ./rfid/desktop.p
                    
                    Start In:  p:\asi10test\rco1010
                    *************************************************************
                    Logical Value = YES will be used to turn logic on to search for RFID tag.
                    Character Value Field = House the Location of the Text File to Import.
                    Load Tag creation will create a finished goods load tags which will have a new field called RFID 
                    Tag.  AS I Task# 11221003 is required to modify Load Tag program to create a unique 24 digit RFID
                     tag#.   This will then provide a new RFID Tag# as a cross reference to our internal bar coded ID
                     code.  The ASI internal bar code number is the index to the Loadtag file.
                    The ASI Loadtag file has all the necessary data including Finished Goods Item Code, Job#, Order#,
                     Customer code, PO#, Item Name, Item Description, Number of Units, Quantity per Unit, Cases per P
                    allet, etc.   The 3rd Party Software by Miles Technology will create a text file that includes th
                    e transaction type, RFID number, warehouse and location.  (See Attached)
                    This text file will have a transaction type of R for Receipt and T for Transfer.
                    This will be assigned based on the zone that RFID Reader is located. 
                    
                    A new ASI program will be written to load finished goods TRANSFERS records from a text file downl
                    oaded by the RFID Scanner / Software.   This text file will be read automatically when a new reco
                    rd is added.  If the transaction is a TRANSFER, this record will be written into the Advantzware 
                    I-U-2 screen.   This text file will need RFID Tag#, From Warehouse, From Bin Location, TO Warehou
                    se, TO Bin Location.   Once transaction is import into I-U-2 transfers screen, then simultaneousl
                    y posted.    N-K-1 FGRecept character value = LOADTAG automatically creates FG Receipt.  Automati
                    c posting programs exist in O-U-7 via N-K-1 SSPOSTFG char value = Loadtag and logical Value = YES
                    .

I-U-5-   07221401 E FGPostUID.  New Security for User ID on Posting
                    See Attached
                    New Security called FGPostUserID.r
                    This will secure the User Id on the I-U-5  Finished Goods Posting Program.
                    When pressing I-U-5, the new security program will be automatically created.
                    The Default User ID will be an asterik *
                    
                    If the User ID is listed on the security program then that user may change the User ID on the fin
                    ished goods posting program.
                    If the user ID is not defined in the new security program then the USER ID cannot be updated.
                    Currently, when pressing I-U-5, the User ID defaults.
                    That logic will continue, however, they cannot change the user id.
                    The net result is that they will not be able to change the user id and post another users transac
                    tions.
I-U-5-   10181211 E N-K FGPost Integer Value = 1 Update / Create O-U-1 Release ($20,000 Co
                    Integer Value = 1, then the  I-U-5 Posting Finished Goods for Receipts will update Release Quanti
                    ty when Total Receipt Qty exceed Order Quantity.
                    This new logic will provide visibility to ship and invoice overruns that otherwise will become wa
                    ste and lost revenue.
                    Releases not processed will be overwritten with the Total Receipt Quantity.  
                    Releases that have been processed, then a new release will be created for the Receipt Qty less (O
                    rder Qty-Actual Released).
                    The Order Qty, Produced and Actual Release Qty quantities are displayed on the O-U-1 browser.
                    The following must criteria must exist to update the Release or to Create a New Release
                    1)  Job# exists on the Finished Goods Receipt Screen and
                    2)   Total Receipt Qty for Job# exceeds Order Quantity  
                    3)   Run & Ship Toggle Box = YES 
                    then 
                    If Release Status = "S", "I" or "L" or (A and not Printed) or (B and not Printed then) 
                    Total Finished Goods Quantity will replace the Release Quantity on  O-U-1 and O-T-1.
                    or
                    If Release Status is P, Z or C or (B and Printed) or (A and Printed) then
                    Program will create a new Release on the O-U-1 Release Folder for Total Receipt Qty less Total Re
                    lease Qty.
                    
                    Please note, O-U-1 Produced Qty is total Qty for all Receipts for all Tags for that Job.   
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page:  96

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    For Example. Job Qty = 14,500 and Order Qty = 12,000.  
                    The release will be automatically changed to 14,500.  
                    This will also update the O-T-1 release if the release is not printed.   
                    If the O-T-1 release is printed or if  the  Bill of Lading is created and Printed for 12,000, the
                    n 
                    FG Posting will create a new release. Qty = Total Produced less Actual Release. 
                    Please note this logic will use Actual Shipped Quantity to determine overrun quantity not shipped
                    .  
                    As another example.
                    
                    For example, a run and ship order for 12,000 has a release created for 12,000.  
                    As production stacks 4000 per pallet, a truck driver may be waiting at the dock for the boxes.  
                    Once 3 pallets of 4000 are created, the skids are loaded on the truck and the driver leaves the d
                    ock.  
                    However, the machine then loads another unit of 2,500 boxes that are an overrun are received into
                     inventory.   
                    At this point the system will create a new release for next day.

I-U-5-   11021208 E N-K FGOECOST CharValue = TransferCost  FG Recpt to Update Order Items
                    N-K-1 FGOECOST     Character Value =  Blank will not transfer Receipt Cost 
                    Character Value =   TransferCost
                    This logic is essential for Stock Boxes, Just in Time Items and Purchased Finished Goods to overr
                    ide a zero cost or outdated cost. Normally, when receipts are posted, the cost is posted to the F
                    G history file, bin file and the I-F-1 view screen. Then, when customer service adds an order wit
                    hout an estimate, the system simply imports the cost from the I-F-1 View Item Tab.  This cost may
                     be outdated.  When Character Value = TransferCost, this will transfer/override the Items orders 
                    cost from the FG receipts cost based on the Job Cost or the Purchase Order Cost. This will improv
                    e all backlog and order profit reporting. This will also work for all Sharp Shooter Post Button. 
                    
                    Posting FG Receipts (I-U-5) will transfer the receipt cost to ALL Open Orders for the FG item tha
                    t is Posted 
                    When.   
                    a) If Vendors PO Items Line has BLANK Customer Order number,  
                         Transfer Cost to Open Orders for that Item.
                    b) If Job# has No Order Number,  Transfer Cost to Open orders for that Item..
                    However,
                    c) If Finished Goods File (I-F-1) Full Cost Field > zero, do not Transfer Cost. 
                    d) If Job# has Order Number, Do Not Transfer cost.
                    e) If Vendors PO Line has Order Number - Do Not Transfer cost

J-L-4-   06201207 E New Report Menu = Machines MSF Produced by Job (Copy D-R-14)
                    See Attached:     (May Copy D-R-14 as this has all the fields needed)
                    Add Grand Total Number of Jobs and Total MSF per Machine for Date Range.  
                    PRINT Parameters:   From Job __________    To  Job  ___________
                                                              From Date __________  To Date  ______________
                    
                    Report Columns:  Date, Job#, Machine, Style, Sheet/Blank Size,  MSF Produced.
                    MSF Produced Formula =    Summary by Machine by Job for all Forms.  
                    Waste Qty Plus Run Quantity / 1000 x (LxW / 144)  for each Form 
                    Formulas will use Average of all Forms or Blanks.
                         Roll Fed machines will use Average of All Forms Gross Sheet Width and Length.
                         Sheet Fed machines will use Average of all Froms Net Sheet Width and Length 
                         Blank Fed Machines will use the Blank Width and Blank Length
                    
                    Please note MSF Formula
                       a)  For Blank Fed Machines (Grand Total of all blanks)
                             Formula = (Waste + Run Qty/ 1000 ) x the Blank Square Feet 
                       b)  Sheet Fed Machines Formula (Grand Total of all Forms)
                             Forms Actual Sheets / 1000 x  (Boards Net Widthx Net Sheet Length / 144) 
                       c)  Roll Fed (Grand Total all Forms)
                             If use LF in Run Matrix = NO, then production is entered in Sheets
                    Roll Sheet Formula = Waste + Run Qty /1000  x Gross Sheet W x L / 144 / 144
                             If use LF in Run Matrix = YES then production is entered in Lineal Feet.  When productio
                    n enters lineal feet we must divide by Gross Sheet L to determine number of sheets.
                    Roll Fed LF Formula = (Wasted Sheets + (Run Qty LF / Jobs Board Length)) x Gross Sheet W) / 144,0
                    00

J-L-4-   11141201 E Add Colors as Column on Report
                    This Report Prints by Form by Machine by Day.
                    
                    1) Add new Columns called COLORS.
                        This report is by Job by Machine.
                         There may be many items printed on one job.
                         This will print the total number of inks from the Estimate Inks/Packs Folder for all items.
                          The ESTIMATE tab has the FORM colors for each form.
                           For example,
                           If we made 3 boxes of Vanilla, chocolate and Strawberry on the same sheet.
                           All items may have 5 colors, however the colors may have 4 common colors.
                          If we added colors for each item, this would total 15 and would be incorrect.
                          Therefore, the Estimate Tab shows FORM colors which may show 7 Colors.
                    IF Report Prints by FORM, then Total Colors simply = Form Colors
                    If Report Combines all Forms by Machine, then we must total all colors for all forms.

                    This Report Prints by Form by Machine by Day.
                    This only allows 1 Field for Board.
                    Test with Order/Job 206937
                    
                    1) Add new Column called Form#
                    2) Add new Column called Board.
                        This report is by Job by Machine.
                        There may be many Forms on a Machine Per Job.
                        For Example,
                        If we made 3 boxes of Vanilla, chocolate and Strawberry on Separate Sheets.
                        Vanilla printed on ECT 32 Board
                        Chocolate printed on 200 C Board 
                        Strawberry printed on 200 B Board
                    
                    
                    To Propler Print this Report, We must Add FORM# for Each Job.

J-R-1-5  03180905 E WIP TAG REPORT
                    New Report to pull the data from the J-F-5 WIP File .
                    WIP tag file show multiple RM Tag Numbers.
                    WIP tag file Browse  Folder will show the machine WIP quantity posted to that machine.
                    Since the WIP tag will process through many machines, DB was created as an Array.
                    The Last Machine is the key to WIP reports as to the status of WIP.
                    i.e.  How many sheets have been Sheeted.....Qty  999,999,999
                    i.e.  How many sheets have been Ream Cut.....Qty  999,999,999.
                    i.e.  How many sheets have been Printed.....Qty  999,999,999.
                    i.e.  How many sheets have been Guillotine.....Qty  999,999,999.
                    i.e.  How many sheets have been Die Cut......Qty  999,999,999
                    i.e.  How many sheets have been Hand Stripped.....Qty  999,999,999.
                    i.e.  How many sheets have been Windowed.....Qty  999,999,999.
                    i.e.  How many sheets have been Foil Stamped.....Qty  999,999,999.
                    i.e.  How many sheets have been Glued.....Qty  999,999,999.
                    
                    New WIP tag Report Ranges From Tag 202699000010000001 to Tag 202699000010000009
                    From Job ________to Job zzzzzzzzzzzzz
                    From FG Item ________to FG Item  zzzzzzzzzzzzzz.
                    From Customer  ________To Customer   zzzzzzzzzzzzzz
                    Summary will show  Columns FG Item Code,  RM Tag#,  Last Machine Qty.  
                    Detail will show each Machine and the Quantity of Each machine.

                    sheet length
J-R-3-   01051204 E New Toggle Box called Exclude Prep Materials
                    Estimating Prep Materials are added in E-B-8.
                    Menu N-Z-3 Material Type 7 = Printing Plates       Menu N-Z-3 Material Type 8 = Cutting Die
                    Menu N-Z-3 Material Type O = Die Wood              Menu N-Z-3 Material Type X = Rotary Die
                    Menu N-Z-3 Material Type Y = Flat Die
                    Many times the Prep Materials are Billed Separately, which is indicated by an "S code in the Esti
                    mates PREP/ROUTE folder.   This stands for invoice / separately billed prep.   The S code will mo
                    ve the material to the MISC folder of the order to be invoiced with the first shipment of boxes. 
                      So the invoice includes boxes on one line and the Prep is another invoiced Line.  When billed s
                    eparately, the materials ARE NOT added to the J-R-3 Report.  They would only show on the J-R-3 re
                    port if the toggle box "ADD BILLABLE CHARGES is checked.    This logic all works fine.  
                    
                    THE CUSTOMER PROBLEM.
                    In estimating, on the PREP / ROUTE folder, any code except S will print the materials on the J-R-
                    3 report under the materials section.  The customer DOES NOT invoice prep with the invoice for th
                    e boxes.   They create a separate invoice.  The customer changes the Prep Code from S to N for No
                     Charge which then causes the PREP material to Print on the Report.   The costs are covered by th
                    e invocie so they do not want the PREP materials on the report.

J-R-3-   03131407 E Freight Cost Calculation
                    JR3 report - 
                    Print Corrugated Job 207512
                    Freight Cost in the Totals shows $3,000.
                    The Order Totals shows $145.
                    
                    The Invoice 7311 was shipped on Bill of Lading 7618 Attached.
                    The BOL has 5 units at 1000 per pallet.
                    The Freight Cost on BOL shows $375 which is the Revenue.
                    The Cost must be calculated.
                    The Invoice shows Carrier = TRUCK.
                    The A-F-1 Customer Shipto shows Delivery Zone 100.
                    The A-F-8 file for Truck Zone 100 shows $30 per Pallet.
                    The Bill of Lading has 5 Pallets.
                    
                    Cost = 5 Pallets x $30  = $150
                    However, Minimum Rate = $200 so cost will be $200.
                    JR3 shows $3000.

J-R-3-   08281201 E New Toggle Box called Exclude Std Hrs if WIP = 0
                    ASI Estimate 9846 for Job 205098 has 3 forms.  
                    Each form has approximately 30,000 sheets for each form for each machine.
                    Simkins posts all production to form 1 for all machines.
                    For example, Sheeter (machine SHT1) has 90,000 sheets posted to form 1.
                    Thus forms 2 and 3 have zero production posted.  
                    Obviously, production should be posted to all three machines.  
                    Since its the same machine and same standards, it is more easy for plant to post to form 1.
                    CURRENT LOGIC.
                    Calculates run hours for machine with Production by Standard Hours =  Qty Production in WIP  / J-
                    U-1 Run Speed.  Then Adds Run hours from J-U-1 for machine without Production Quantity.
                    Toggle will not add J-U-1 hours if no production is posted.
                    PROBLEM.
                    J-Q-1 shows correct estimated hours for each form.
                    J-R-3 shows summary of ALL forms for the job.
                    Thus Form 1 has production of 90,000 which is standars hours of 4.5 hours.
                    J-R-3 adds the Run Hours for from 2 and 3 to the J-R-3 report.
                    Same is for MR which is perfect.
                    New Mod / Toggle Box.
                    YES =  will EXCLUDE the run hours for any machine for any form that has ZERO Production.
                    Thus forms 2 & 3 would hours would be excluded from report.
                    NO   =  will be existing logic that will add the J-U-1 Run Hours form machine with Zero Productio
                    n.
                    
                    
J-R-3-   08281206 E New Toggle Box to Calculate Waste
                    ASI Estimate 9846 for Job 205098 has 3 forms.  
                    New toggle Box =  Waste = Board Issued minus  Finished Goods Quantity Posted
                    This is from WIP Act Material
                    Board must multiple number out time number up.
                    
                    If this toggle box is checked.
                    The total actual sheets posted per form x number up x number out = Total Blanks per Form.
                    This is the equivalent of of the Blanks Issued to the Job per Form.
                    The total of all forms minus the finished goods received = Blanks Wasted per Job.
                    This will not show waste per item.
                    This will only show Job Waste.
                    
                    
                    If toggle box is not checked, existing logic will be used which adds waste for each machine.
                    
                    See Job 205234 for Estimate 9919 for RM Item SBS18-20 
                    I issued 4 rolls of 20,000 LF per Roll for a Total of 80,000 LF.
                    Each Sheet under J-U-1 is (38.875/12) = 24,695 shheet x 3 Up = 74,085 Boxes
                    Copy Waste for Board Issued to Job from J-R-8 Board Reconciliation Report
                    This report converts each form issued to job into Blanks.
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
J-R-3-   11051305 E New Toggle Box ___  Use Machine File Crew   **INV**
                    New Toggle Box   ___  Use Machine File Crew
                    This will only be available to select when checking the toggle box, 
                    Calculate Using Current Machine Rates?
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 104

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    
                    When checked this will ignore the crew posted to the data collection via TouchScreen or Advantzwa
                    re Data Collection.  Therefore, if the machine shows crew of 3, but the Touchscreen has a crew of
                     1, the Machines Crew of 3 will be used to calculate the Direct Labor Cost.  
                    The Fixed and Overhead Rates will not be affected.
                    
                    When unchecked this will use the crew size posted from data collection via TouchScreen or Advantz
                    ware Data Collection. Therefore, if the machine shows crew of 3, but the Touchscreen has a crew o
                    f 5, the WIP Crew of 5 will be used to calculate the Direct Labor Cost.  
                    The Fixed and Overhead Rates will not be affected

J-U-1-   01111105 E Job-hdr records missing (f/g items on bottom browser missing)
                    Code to fix so you can then bring up the job and rebuild the job:
                    
                    DISABLE TRIGGERS FOR LOAD of job-hdr.
                    
                    FIND FIRST job where
                               job.company eq "001" and
                               job.job-no eq "  4444" and
                               job.job-no2 eq 0
                               no-lock.
                    
                    CREATE job-hdr.
                    ASSIGN
                        job-hdr.company = "001"
                        job-hdr.j-no = 8888888
                        job-hdr.job     = job.job
                        job-hdr.job-no  = job.job-no
                        job-hdr.job-no2 = job.job-no2
                        job-hdr.opened  = YES.
                    
                    RELEASE job-hdr.

                            Material Type 6 is a Case Divider.  Total Divider are multiplied by number of cases.
                            After Pallet RM Item #  and before the Adhesive RM Item # 
                    
                    2.     Add CASE COUNT after No. of cases under Finishing.
                            Pull the information from  O-U-1 - Order Item Detail - Units/pallet
                    
                    3.    Move the CAD # in the board section up to print in the FG item section
                           Change Label from Order Type to  Order Type/Cad#
                           Print Under the Order Type.
                    
                    4.    Space out the remaining items in the board section

J-U-1-   06061203 E XML output report option for Premier Print-to-File - Job Ticket Only
                    This task is simply a copy of 05181205 that is the the other 3 reports.  
                    This one is a placeholder for the Job Ticket work only.
                    For the following reports from Advantzware:
                    4.   Job Ticket
                    ASI will create a XML output file in a location specified through a system level control for each
                     report.  These controls will be (respectively):
                    4.   XMLJobTicket
                    The logical (yes/no) value will indicate whether the ASI system outputs to XML (yes) or does not 
                    (no).  The character value for each of the system controls will contain the file path for which t
                    o store these XML files.  
                    
                    The user interface will not change.  When a system control is set to yes for a given report and O
                    NLY if the user selects "Print to File" and submits via the "OK" button, ASI will simply create a
                     secondary output stream to the XML and also allow the user to select the file location for print
                    ing to an .xpr file, as they do today (i.e - two files get created, one XML in the location speci
                    fied by the system control, and one .xpr in the location specified by the user).  The other print
                     options should not create an XML output.   Premier wanted to limit the amount of duplication of 
                    reports and their users are already trained to print-to-file today.
                    
                    XML File Details:
                    ASI will choose a file naming convention that is simple.  ASI will create a file on every print-t
                    o-file operation done, regardless if the form has already been printed.
                    Premier provided a sample breakdown of fields they would like the XML to output for BOL and Job T
                    icket.   These samples are attached.
                    In general, Premier would like header and footer information supplied once with each data item br
                    oken out into a separate tag.  For the variable line-item parts of the reports, they would like e
                    ach printed line represented as a tag with space delimited values inside each tag.

J-U-1-   11130809 E Corrtrim Integration (See Attachments) (Invoiced on Contract)
                    Delta has a Corrugator in their plant to make sheets for their sheet plant converting machines.
                    Job Data for sheets will be downloaded to the corrugated scheduling software, CorrTrim, written b
                    y Corrugated Technology, Inc.
                    
                    Once this software has scheduled the Corrugator by Job, the start date and start time must be dow
                    n loaded to the Advantzware Job File.   ASI will search import this data every time the file has 
                    been updated.  The Report Corrugator Schedule (RCSH) transaction is used to send the corrugator s
                    chedule information to the business system.

M-F-1-   06021403 E Delete Raw Good Item must check History before Deleting
                    Find Item SBS18-24
                    Next, click History Button and you will see data.
                    Next, click View Item.
                    Click Delete Button.

                    If history exists, program will not allow deleting of the record.
                    Display warning.
                    "Sorry, History exists, item and history must be purged via system administrator"

                    If RM Item is BLANK.
                    The delete button should delete the items without checking for any conditions such as open purcha
                    se orders, history, etc.
                    A blank item code should never exist so DELETE will simply remove this.

                    For Sharp Shooter Clients
                    This will provide abilitty to correct data entry errors, then recaculate the inventory totals.
                    This will also allow customers that have inventory without tags to switch to tags.
                    When a customer buys Sharp Shooter, the inventory on hand will not have a Tag#.
                    They can COPY an existing Receipt line an add a TAG# to that Line.
                    They can Copy that new Receipt and change the Tag#.
                    When they have duplicated added enough Tags to equal the On Hand without the Tag, then they can D
                    ELETE that Receipt Line.   
                    
                    Please note,  user ID must be asi for COPY and DELETE button to work.

M-F-1-   11261403 E HISTORY to Display A/P Invoiced Status with Update with Security Acces
                    Raw Materials History Tab new A/P Invoice Status.
                    
                    This new field can be updated by the User ID ASI or users with security via the Program Master.  
                     This will allow ASI and customers to corect the database if a bug in the V-U-1 program improperl
                    y updates the RM History table.
                    
                    
                    Business Reason for this Logic.
                    When RM Receipts are posted, the A/P Invoice# and/or Status is updated in the RM History database
                    .   This logic is used when adding an A/P invoice from a purchase order.
                    Somehow,  purchase orders with multiple lines are showing the wrong status.
                    For example, 1 PO Line is received and Invoice.
                    However, the 2 PO Line item is received but the user cannot add the A/P Invoice.
                    The warning on the V-U-1 Invoice line tab states "No PO Avaialbe"

                    Calculation for MSF.   For Example,  ASI Item SBS18-24.5  has width of 24.5 inches
                    If Board = Roll of 100,000 and Consumption UOM = LF
                    MSF = 204.166 =  (100,000 LF    x (24.5 /12"))  / 1000
                    If Board = Sheets and sheet is 24.5 x 34.25   and 35,036 On Hand
                    MSF = 204.166 =  ((35,036 Shts x  (24.5 x 34.25 / 144") ) / 1000)

                    6) Transfer All  Print selection Ranges from Legacy Report will match New Report
                    7) Transfer All  Sort Options from Legacy Report will match New Report
                    8) Transfer All  Toggle Box Options from Legacy Report to New Report

                    a)  Add Alll fields listed on the DETAILS Radio Button

M-U- -   07021301 E New Record ID Logic to Prevent Record Locking
                    We are 99% positive when this issue was made the cost should have been pulled as 90 cents/lb.  Ho
                    wever, as you can see the price was posted as 30.68/lb.  We suspect this is because when multiple
                     users are in M-U-1 or M-U-2 that they are not being locked out of each others transactions. 
                    
                    Somehow, records are being merged and causing errant postings.  
                    This must be rectified.  
                    Just today, I am told a person was entering a receipt in M-U-1 and, when another user attempted a
                    n entry simultaneously, their record disappeared altogether.  Users have to be locked out from ea
                    ch other's transactions. 
                    
                    We first suspected users were accidentally copying a non-posted entry of another user, but now we
                     believe it is this cause.  
                    
                    
                    ASI Solution
                    New Standard Progress Record Number to Prevents Locking.

M-U-1-   03171107 E N-K RMUnderOver    Character Value to Dictate Logic to Check Over and
                    Character Value = UnderRuns and OverRun 
                    This will be default logic when creating this new N-K-1 Parameter.
                    This will check each raw material receipt for underun and overrun quantity.
                    This option will be used when tag numbers are not used via the M-U-1 menu.
                    The user enters the total receipt quantity for all pallets and rolls on one line.
                    
                    Character Value = OverRuns Only 
                    This will check each raw material receipt only for overrun quantity.
                    This option will be used when receiving multiple tag numbers via M-U-1.
                    System has no idea how many tags will be added so it checks underrun every line.
                    The user enters the total receipt quantity for each  pallets or roll tag so the program would che
                    ck for underrun on each line and prompt warning.    
                    This parameter will turn this feature off and never check for underrun quantity.
                    
                    
                    Original task 09281005:  
                    Tested on ASI PO 101420

M-U-1-   09281005 E N-K RMUnderOver  New popup when receiving under the qty minus the PO Q
                    N-K RMUnderOver  
                    New popup warning message when receiving outside the allowable overrun and underrun of a purchase
                     order quantity.
                    
                    Logical Value = Yes turns on this logic.
                    Logical Value = No will not use this logic.
                    
                    Character Value = OverRuns Only.  When receiving over the quantity plus the overrun, a popup come
                    s up to notify you that the receipt quantity is over the allowable overrun..  
                    
                    Character Value = UnderRuns and OverRun
                    When receiving over the quantity plus the overrun, a popup comes up to notify you.  
                    Also, when receiving under the Purchase Order quantity less the underrun percentage, system will 
                    display a warning message.
M-U-2-   02211105 E N-K RMTAGS  DELETE Button in M-U-2 to Remove WIP Tags
                    Add Issue for Job 202699 for Raw Material Item sbs18-24.
                    Select  WIP Tags by pasting Raw Tag 01014060010000009 to Tag 0101406001000001
                    
                    WIP Tags Created via the M-U-2 Button should be deleted if the RM Issue is deleted.
                    Delete button will search N-K-1 RMTAGS logical value = YES.
                    If logical value = YES, 
                    program will search Brwse WipTags = RM Tag listed on the M-U-2 line that also have Wip Tag Status
                     = ISSUED 
                    
                    The net result is we want tight inventory control.
                    RM Tags become WIP tags and we cannot have both on hand.
                    If we delete an unposted raw material issue for a RM tag then must delete the WIP Tags that were 
                    created / assigned to that RM Tag.

M-U-2-   10021204 E N-K RMIssue  Integer Value = 1 to Prompt to Re-open job
                    N-K RMIssue  Integer Value = 0 will not Prompt to Re-open job when adding new issue for a closed 
                    job.
                    This will continue to display message, "Cannot Issue Materials to a Closed or Completed Job" 
                    Therefore, before issuing RMs to a closed job, the user must click J-C and Reopen Job.  
                    Then go back to M-U-2 and add new Issues for the Job.
                    
                    N-K RMIssue  Integer Value = 1 
                    The issues program will prompt to Re-open job if the Job Status = C.
                    This is similar prompt that already exists when adding FG Receipts for a Closed Job.
                    Please note, the program will create NEGATIVE ISSUES when a job is reopened for materials that ar
                    e set to AUTOPOST.  
                    For example, ASI Job W2297-12 shows the J-U-1 Materials Tab has the field called AutoPost set to 
                    YES for Pallets and Cases.  
                    When jobs are closed, the materials that are set to AUTOPOST will automatically create issues on 
                    the M-U-2 Screen.
                    When jobs are reopened the materials that are set to AUTOPOST will automatically create negative 
                    issues on the M-U-2 Screen.
                    
                    
                    
                    In Summary,  only need to execute the CLOSE or REOPEN procedure from J-C

M-U-5-   02211106 E N-K RMTAGS  Post Raw Materials to Update WIP Tag Status to ON HAND
                    N-K-1 RMTAGS logical value = YES.
                    Post Raw Material Issues should update the STATUS = ON HAND
                    That is the only change needed.
                    
                    Business Logic Explained
                    The business logic is that posting raw materials issues currently reduces the raw materials on ha
                    nd quantity from the bin / tag.  
                    By changing the status of the WIP Tag to ON HAND we will be able to calculate total the 
                    ON HAND balance of Work in Process (WIP) tags.

M-U-6-   02131205 E N-K AutoIssu Logical Value ? to Toggle for Creating Issues
                    M-U-6 & Move to Sharp Shooter - Scan Vendor Tags  - POST Button.
                    New button option called CREATE ISSUES?  on the POST Button.
                    When N-K-1 AutoIssue = Yes, this will be checked and cannot be changed.
                               When posting receipts, the issues will be created to mimic the receipt.
                    When N-K-1 AutoIssue = No, this will be unchecked and cannot be changed.
                                When posting receipts, the issues will be created to mimic the receipt.
                    When N-K-1 AutoIssue = ?, the Created Issues Toggle Box is Updateable by User.
                               User can Check to Create Issues or Uncheck to Not Create the Issue.
                    
                    N-K-1 AutoPost Logical Value = ?
                    Will give Forklift Driver Option to Create and Post Issues or to just create Receipt and to not c
                    reate the issue to the job.    
                    
                    For example, 30 pallets are waiting at the receiveing dock to receive.
                    If 10 Pallets are to be moved immediately to the plant floor, then the user can scan the 10 palle
                    t and delivery to plant, then click the POST button can checked the Toggle "CREATE ISSUE" and the
                     10 pallet tags will be recieved and issued simultaneously resulting in Zero on Hand.
                    
                    The remaininng 20 pallets can be scanned then forklift driver will click the POST button and UNCH
                    ECK the Create Issues button.  Then click OK to Post.  The net result will be 20 pallet tags will
                     be ON HAND and waiting for a future Issue.

N-K-1-   02031404 E N-K RelPost  Decimal Value = 1 to Place All BOL Lines as C for Complet
                    Decimal Value = 0  
                    This logic will continue to calculate either a C or P for Complete or Partial for each Bill of La
                    ding Line.  When BOL Line is P for Partial, a Back Order Release will be created when the invoice
                     is created via the Bill of Lading Posting Logic.
                    
                    Decimal Value =1 
                    Every line of the Bill of Lading will always be set to C for Completed.  
                    Therefore, a back order release will never be created.
                    This logic will work for ALL Customers when View Control Integer Value = 1.
N-K-1-   02131201 E N-K LASTSHIP   Character Value = Custom / Stock
                    Character Value = Stock/Custom.  
                    Will be used for customers that manufacture and distribute boxes to determine the due date, which
                     transfers to the Promise Date.  Last Ship Date will  continue to add the customers warehouse day
                    s to the order date.     For example,  if integer value = 1 and decimal value = 5 then due date f
                    or distribution items without estimate would be 1 day from the order date wheras orders to manufa
                    cture would be 5 days from the order date.   The due date can always be changed after it is calcu
                    lated.
                    
                    Integer Value = When Character Value = Stock/Custom
                    Orders without an Estimate Number will calculate the Due Date by adding the Integer Value as the 
                    number of days from the order date.     
                    
                    Decimal Value = When Character Value = Stock/Custom
                    Orders with an estimate will use the Decimal Value as the number of days to add to the order date
                     to calculate the Due Date to make and ship manufactured goods.

                    OL to be printed/emailed at a later date if needed via O-Q-1.  
                    The scanned BOL must be saved as the file name = BOL#.pdf.
                    For example, bill of lading number 82703 would be saved as 82703.Jpg

                     file.

                    s on "BOL" tab.  NEW Button called  "Signed BOL".  This will view / print the Jpeg.  Scanned BOLs
                     will be saved as JPEG files with filenames "bol_number.jpg"  (for example, 82703.jpg), in the di
                    rectory that is set under N-K-1 BOLSIGN Character value.  If file "bol_number.jpg" does not exist

                    navailable".

N-K-1-   09011103 E N-K JobcardC = MultiCellGA   (Copy United)
                    N-K-1 JobCardC = MulticellGA.   Copy United Job Card and Make Changes per Attached.
                    Total of Slots in Long = Qty per Set of Short.   Total of Slots in Short = Qty per Set of Long.
                    A)  Attachments shows ASI folder of Adders & Die
                    B)  Attachment shows ASI folder of Long and Short Partition Dimensions.
                    C)  United Job Card is Attached without Changes as a reference.
                    D)  New Multiple Job Card is Attached labeled as United JobCard with Changes
                    E)   Sample Picture of Assembled Partition is attached.
                     
                    1)  Long and Short Dimensions will print from SET Button in dimensions displayed.
                          New section for Long and Short will replace existing section.
                          Long Partition is always Blank1.    Short Partition is always Blank2.
                          Set Button and SPEC folder show all diemensions. 
                    2)  Department Notes will print on bottom middle block.     
                          Remove all lines currently in the section.   
                          Print Job Card screen has toggle box to list Departments that will print in this section.
                    3)  Number of Slots are listed in the Style File.
                    4)  Long Qty = Order Quantity multipled by Overrun % multiplied by Qty/Set on Est Folder. 
                    5)  Short Qty = Order Quantity multipled by Overrun % multiplied by Qty/Set on Est Folder
                    6)  Set Qty Min and Max.   This is Order times Underrun % and Job Qty times Overrun %.
                    For example,  Order 203180 for Estimate 8786 has a P9 Long 12x6 and P7 Short 9x6.
                    Order qty = 1000 with 10% under = 900 and 10% over = 1100.
                    Style P9 Long Quantity = 1100 x 7 =  7,700.     Style P7 Short Quantity = 1100 x 9 =  9,900

N-K-1-   09140713 E N-K OEPrepPO logical value YES to create PO's / Update Schedule Board
                    N-K OEAutoPrep Prompts to Create PO from Order Entry.(Works with Task 09050704)
                    System will creation purchase order for prep material based on new N-Z-3 material types below:
                    7 = Printing Plates, which are Prep Code "P".
                    8 = Cutting Dies, which are Prep Code "D".
                    X = Flat Die, which are Prep Code "F".
                    Y = Rule or Rotary Die, which are Prep Code "R". 
                    
                    Logical Value = YES will prompt to add purchase order for prep material such as plates or dies.  
                    
                    
                    Logical Value = NO will not prompt to create purchase order for prep material. 
                    
                    Please Note, a series of modification tasks were required to integrate Prep.
                    New prep material types 7,8,X,Y will replace "M"isc materials for inventory control and purchases
                     validations. Raw goods receipts for these material types will automatically update the schedule 
                    board based on the new material types. The users will be able to color code jobs waiting for plat
                    es or dies. Best of all, the system will update the board when the plates and dies are in receive
                    d.
                    Job standards creation will transfer all Misc & Prep material to the job file's material folder. 
                     When the order line has a status of NEW, then purchase orders will be created for all Plate and 
                    Die Prep codes on the estimate in the job file regardless of SIMON code.  The AutoPrep will creat
                    e PO for all prep material regardless of SIMON codes.  In summary, modification will 
                    Automatically prompt to create Purchase Order, 
                    Automatically update cost from Purchase Order back to the MISC folder of Order.
                    Automatically updates the Schedule Board when Dies or Plates are Received 
                    Automatically updates the Schedule Board when Dies or Plates are on Hand.
                    Automatically create Raw Material Item Codes to Match the Plate or Die Number.
                    Automatically cross reference Plates and Dies to a Raw Material Item Code.
                    Automatically update the Job -Material Folder.

N-K-1-   11161006 E Automatic Partition Layout Calculation
                    See Attachements for estimate 8320, which is an assembled partition.
                    DEFAULT GRAIN will be S = SHEET FED.
                    
                    Currently COMBINATION logic does not calculate the LAYOUT page.
                    Partition styles should automatically calculate the LAYOUT page.
                    The GOTO Button number up times the Blanks Width and Depth will be used.
                    
                    This example the SET size / 3D image is 12 x 9 x 5.
                    The length partition is 12 inches long by 5 inches high.
                    The width partition is 9 inches long by 5 inches high.
                    The GOTO shows 5x2 and 5 x 3.
                    
                    The Die Width of the Length Partition  MUST match the DIE Width of the Width Partition.
                    i.e  Blank1 Die Width must = Blank2 Die Width.
                    Therefore  Sheet Width Number Up times Blank Width = NET SHEET Width.
                    ie.  5 x 5 = 25.
                    
                    The DIE Length is both blanks Lengths times number up on Length.
                    Therefore  12 x 2 + 9 x 3 = 51.

N-K-1-   11221101 E N-K FGEMAIL   Email Customer Service for Out of Stock Inventory
                    N-K-1 FGEMAIL.  FG Receipts via Purchase Orders  will automatically Email Customer Service for Ou
                    t of Stock Items that have been received.   Please note, The character option will be for manufac
                    tured goods, whereas the Integer Value will be for Purchased Goods.
                    
                    Integer Value = 0  Will not validate on hand value for receipts for purchase orders.
                    Integer Value = 1  Will check Finished Goods Receipts for Purchase Orders.
                    
                    Check Finished Quantity On Hand = Zero.   
                    And Quantity Allocated in I-F-1 is greater than Zero.
                    Then search Open Orders for this FG Item.  (Allocated Button in I-F-1) 
                    Email each UserID on each Open Order.
                     
                    This logic will be for I-U-1 receipts for finished goods with a purchase order number.
                    When posting finished goods (I-U-5) this will create email similar to existing logic.
                    Prior to posting, program must define list of items with On Hand = Zero.  
                    The program will then  search the USER ID for all OPEN orders for this finished goods item.   Onc
                    e the list of user IDs by Order is compiled, the progam will then automatically email the user Id
                     (CSR) on each Order.  The Email message line will show the  Purchase Order#, Customer Order#, FG
                     Item# and quantity Received to Inventory.  The message will read,  Finished Goods Receipts have 
                    been Posted.
                    
                    Please Note,  Similar Logic is on Task# 01210505  N-K SSBOL Creation: Scanned Tags  added to Rele
                    ase  with EMAIL   This task looks at the order user ID to create SEND to email.

N-K-1-   12170903 E N-K BarDir   F1 Lookup on View Control and View Form

N-K-1-   12191104 E N-K SETPRINT = McLean  New Sell Price = F
                    See Attached Screen for Estimate 9267 for 25000 Assembled Partitions
                    N-K-1 SETPRINT.   Character Value = McClean
                    This must be caculated when pressing the ESTIMATE folder Calculate Button.
                    This must also calculate when changing the Sell Price/M
                    This must also calcualte when changing the Gross Margin %
                    This must also calcualte when changing the Net Margin%.
                    New Estimate control File Sell Price Calculate = F.  
                    This equals Factory Cost Plus markup + Freight.
                    This will be the same calculation as G plus cost of Freight.
                    New Temp database field to store the total freight cost and quantity for each Form.
                    
                    Currently, the Sell Price Calculation program looks for markup% in customer file.
                    If blank, then the Profit % in the estimate control file is used.
                    The new F calculation will be as follows:
                    Sell Price =  Existing Calculation = Existing G Logic plus Factory Cost/M.
                    Sell Price =  Factory Cost per M / (1-(Profit% / 100)  +  Total Freight Cost / Est Qty.
                    Please note, the Cost of Freight is the sum of freight for each form.
                    Form 1 for Long Partition = $87.46/M x (50,000 / 1000)  = $4373 
                    Form 2 for Short Partition = $74.21/M x (70,000 / 1000)  = $5565.75
                    Total Freight = $9938.75
                    Set Freight / M   = $9938.75 / (25000/1000)  = $397.55
                    Thus New Sell Price Method = F
                    Factory Cost = $166.41 / .20 + $397.55 = $1229.6
N-K-1-   12221003 E N-K CustXfer   Intercompany Processing Customer Data
                    N-K-1 CustXfer  
                    ESP: util\copycust.w has code to do it.  Not sure would want to copy warehouse/location info...
                    Logical Value = NO will be existing logic and not xfer data between companies.
                    Logical Value will automatically xfer data between companies.
                    Character Value will list the companies such as 001,002.
                    Each company will be separated by a comma.
                    F1 on the character value will only allow companies from the G-F-1 Company File.  
                    The company codes on character value will have synchonized customer data.
                    All files and fields will be transfered such as Bill to, Sold to and Ship To data will be transfe
                    rred. 
                    
                    New Logic:  Save Button for Add / Change/Delete will update other company CUSTOMER file for the s
                    ame Customer code.  Save button via Add Button copy the data from to all other companies on the c
                    haracter value.    Update button will transfer all the data to the other company.  For example, i
                    f I login as ASI to company 001 and add a new Customer called SEWA, the customer  will be copied 
                    to the other companies listed on the character value.
                    If I delete a customer, that same customer code will be deleted from all companies.
                    If I update SEWA, then all new the data will transfer to the other companies.
                    
                    Please note, no data on the TOTALS folder will not be updated customer balances for each plant ma

N-K-1-   12221004 E N-K VendXfer Intercompany Processing Vendor Data
                    N-K-1 VendtXfer  This logic is for intercompany transfer of vendors and vendors data within a com
                    mon database connected via a single network.
                    Logical Value = NO will be existing logic and not transfer data between companies.
                    Logical Value = YES will automatically transfer data between companies.
                    
                    Character Value will list the companies such as 001,002.
                    Each company will be separated by a comma.
                    F1 on the character value will only allow companies from the G-F-1 Company File.  
                    The company codes on character value will have synchonized customer data.
                    All files and fields will be transfered such as Vendor Code, Remit To, Terms, etc. will be transf
                    erred.  
                    
                    New Logic:  Save Button for Add / Change/Delete will update other company Vendor file for the sam
                    e vendor code.  Add mode will copy the data from existing company to all other companies on the c
                    haracter value.    Update button will transfer all the data to the other company.  For example, i
                    f I login as ASI to company 001 and add a new vendor called SEWA, the vendor will be added to the
                     other companies listed on the character value.
                    If I delete a vendor, that same vendor code will be deleted from all companies.
                    If I update SEWA, then all new the data will transfer to the other companies.

N-R- -   05271408 E Util/FindReplaceFilePath.r - New Utility to Update the Disk Drive Lett
                    Util/FindReplaceFilePath.r - New Utility to Update the Disk Drive Letter
                    The customer stores attachments on the PAPER CLIP Icon throughout the system.
                    They have a new server and new disk drive letter.
                    They need the beginnning character replaced, which is the disk drive changed.
                    
                    This utility will allow the user to find and replace the old drive letter (or any folder) with a 
                    new drive letter.    There will be a "Find File Path:" and a "Replace File Path with:"
                    To change the drives across all attachments, user would simply enter "P:\" in the Find field and 
                    "Q:\" in the Replace field.
                    
                    Additionally, there should be a check box that says "Include Box Designs" that will include these
                     special database tables in the find/replace search.
                    
                    Please Note:
                    This utility does not search on the beginning characters.
                    This will find and replace any string of characters that match.
                    So if you Replace N with Z.  This will replace all letters including folders and file names.
                    If you want to replace the N Drive they must type N:   with Z:

                    New Utilitity to consolidate Transfers in FG History File by Date, Time, Tag#, Whse and Bin.
                    Step to Duplicate.
                    1)  Create Release for INVOICE only for 25,000 boxes.
                    2)  Click INVOICE button to create invoice. 
                          This creates a -25000 from Customer Blank and 25000 for customer IBM1000.
                          Thus 25,000 boxes are owned by customer.
                    3)   Next create SHIP ONLY Release for FIVE Tags.
                           Click BOL button to create Tags.
                    4)   Post BOL to create Invoice.
                          For each BOL Line (Each tag) 
                          This creates a 5000 from Customer Blank and -5000 for customer IBM1000.
                          Since there are two tags, there are 10 new TRANSFER transactions.
                          They all have the same Date and Time.  
                          Five Transfers with 5000 with no Customer and Five -5000 Transfers for IBM1000
                          
                    New Utilty.
                    If Date, Time, Job#, Tag#, Warehouse and Bin are the same, GRAND TOTAL lines.
                    Net Result is History Tab will show -25,000 for IBM1000 and 25,000 for Blank Customer.

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          WorkSheet will display the following Fields: Item Code, job#, Cust Part#, Item Name, Desc1,
                     Desc2, Tag#, Quantity, Qty/Case, Units/Pallet, Pallets, Qty/Pallet.
                    Only the Qty/Case (aka unit)  and Units/Pallet will be updated.
                    Program will calculate / Update the following Fields on WorkSheet, calculated as follows:
                    Qty/Pallet = Qty/Case x Units per Pallet
                    Total Pallets = Total Quanity / (Qty per Pallet)
                    Units = Total Qty / Qty per Case
                    See Attached  Example, 
                    If Quanity is 5000 and Qty/Case = 500 and Units/Pallet = 10 then 
                    Units = 40,   Qty per Pallet = 5000 and  Total Pallets = 1

                    Each finished goods item may have multiple releases.
                    Each Release can have a different LOT#.
                    Print the LOT# from the 1st Item for the oldest Release Number.
                    
                    
                    See attachment dated 3/2
                    
                    
                    Please note,  Both Jobcards must be colonial
                    N-K1 JobcardF = Colonial
                    N-K-1 JobcardC = ColonialPL
                    Product Category = Product Category must start with P

O- - -   05181205 E XML output report option for Premier Print-to-File
                    For the following reports from Advantzware:
                    1.  BOL
                    2.  Job Ticket  (moved to 06061203)
                    3.  Quotes
                    4.  Estimates   (moved to 06061202)
                    5.  Invoices
                    
                    ASI will create a XML output file in the location defined in the CHARACTER value field.
                    1.  N-K-1 XMLBOL
                    2.  N-K-1 XMLJobTicket (moved to 06061203)
                    3.  N-K-1 XMLQuote
                    4.  N-K-1 XMLEstimate (moved to 06061202)
                    5.  N-K-1 XMLInvvoice
                    
                    The logical (yes/no) value will indicate whether the ASI system outputs to XML (yes) or does not 
                    (no).  The character value for each of the system controls will contain the file path for which t
                    o store these XML files.  
                    
                    The user interface will not change.  When a system control is set to yes for a given report and O
                    NLY if the user selects "Print to File" and submits via the "OK" button, ASI will simply create a
                     secondary output stream to the XML and also allow the user to select the file location for print
                    ing to an .xpr file, as they do today (i.e - two files get created, one XML in the location speci
                    fied by the system control, and one .xpr in the location specified by the user).  The other print
                     options should not create an XML output.   Premier wanted to limit the amount of duplication of 
                    reports and their users are already trained to print-to-file today.
                    
                    XML File Details:
                    ASI will choose a file naming convention that is simple.  ASI will create a file on every print-t
                    o-file operation done, regardless if the form has already been printed.
                    Premier provided a sample breakdown of fields they would like the XML to output for BOL and Job T
                    icket.   These samples are attached.
                    In general, Premier would like header and footer information supplied once with each data item br
                    oken out into a separate tag.  For the variable line-item parts of the reports, they would like e
                    ach printed line represented as a tag with space delimited values inside each tag.  
O- - -   07061204 E XML output report option for Premier Print-to-File (version 4)
                    Add ending PAGE tag.

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    We have received a request from the plant that currently receives orders from Premier Packaging t
                    o enhance the current XML we are receiving when they place an order. 
                    Premier is expecting their complete job # to show up on the load tag we are sending them when the
                     product is produced and we are only getting part of the job #. Today our plant is receiving a fa
                    x from the customer containing the complete job # on it. They then have to go in and update the j
                    ob # to include the last few digits. I have no clue where the rest of this job # that printing on
                     the fax is located, but we are definitely not getting it. Below is an example. I am hoping that 
                    the process is just truncating the field we are receiving to 5 digits and can just be expanded. O
                    therwise we will need to have an additional field added to our XML layout.
                     
                    Example:
                     
                    Premiere sent PO # 70843a1 on 7/14
                    Attached is the XML we received
                    As you will see, we received 246059 in the PO line sequence number. This is part of the job # and
                     is in the correct location but as you can also see by the fax that is attached, the complete job
                     # is 246059-01-01. We are missing the -01-01.
                     
                    Please let us know what would be involved to include the rest of the job # in the file you are cu
                    rrently sending. Thanks.

O-B-3-   04271203 E N-K INVPRINT = LoylangBSF  (Copy LoyLang)
                    N-K-InvPrint = LoyLangBSF  (This is a Invoice Form Change Only)
                    This will be added to the View Form by unique customer.
                    When Customer is on View Form and character value = LoyLangBSF and 
                    Finished Goods Product Category = PADS THEN.
                    The Sell Price and UOM on the Quote From will be replaced by Sell Price and UOM per BSF
                    BSF = Blank Square Feet.
                    Price per Board Square Foot is calculated as
                    Selling Price / Blank Square Feet. Blank SF = 4.401  (Spec Folder Blank Square Feet)
                    This is found in the Spec Folder for quotes and I-F-1 Totals Folder for invoicing.
                    
                    Order Entry and Invoice File will house the price per each.  The Invoice Form and Reprinting Post
                    ed AR Invoice Form will print the Sell Price per BSF in place of the Selling Price on O-B-1 Invoi
                    ce Folder or A/R Histry File.   Only EA and M will be Converted
                    
                    Sell Price per BSF = Items Sell Price /divided by Blank Square Feet.   
                    Sell Price per M = 
                    ((Sell Price Ea x Qty / (Qty/1000)  / Blank Square Ft)
                    
                    For Example: 
                    Sell Price of $1354.14 / 4.401 = $307.69 
                    Sell Price of $1.35414 x 5000 / (5000/1000) / 4.401 = $307.97
O-B-3-   04291002 E N-K INVPRINT = CSC-GA  (New Invoice Form)
                    See Attached - Copy Elite Form and Add Container Service Logo
                    Update order invoice and A/R Invoice.
                    Also update printing posted invoices.
                    
                    Please note, this invoice form has limitations.
                    Purchase order number and bill of lading number in header section is not recommended.   
                    If multiple orders with different PO are on same bill of lading, only 1 PO# will print on this in
                    voice form.  Likewise, if a customer wants their invoices consolidated by PO#, multiple bill of l
                    adings may have the same PO#, whereby only 1 BOL# will print on the Elite Invoice Form.

O-B-3-   05101102 E N-K INVPRINT = CSC-GA   Summarize by FG Item
                    N-K-1 InvPrint = CSC-GA invoice form will summarize by FG Item.
                    This will total the Invoice quantities for all identical finished goods items.
                    If multiple bill of ladinds are combined on a single invoice, the quantities will be summarized b
                    y finished goods item.
                    
                    However, if if an item has a different sell price on invoice line then this will repeat item on i
                    nvoice form showing the separate price.  Meaning, the FG item will be summarize the quantity by i
                    tem by sell price.  This modification is to summarize by Finished goods Item by Sell Price. 
                    For example.
                    Order 100100 for customer XYZ is shipped 1000 boxes at $1 each.
                    Order 100200 for customer XYZ is shipped 1000 boxes at $1 each.
                    Order 100300 for customer XYZ is shipped 1000 boxes at $1 each.
                    Order 100400 for customer XYZ is shipped 1000 boxes at $2 each.
                    Order 100500 for customer XYZ is shipped 1000 boxes at $2 each.
                    Order 100600 for customer XYZ is shipped 1000 boxes at $2 each.
                    
                    When this invoice is consolidated the invoice should show 
                    Qty shipped 3000,Qty Invoiced 3000 at $1 each with Total Price of $3,000 
                    Qty shipped 3000,Qty Invoiced 3000 at $2 each with Total Price of $6,000

O-B-3-   06121410 E N-K InvPrint = SouleMed
                    See Attachment for changes.   
                    The only field that prints after the new changes are the Shipped Quantity.
                    However, this is the quantity of boxes.
                    The medical division packs 90 percent of their product in corrugated cases.
                    
                    When the Invoice Sell Price = CS,  then the Quantity Shipped will be divided by the Quantity per 
                    Unit.   The Unit Count on the BOL is the quantity packed per Case.
                    For example,
                    If  the Bill of Lading showed Shipped 14 Units with 12 Qty per Unit.
                    The Invoice Screen would show 144 Shipped, Case Count = 12  and $150 per Case.
                    
                    That is perfect.
                    The Invoice also currently prints 144 and  also show $150 per CS (Case).
                    This is confusing to their customes.
                    
                    MOD =  Print 12 in place of the 144.    Invoice will print 12 at $150.
                    
                    Please note, the Calculation of Extended Sell Price and Total Invoice Price WILL NOT CHANGE.   Th
                    at will continue to be Invoice Qty Divided by Case Count x Sell Price per Case.
                    ie.  144 / 12 X $150 = $180
