O-B-3-   08011308 E Batch Email Invoices with Signed BOL without Printing Invoice (Shared
                    Batch Email will also attached Signed Bill of Lading if Signed BOL Exists - Logic Existed.
                    A-F-1 Customer Field = Paperless Invoice
                    O-B-1 Icon  Toggle Box = Ignore Paperless Setting
                    O-B-3 Toggle Box = Ignore Paperless Setting
                    Batch Emailing Invoices will only to Email Customers set to Paperless Invoice
                    Output Not Equal to Email - Will only Process Customer with Paperless Invoice UNCHECKED.
                    To Override Above Logic.
                    New O-B-3 and O-B-1 Icon Toggle Box =  Ignnore Paperless Setting
                    
                    New Database Field in A-F-1 Customer Field = Paperless Invoice   
                    The O-B-3 Email Toggle box will still email a single Invoice for any Customer.
                    i.e. Emailing Invoice (without Checked Batch Invoice) will not check A-F-1 Email Invoice Box.    
                    
                    
                    Invoice PRINTING Logic will also Change.
                    When Printing Invoices, Customers set to Paperless Invoice checked will not print to Paper.
                    When Printing Invoices, Customer NOT set to Paperless Invoice will Print to Paper.
                    The  printed Invoice will be Mailed via post office at cost of .48 cents per letter.
                    New O-B-3 Toggle Box "Ignore Paperless Setting"  - Ignores A-F-1 Paperless Invoice Logic 
                    Ignore Paperless Setting will allow Output for all customers regardless of Paperless Setting.
                    This allows Invoice Number to be Assigned and Reviewed on  the Screen..
                    
                    STEP 1.
                    Printing Invoices to Screen, thus saving paper.  (Check Ignore Paperless Setting)

                    ng.   They just want to Email the Invoices with Signed Bill of Lading Attached.

                    ailed via post Office.  If checked, the Invoice will not Print when Printing Invoices to the Prin
                    ter.  When BATCH emailing, only customers defined as EMAIL invoice will proces via the O-B-3 Prin
                    t Program.  Batch Emailing Invoices will save tons of paper and countless hours of time.  Many cu
                    stomers do not need or want a printed Invoice.
                    Premier prints the Invoice to the Screen so that an Invoice Number is Assigned.

O-B-3-   09061101 E N-K INVPRINT = PeachTree & N-K INVPRINT = peachtreefgl3
                    N-K-1 Invprint = Peachtree & PeachtreeFGL3
                    Change column heading to Shipped/Invoiced so this is a two line heading with Shipped printed on t
                    op of Invoiced.   Ship quantity will print on top line.   
                    Invoice quantity will print under this field however only 1 of the two will print.    
                    This new logic must work if invoice form is defined on View Control or View Form by Cusotmer fold
                    ers.
                    
                    Currentlly, only the shipped quantity prints regardless of invoice quantity.
                    If shipped quantity = invoice quantity on invoice, then ONLY print Shipped Quantity.
                    This occurs when release is B for bill and ship.
                    
                    If Ship Quantity is greater than zero and Invoice Quantity = zero.  ONLY print Ship Quantity.
                    This occurs when release is S for Ship Only.
                    
                    If Ship Quantity is ZERO and Invoice Quantity is greater than zero, ONLY print Invoice Quantity.
                    This occurs when release is I for Invoice Only.
                    
                    If Ship Quantity does not equal Invoice Quantity and both are greater than Zero, then print ONLY 
                    Invoice Quantity.     This is when they ship over the overrun but only invoice the allowable over
                    run.  For example, order quantity is 1000, they ship 1200 and invoice 1100.
                    Only the 1100 will print.

O-B-3-   10281103 E N-K InvPrint = TriLakesBroker  (Copy TriLakes)
                    New N-K-1 InvPrint  View Form = TriLakesBroker   See Attached:  Order 203638 Release 
                    Copy N-K-1 Invprint View Control = TriLakes.   
                    Replace the Existing PO# with the Customer Lot# field from the Release Folder.    
                    TriLakes will place TriLakesBroker on the N-K-1 InvPrint View Form for that Customer.
                    
                    Explanation for the Modification Follows:
                    TriLakes is the Box manufacturer.
                    They have sales reps known as Box Brokers that have their own Company.
                    The Box Broker sells boxes to End Users Such as IBM CORP, AT&T, etc.
                    The Box Broker does not manufacture boxes.
                    The Box Brokers issues a Blank PO# to TriLakes to Manufacture Boxes for the end user.
                    The Box Brokers Blank PO# is added on the View Order Folder, for example PO# 5000.
                    The End Users PO is added to the  Line Item and Release PO#.
                    The Box Broker sends a new PO# for each delivery to the end user.
                    The End User may also send a new PO# for each delivery.
                    Therefore,
                    The release PO# will always be for the End user.
                    The Customer Lot# will house the Box Brokers PO# for each delivery.
                         For example delivery 1 for 1st release may be PO# 5000-01
                         For example delivery 1 for 1st release may be PO# 5000-01
                    The Release PO# always transfers to BOL and Invoice.
                    The new Tri LakesBroker Invoice will  print the Customer Lot#

                    The customer flag may be set to print Invoice per PO.
                    Therefore, this will create two invoices.
                    The weight for each invoice line will be the total of all BOL lines for that BOL and that PO#.

O-B-4-   05291402 E cXML Processing  - Order Entry, ASN, & Invoicing
                    NOTE: This mod includes the previously quoted mod for the Invoice piece only (#12131306).
                    This mod will enable receipt of orders through cXML and transmission of cXML Advance Ship Notices
                     (ASN) and cXML Invoices.  Specs on required cXML formats are attached.
                    ASN & Invoice:
                    cXML Invoice generation is triggered by Premier user.  A new interface will be created that allow
                    s specifying a date range of invoices for a given customer. 
                    ASN piece would also be triggered by Premier user when the user prints a BOL (first time only, no
                    t reprint).  This would only execute special cXML handling if the customer is activated in an NK1
                     (cXMLASN. - View Form per customer)
                     - In both cases, this would generate a cXML file with a file name that indicates customer, data 
                    type and run date. 
                     - The cXML data that would then be pushed/transmitted to customer based on instructions stored i
                    n an NK1 for each customer. (cXMLASN & cXMLInvoice)
                     - There would be a log kept of transmissions.
                    Order Import piece:
                     - Assumption:  This is for stock item orders only.  No jobs will be automatically created.
                     - Receipt of the cXML would be a push from customer (Ariba) to an ASI/Premier web-service.  This
                     push would trigger the import process without any user interaction. 
                     - Similar to OEImport, orders come in to the system into O-W for approval.  
                     - The information in the cXML for the order should override any pricing in the system.  This wou
                    ld only apply to the individual order and should not affect the price matrix.
                     - ShipTo information needs to be added dynamically if the shipto ID provided is not already a va
                    lid ASI shipto.  If the shipto ID already exists in ASI, the new address information should be up
                    dated.
                     - Scheduled release would be created with the appropriate shipto ID.
                     - Change & cancellation orders would not affect ASI directly.  These will be handled by generati
                    ng an email detailing the change/cancellation.
O-B-4-   06131203 E Add Cost & Profit% from Invoice Line to Report next to Sell Price
                    See Attached.
                    Add new Cost Column to INVOICE Register / Posting Report. (before price)
                    Add new Profit# Column to Invoice Register / Posting Report. (after Tons)
                    
                    Profit% is calculated
                    as Sell Value minus Total Cost Value divided by Sell Value.
                    For example.
                    IF cost were $100 per M and Sell Price were $25 per Case.
                    If we sold 5000 boxes packed 200 per case.
                    The Total cost is 5000/1000 x $100 = $500 
                    The Total Selling Value =  5000/200 x $25 = $625
                    Thus Proit % is  $625 - $500 / $625 = .20 
                    
                    If this is NEGATIVE, print in RED.
                    
                    Please note, the Extended  Price (Sales Value) is on the Invoice Item Screen.
                    The cost must be calculated based on either a cost EACH or cost per M.
                    If Cost = EA then Invoice quantity x EA = Totat Cost.
                    If Cost = M then Invoice quantity/1000 x Cost/M =  Total Cost
                    
O-B-4-   09061203 E INVOICE PRINT ICON
                    PRINT ICON
                    New Toggle Box,        Email as Original?
                    This will Remove "[REPRINT]" from the subject line of the e-mail - see attached.
                    
                    Program uses the Status of the Invoice to Determine the Title Line.
                    The invioce status was printed this the title is accurate.
                    When printing an Email the Toggle Box REPRINT is automatically checked based on this status.  Thi
                    s cannot be changed
                    
                    PRINT ICON
                    New Toggle Box,        Email as Original?
                    This will default to UNChecked = NO when REPRINT Box is set to YES.
                    Therefore, the title will show REPRINT on the email.
                    
                    When this REPRINT box is Checked.
                    The user can manually Check the new Toggle Box "Email at Original?  = YES>
                    The program will tehn remove the word [REPRINT] from the email title.
                    The reason for this logic is so invoice can be printed and checked for errors.
                    Then once approved, they will email to customer as orignal.
O-B-4-   10061401 E cXML Processing  - Lookup Shipto tax code based on state
                    When ShipTos are automatically created, they are importing the tax code from the default shipTo (
                    this is the Shipto with the same ID as the Customer Number - DSG for instance).
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 155

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    This mod will add an additional lookup to the tax code table to attempt to find a match of the Sh
                    ipto State.
                    If a Tax Group is found that matches the State code, that will be used as the Tax Code on the new
                     shipTo.  Otherwise, the Tax Code will use the default as it does today (Note:  if Premier wants 
                    this to fall back to INT, that is what should be used on the default ShipTo).
                    
                    Change to above:
                    Instead of using the STATE Abbreviation as the tax code, the system will look for an existing shi
                    pto from the same state and use the tax code specified on that shipto.

O-F-4-   04081303 E New Toggle Box = Copy & Update New Price Matrix Only
                    This new logic would allow the prices to be updated weeks in advance of the effective price chang
                    e.   New Toggle Box =  Copy & Update New Matrix Only  
                    When Checked on O-F-4 Global Price Increase
                    Price Matrixes will be updated based on Effective Date.
                    Only Matrixes within the Print Selection Range including the Effective Date Range
                    
                    1)  Will copy the existing Price Matrix for the Selected Range.
                    2)  Place the New Effective date on the Copied files. 
                    3)  Change the Price on the New Price Matrix that Matches the New Effective Date
                    4)  Existing Price Matrix WILL NOT Not Be Changed.
                    
                    This would allow us to keep existing pricing in place until the effective date has arrived.  Exam
                    ple: So if I sell a stock box 10x10x10 to customer IBM1000 for $100/M and they will incur a 10 % 
                    price increase their new price would be $111.12/M based on increase on price.  
                    Please note,  calculation calculates true profit, thus divides $100 by .90.  THIS IS A BUG.
                    The Increase % Works by multiplies Price by 1 + Profit/100.  
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 156

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    ie.  10% increase multiplies by 1.1   This works perfectly

                    New Effective Date is MANDATORY when Checking Copy & Only Update New Matrix?
                    
O-F-4-   04081304 E util/DeleteOF4Prices.r      (Shared Cost)
                    Utility to delete Duplicate Price Matrix from O-F-4.
                    The matrix with the oldest effective date will be deleted.
                    Utility will First make Backup of Entire Price Matrix to Disk.
                    This will be used to Restore Data in case of Mistakes or Bugs.
                    
                    Please note, for a finished goods item there may be unlimted matrixes by effective date for each 
                    of the following examples..
                    1) Customer Code, Customer Type and FG Item Code.
                    2) Customer Type and FG Item Code.
                    3) FG Item Code
                    4) FG Category
                    
                    Utility will Prompt for 
                    From Customer  ___________       To  Customer             ____________
                    From Customer Type_______      To Customer Type  ____________
                    From FG Item     ___________       To  FG Item     _____________
                    From FG Category __________   To FG Category ____________
                    
                    Utility must find each FG item for Selection Ranges 1 to 4 above that matches and compare that Id
                    entical Matrixes exist with multiple effective dates.
                    Then Delete Matrix with the Oldest Effective Date.   At least one Matrix will remain.
O-F-4-   07251302 E Global Price New Toggle Box " Round to 4 Decimals ?
                    Currently, Global Price Increase has Option to Round to the Penny. 
                    Price of box is $ 2.0034 cents each.
                    Price increase it?s going to get rounded up to the penny with two Decimal Positions.
                    But we would rather leave it at 4 decimal places. 
                    It would be nice if the software would keep the same price format of the original price instead o
                    f rounding to the penny.  
                    
                    Net Result, 
                    Price of $2.0034 box with Global Price Increase of 6%.
                    2.0034 box x 1.06 (6% increase)   (Toggle Box =  Price Increase)
                    Would now read 2.1236 instead of the $2.13.
                    
                    
                    Mod is New Toggle Box
                    Round to 2 decimals __    4 Decimals  ___
                    User will check either 2 or 4.
O-F-5-   12221001 E N-K OrderXfer  Intercompany Processing of Orders
                    Existing Menu O-F-5 Task#'s 09220507 & 08040516 which copies Order from Company 1 to 2.
                    This menu was for stock items.   This must be modified for orders with jobs. 
                    1) Save Menu Parameters for the Copy Company to Company Program 
                    2) Next sequential Order Number for Copy To company must be imported.   (This now copies)
                    3) If customer does not exist, Util/CopyCust.r must be invoked to copy customer.
                         Bill to, Sold to and Ship To and other  data will also be transferred.  
                    4)  New Order for COPY TO company must search for estimate from TO COMPANY.
                          This must search company for estimate by Finished Goods Item Code & Customer Part#. 
                    5)  If estimate does not exist, program must copy Estimate (Util/CopyEst.r)
                          New estimate must Rebuild machine routing from New Company
                    5)  This will CLOSE the original order of the FROM Company.
                    New N-K-1 OrderXfer  may be need to list valid intercompany processing.  
                    Character Value will list the companies that will have synchonized customer data.
                    The F1 on the character value will only allow companies from the G-F-1 Company File.  Each Compan
                    y will be separated by a comma.
                    
                    Step 1 Company 001 Plant quotes Assembled Partiton Set and stores costs.  
                                 Company 002 Plant will be Vendor for 001 Plant and vice versa.  
                    Step 2 ABC Customer places Order for Company 001.  
                    Step 3 Company 001 transfers Order (O-f-5) to 002 Company 
                    Steo 4  System closes order for PA Plant.  
                    Step 5 System searches for existing estimates for customer Part# of Set.
                                  List of estimates is displayed for customer Service Rep to select.
                    Selected Estimate is used to create the new order on the other company.
                    If estimate does not exist, system copies 001 estimate information to 002 company and rebuilds ma
                    chine routing.  System Adds order on new Company with new Estimate.

O-F-8-   11111402 E cXML Order Processing - ShipTo requires handling of DICKS: prefix
                    New N-K-1 cXMLShipToParse - Character value
                    This only applies at the View Form/Customer specific level.
                    
                    The Character Value per customer will identify any prefix that needs to be trimmed before auto cr
                    eating the shipTo on order import.  Additionally, this prefix will need to be re-applied to the S
                    hipTo when creating the cXML files to be transmitted back to Ariba.
                    
                    For example, if Shipto is "DICKS:00001", the system will parse the DICKS: prefix and load the shi
                    pto in the ASI system as 00001.  Additionally, when building the cXML for ASN, Invoices and Ackno
                    wledgements, the ShipTo ID must be added to the "Contact" segment with the Prefix added.
                    Example:
                    <Contact addressID="DICKS:00001" role="shipto">
                    
O-F-8-   11121302 E N-K OEImport   View Form  Quote Days per Customer
                    N-K-1 OEIMport :  
                    Ipad Sales Order Import by Customer.
                    The Ipad App has fields for quote and estimate number.
                    Sometimes the estimate number is the only field entered to place an order.
                    The import program will search for the most recent quote.
                    The Integer Value on the VIEW CONTROL tab determine the Days Old allowed.
                    If the integer Value = 30, then quotes older than 30 days will not be used.
                    Therefore, if a quote cannot be found within 30 days, then the price will import as Zero.
                    
                    View Form allows validatation of Quote Age per Customer.
                    The View Form allows Customer ID.
                    The Integer Value on the View Form field will validate the Quotes Age.
                    When an order is imported from the IPAD, if the quote# is missing but the estimate# is listed.
                    The program will search for the most recent quote.
                    If the quote is within the days defined by the Integer Value, the Sell Price will Import.
                    If the quote is outside the days defined by the Integer Value, the Sell Price will be ZERO.
                    
                    For example, if Customer ATT1000 has integer value = 60 then the IMPORT program will search the f
                    or the last quote,  if this quote is within 60 days of todays date, the quoted price will transfe
                    rs to the new Order under the O-W menu.

O-Q-1-   09111201 E Add NEXT SHIPTO field in OQ1 Browser
                    Add new field called  "Last Shipto" on  O-Q-1.
                    This will print the last or next shipto code form the Release Folder.
                    
                    When multiple release lines exist for the item, the program will look for a release in the follow
                    ing priority:
                    Release Status C for Completed.
                    Release Status Z BOL is posted and in OB1.
                    Release Status P for posted release that is in the bill of lading file.
                    Release Status B for back ordered release
                    Release Status A for Actual Release.
                    Release Status I for Invoicable / past warehouse terms.
                    Release Status L for late.
                    Release Status S for released.
                    
                    The logic is to print the history of the shipment first back to the release status.

O-R-1-1  04051309 E Report Select Fields   More Changes  Test print Order# 205943
                    N-K-1 Reports,   Character Value =  OR11   Logical Value = Yes
                    New Columns Selectable by User  - See Attached new Fields
                    See Attached 2 pages, page 1 is existing report.  -   Page 2 are all new columns.
                    Page 1 has formula on orders.
                    Page 2 has formula on actual received and shipments, plus loss factor.
                    Please note,   PO may have multple Receipts Dates.
                    Orders may have multiple Ship Dates  thus 1 Line will be inaccurate.
                    Best we can do is print 1st Receipt Date and 1st Ship Date.
                    
                    New Fields
                    1) Order% Profit
                    2) MSF Rec'd
                    3) FG Ship Date
                    4) PO Rec Date
                    5) FG Ext Price
                    6) PO Rec Cost

O-R-1-3  07071407 E OR13 BackLog report - Toggle Boxes = Shipped Value ___   Invoiced Valu
                    See attached documents two pages.
                    When an order is INVOICE only, the OR13 does not reduce the backlog value because nothing has shi
                    pped.  That logic is pefect and will not be changed.
                    Currently, the O-R-13 backlog report calculates the backlog based on Quantity Orders less Qty Shi
                    pped.  However, Invoice Only Releases are not considered as zero quantity has shipped.
                    1)  The Solution is a new New Toggle box called 
                          Sales Value?  Shipped Value    ____     This is the Current Logic is Value by Order Qty.
                                                       Invoiced Value  ______.
                    New logic when checking Invoice Qty will substract the Invoiced Qty times Sell Price (Invoiced Sa
                    les)  from the Order Value Sales (Order Qty x Selling Price).
                    
                    2)  The HM1 Report, the Excel Speadsheet called Sales F/C uses the OR13 report.
                          This should be changed to use the new O-R-13 Toggle Box option called Invoice Qty
                    
                    TESTING
                    a)  See Attached.  Print for Item Taco Supreme
                         a)  Expand OR13 Print Parmeter for Item# to view 15 characters.
                         b)  Sales Value incorrect per attached.  Qty Due/1000 x Sales price = Backlog Value
                               For new Invoice Value 
                              Order 207650 = 25,000 Ordered  less 25,000 Invoice Only = ZERO DOLLARS
                              Order 207653 = 24,000 less 15,000 invoiced x $193.49/M  = $1741.41
                    
                    
O-R-1-3  07241409 E OR13 BackLog report Invoiced Value to be Used in HM1
                    Task 07071407 added in Toggle Box to Show Invoiced Value.
                    The calculate is to take the Order Qty Value less the Invoiced Value for Backlog Value.
                    Invoice Only releases will lower this value.
                    HM1 uses the OR13 report and this new logic should be used in HM1.
                    
                    Problem is that I do not know how to Test.
                    The HM1 Report, the Excel Speadsheet called Sales F/C uses the OR13 report.
                    This should be changed to use the new O-R-13 Toggle Box option called Invoice Qty
                    
                    
                    I tested OR13 with Order# 207650
                    Ordered 50,000, Invoice Only for 25,000 and Backlog value was perfect = $5,000
                    But, I ran HM1 for June 17,2014 which was Invoice Only date and I do not see any Value.

O-R-2-   06221105 E N-K SalesRep  Broker / Extra Sales Rep and Percentage by Customer
                    N-K-1 SalesRep  Broker / Extra Sales Rep and Percentage by Customer
                    Transfer Sales Rep to Order Item Line as Sales Rep # 002.
                    The Logical Value = Yes will turn on this Logic.
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 165

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    The Logical Value = NO will turn this logic off.
                    
                    The VIEW FORM folder will alow defining a Customer Code.
                    The Character Value will House a Valid Sales Rep Code from A-F-3 File.
                    An F1 Lookup on character value will display all sales rep just as the A-F-1 Sales Rep Search.
                    The Decimal Value will House the Default Commission Percentage for this Customer.
                    
                    For example, if I add customer ATT1000 and character value as Sales Rep 003 and commission of 2.5
                     in decimal value.   Add new order or new FG item will transfer this Sales Rep 003 to the View Or
                    der and Item folder as sales rep number 2 when adding an order.
                    
                    The Original Sales Rep will continue to transfer from the original logic as the first sales rep o
                    n the orders View Tab and Line Item Tab.  
                    
                    This new logic will simply transfer a second sales rep to the order.

O-R-5-   12040904 E Add column on Orders Booked Report cerunf = fibre cerunc = fibre
                    New Toggle Box:  Print Avail Margin?
                    This will to Add  column on the O-R-5 report? 
                    
                    The Available Margin will replace the Profit Field.
                    
                    New Database field must be added called Available margin will need to be saved in the order line 
                    item.    The available margin will be obtained the same way the commission is obtained from the e
                    stimate when entering an order.  Therefore, whenever we add or change a line item via an estimate
                    , we must update the available margin.
                    
                    Once we have the available margin field on the order line, we can then print on any report.
                    Adding to report will take less than 4 hours with toggle box.
                    Majority of work is to add new database.
                    
                    ESP - New fields are oe-ordl.q-qty and oe-ord.t-fuel.

O-R-6-   01171403 E OR6 - Output to Excel Only   - Add Ship From Location
                    Export to Excel.
                    Add Field called WHSE
                    This is the Warehouse on the Bill of Lading.
                    For each Invoice, find the Bill of Lading Number, then Find the Warehouse on the Bill of Lading.
                    This is the SHIP FROM warehouse.
                    
                    1)  Invoice Post will transfer the Ship From Warehse to the Accounts Receivable History File.
                         If needed, the BOL Post will transfer to the O-B-1 BOL file.
                    
                    2)  OR6 Report will transfer Wareshouse directly from the A/R History File 
                    
                    3)  If Options 1 & 2 Above Require Less than 5 Hours, 
                         Then Write Utility to Update the SHIP FROM Whse in the A/R History File
                    
                    For each Item on an invoice, we must find the bill of lading number for each finished good item, 
                    then find the Warehouse on the bill of lading line..
                    It is possible to have multiple warehouse locations on 1 or more bill of ladings.
                    Invoices can be created by PO# or by Date Group.
                    This means that multiple bill of ladings can be combined to create 1 invoice.
                    That single invoice may have shipped from different warehouses.
                    Program will only print the first Warehouse from the first BOL for each invoice line when ,
                    
                    
                    
O-R-6-   02011209 E Commission Report by Board Cost to pull from Jobs Estimate#
O-R-6-   02031206 E Commission Report to Use FULL COST if Greater than Zero ($50 per Hour)
                    Distribution Logic New Toggle Box called Use FULL COST?  Y/N   on same line of Cost?
                    OR6 Run Commission Report 
                    Click Detailed
                    Click Cost?  Estimated Board or Order or FG for Finished Goods
                    
                    Place order for FG Item RSC7x7x7 and the Full Cost will display at $225.
                    The Job Cost or Purchase Cost will also display on the Order Items Folder. 
                    The Invoice will post both costs to the Accounts Receivable History File.
                    
                    When Printing the Commission Report.
                    If the toggle box Full Cost?  is Checked 
                    and the FULL COST >0 in the AR History File, 
                    then the FULL COST will be used in place of the existing invoice cost.
                    This will be used on the report Regardless of Cost Method selected.
                    
                    In summary, the commission report will be printed for a month.
                    Invoices will be for both packaging supply / distribution items as wel as manufactured goods.
                    If the FULL Cost > zero, this will print. (Packaging Supplies)
                    If the FULL Cost = 0 then the existing invoice cost will print. (Manufactured Goods)

O-S-1-   01191105 E Custom 856 Report
                    ESP 2/21/11 - Add to add new field to BOL posting, so old data won't work, only new BOLs going fo
                    rward.
                    
                    Metro needs a custom 856 shipment report.  It will be run from N-R and be called util\metro856.r.
                      The report will show the total shipments for a particular item on a particular day by utilizing
                     posted BOLs for that item and BOL date.
                    It will have the option to be generated as a csv file (output to Excel).
                    It will have a date field and an fg # item field.  It will remember the last parameter entered.
                    It will sort by Order # (Job #) and P.O. #.  So, if multiple jobs ship on the same day, it will s
                    how each job separately.
                    The report will show the following fields with the column headings:
                    Transaction Date
                    Transaction Time (find most recent shipment time)
                    Supplier Num (Hard Code 49783)
                    Product Num (Hard Code 04498051)
                    Supplier Product (itemfg.i-no)
                    Product Description (itemfg.i-name)
                    Purchase Order # (Customer PO from BOL)
                    P.O. Received Date (oe-boll.lot-code will store this)
                    Sales Order #
                    Ship Date
                    Expected Delivery Date (if ship-state = "PA" then ship-date + 1 else 
                    ship-date + 2)
                    Delivery Mode (Hardcode L)
                    Production Date (same way as done in Metro BOL)
                    
                    Expiry Date (ship-date + 358)
                    Shipped Quantity (sum of qty / 1000, for job, p.o. #)
                    Shipped_Quantity_UOM
                    Product_Price 
                    Transaction_Currency 
                    Customer_Name
                    Customer_Number
                    Customer_Address_1
                    Customer_Address_2
                    City
                    State
                    Postal_Code
                    Country_Code
                    Location_Code
                    EDI_Mailbox

O-S-1-   06071202 E N-K BOLQtyPopUp   New Parameter to Remove Message
                    N-K-1 BOLQtyPopup      This parameter is ideal for partial shipments.
                    For example you pack 3600 boxes per pallet.  Customer requests a shipment of 5600.
                    If you select two pallets, this will transfer a full pallet of 3600 and a partial pallet of 2000 
                    from a full 3600 pallet.
                    
                    Logical Value = YES will continue to display the Warning Message.
                    Warning Message  - Tag Qty exceeds BOL Qty.   Do you want to update BOL Qty?
                    
                    Logical Value = NO will not display the Warning Message.  
                    Therefore, if the user selects any tag number quantity, the system will simply accept the BOL qua
                    ntity regardless of the Bin or Tag Quantity.  
                    
                    For example, Order 205232 is order for 1,000.
                    I release 1000.   I select a Pallet Tag with a count of 25,000.
                    Program prompts to import tag and they answer YES.
                    That will immediately import the 1000 when Logical Value = NO.
                    If Log Value = YES, it will prompt to import the entire 25,000.
                    
                    Release was for 100 boxes which transfers to the Bill of Lading as quantity of 100. User clicks S
                    elect Bin/Tags and selects a pallet tag with 500 boxes in the Bin or Tag.
                    Program WILL NOT import the quantity of 500.
                    The quantity on the BOL will remain 100 without a warning message.

O-S-1-   08091102 E Print Icon not Printing Exception Report via O-S-5
                    N-K-1 BOLPost 
                    Character Value = Bin>Qty  
                    This requires the items on hand bin location quantity on hand must be equal or greater than the b
                    ill of lading quantity on hand for that Bill of Lading Job#, Warehouse and Bin location.      Thi
                    s stops a negatative on hand from occuring.
                    If Bill of Lading is greater than the Bill of Lading will not post until the item is corrected.
                    
                    The O-S-5 Menu will print an exception report when the inventory on hand is less than the quantit
                    y to ship on the bill of lading.    This is specific to Job#, Warehouse and Bin Location.
                    
                    This report only prints the finished goods items that are too low.
                    If a customer has 50 items on the bill of lading, it is important to point the customer to the on
                    ly item that must be fixed.   Normally, they just need to change a job number or bin location or 
                    maybe a tag number.    The O-S-5 works perfectly.   However, customers the use O-S-1 do not see t
                    he exception report so it is a friendly feature that we must move to O-S-1 Print Icon.
                    
                    
                    See Attached.
O-S-1-   10241106 E N-K BOLFreight     Bill of Lading Freight Calculated by Freight Class
                    N-K-1 BOLFreight.    
                    Calculate freight based on Customers Shipto Delivery Zone or finished goods item freight class.  
                     Differerent material such as Foam, ChipBoard and Corrugated Flute are used to produce the finish
                    ed goods items that have different freight classifications.  The customer shipto only supports on
                    e delivery zone.   However that same shipto may ship both chipboard and corrugated, thus the ship
                    to delivery zone is too limited.   The  Finished Goods Item file has a freight classification for
                     each item.  The freight classification is effectively the same as the delivery zone found in the
                     shipto file. 
                    
                    Character Value = Shipto Delivery Zone.    The existing logic, the freight cost for the bill of l
                    ading is calculated on the customer shipto delivery zone and the orders common carrier.  The devl
                    ivery zone is not housed on the order, release, bill of lading or invoice.  This is only housed i
                    n the customer Customers Shipto file which is used to calcualte the freight cost.  
                     
                    Character Value = FGFreightClass  =  The (A-F-8) carrier file's delivery zone and zip code that m
                    atches the Finished Goods Items Freight Class will be used to calculate the freight.   Once the I
                    tems BOL weight is determined, the carriers freight rate table is used to calculate the freight c
                    ost.   The freight cost will be calculated for each Finished goods items Freight Class rather the
                    n the Delivery Zone.   The freight class must match an existing delivery zone in the A-F-8 Truck-
                    Carrier File.    The existing logic to calculate freight cost will be used, HOWEVER a new program
                     will be created to look at each line item on the bill of lading to determine the Freight Class (
                    ie Delivery Zone).  Each line item will calculate the cost once the correct delivery zone is dete
                    rmined.  For example, an esitmate for Chipboard material may have the Inks/Pack folder delivery c
                    ode set to 55 whereas an estimate for Corrugated material such as 200C may have a delivery code o
                    f 100.    This delivery zone is transferred to the finished goods item file (I-F-1) freight class
                     field.   The existing logic will be copied to calculate freight based ont the items Freight Clas
                    s and item weight per 100 pounds (Wt/100).  
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
O-S-1-   12291105 E N-K BOLFreight   BOL Freight Calc by Frt Class (Old Task 10241106)
                    New N-K-1 BOLFreight.    Calculate freight based on Customers Shipto Delivery Zone or finished go
                    ods item freight class.   
                    
                    Differerent material such as Foam, ChipBoard and Corrugated Flute are used to produce the finishe
                    d goods items that have different freight classifications.  The customer shipto only supports one
                     delivery zone.   However that same shipto may ship both chipboard and corrugated, thus the shipt
                    o delivery zone is too limited.   The  Finished Goods Item file has a freight classification for 
                    each item.  The freight classification is effectively the same as the delivery zone found in the 
                    shipto file.

                    n the customer Customers Shipto file which is used to calcualte the freight cost.

O-S-3-   01191338 E N-K INVSTATUS - Invoice Status and Post Bills/Create Invoices One at T
                    New N-K-1 InvStatus.   
                    Logical Value = NO will continue to be existing Logic which creates all invoices as Released or H
                    OLD if  the A-F-1 Customer Invoice Method is set to GROUP by Date.    
                    
                    Logical Value = YES will activate this new Logic.
                    When Posting BOL's this will place all invoices to a Status of W for Waiting for Approval.  The O
                    nly exception will be HOLD status will continue to be set if the A-F-1 Customer Invoice Method is
                     set to GROUP by Date.   This will allow Sharp Shooter to Post Bill of Lading when Printing, ther
                    eby updating on hand inventory and creating Backorders immediately.   The O-B-1 HOLD/APPROVE butt
                    on will be modified to Release all Invoices with Status of W.  Users will find 1st Invoice with S
                    tatus of W and press Approve.
                    
                    Character Value = Blank or Batch will be existing logic for posting Bill of Ladings to Create Inv
                    oices which uses the Print Selection Screen for Range of Bill of Lading, Customers, etc.
                    
                    Character Value =  One BOL Only.   This will only allow the POST toggle Box or OS5 menu to post 1
                     Bill of Lading at a time.    The From and To Bill of Lading must Match in Character Value = One 
                    BOL ONly .   Print Option on the Menu O-S-1 via the Print ICON Post Toggle box.   O-S-3 Print Bil
                    l of Lading Post Toggle box and Sharp Shooter Print Bill of Lading Button to Allow only One Bill 
                    of Lading to Post.      Please note, N-K-1 SSBOLPrint parameter Integer Value = 1 will  Post the 
                    Bill of Lading during Sharp Shooter Printing BOL button.
                    
                    Currrently, problems occur when they accidently post more than one Bill of Lading Number.
                    Then they have to delete the Invoice to move it back to the bill of lading stage.
O-S-3-   01211009 E N-K BolFmt = Metro  (Copy Oracle)
                    Copy Oracle. Attached PDF showing the revised BOL.  The areas circled in red are new. 
                    1) Manufacture Date = Print the first finished goods receipt date on our BOL similar to I-R-2.
                    2) Trailer# =  Print Trailer Field from BOL Header
                    3) Seal # =  New field on BOL Header under Trailier.
                         12 characters with numbers and dashes, changes with every BOL.
                          (oe-bolh.airway-bill)
                    4) Net Weight =  Quantity of Each Line Item x Items Square Inches x Board Weight on Estimate.
                         FG Items Total folder houses the square inches.
                         BOL# will have Job#.  Job# will have FG Item and Board for that S/B.
                         RM Item for Board will have Basis Weight of Board (Weight per MSF)
                                   Therefore formula is 
                                   BOL Item Qty x Item Square Inches / 1000 = MSF
                                   The items MSF x Board Weight = Net Weight of Line Item.
                                   Grand Total all Line Items.
                    5) Gross Weight = Print BOL weight field listed on BOL Header.
                    6) Bottom of the BOL note:  
                         "All claims must be made within 30 days..." to read "10 days" instead.
                    (7) The attached PDF shows a new field entitled, "Ship From", which is circled in red. 
                    Add this field to the BOL, and display the warehouse location where the shipment is originating f
                    rom (MAIN, POMPT, CLIF, etc.).

                    (9)  Change Column Heading, Carrier, to Carrier / SCAC. (stands for Standard Carrier Alpha Code

O-S-3-   02261015 E N-K BOLFMT = PremierX   Change Columns to Match Premier BOL

                    s required column fields of data.   The PremierX form uses Xprint and is the nice desired format.
                      However, the columns on Premier BOL must be duplicated on the PremierX format.

                    Body of Columns should be
                    Item#/Order#    
                    PO#/Job#   
                    Cust Part# / Description   (Description is Item Name, Description 1, Description 2.
                    Units        (Total Units for Same Quantity) 
                    Per Unit  (Quantity per Unit)
                    Total       Total Item Quantity.
                    
                    
                    For example, if they shipped 10 units with 500 per unit and 2 with 400. This would read.
                    Units   Per Unit      Total
                    10         500
                    2           400              5,800

                    n the overrun% is exceeded.  See task 04111102.
                    
                    
                    ASI Response.
                    Logic will be added to Not Print BOL on HOLD
                    A bill of lading cannot be posted unless printed.
                    A bill of lading that is on hold cannot be printed.
                    Therefore reprinting a posted bill of lading must have been approved in order to post.

O-S-3-   06301406 E N-K BolFmt = CapitolBC   Copy ConsBox and Add new Page with BarCodes
                    N-K-1 BolFmt - CapitolBC    (This will be used on the VIEW FORM tab)
                    Quote Excludes Bag/Label Page Attached)
                    New Form will utilize XPRINT with Xprint Bar Codes.
                    All bar codes shall be Code 3 of 9, also known as Alpha39, Code 39, Code 3/9, Type 39, USS Code 3
                    9, or USD-3. There must be at least a  inch gap between the barcode and any border on the shippi
                    ng label. 
                    1) Copy ConsBox bill of Lading Format and use Capitol Container, Alabama Logo
                         This format will continue to print.
                    2) New CapitialBC form will print summary page as an Additional Page 
                        that summarizes the BOL Lines.   Heading with Bar Codes will be:
                        a)  Packing List#    =  Bill of Lading Number
                        b) Release#            =  Release# on the O-S-1 Bill of Lading Screen
                        c)  PO#                      =  1st BOL Lines Customer PO#
                        d)  ASN#   (Sequential Number starting at the number from field NK1 BolFmt Dec Value)
                                          Logic to use the DECIMAL value from N-K-1 BolFmt View Form.
                                          The VIEW FORM by customer dictates the ASN#.   
                                         Only customers defined on the NK1 BolFmt View Form will increment this ASN#.
                    
                                         ASN# must be Incremented by 1 for each Bill of Lading Printed.
                                         For Example.  NK1 BOlFmt View From Customer = Rheem and Dec Value = 100.
                                         The 1st printed BOL with status of Unprinted will print ASN# 100.
                                         Each BOL for Rheem should have a new ASN# incremented by 1.
                                        The Printing of the BOL will increment this number when BOL Status is UNPRINT
                    ED.
                                        REPRINTING the Bill of Lading  will not increment this Number.
                                        Each client that is defined on the VIEW form can have a unique internal numbe
                    r.
                    3)  Body of Form will print Bar Codes for Follwoing  (See attached)
                         a)  Customer Part#
                         b)  Quantity Shipped
                         c)   UOM

O-S-4-   08131008 E N-K BORelDate?  Back Order release Date?
                    N-K BORelDate?  Back Order release Date?
                    
                    Character Value = Today   When a backorder is created, the release date defaults to today's date.
                       This is the existing logic prior to this modification.
                    
                    Character Value = Release Date  The release created for the Backorder will have the same date as 
                    the original release date.  For example, customer loads an order today that is due Monday, and ca
                    nnot get all of the order on one trailer so a Backorder is created. 
                    However, the Release date of the Backorder shows as today. 
                    Customer wants the default date to be Monday. 
O-S-5-   02081203 E Florida Tax Calculation via Post BOL/Create Invoice for   ($50 per Hou
                    Invoice Creation and O-B-1 Total Tax Logic  (See Attached)
                    1)  Add new field in I-F-1 called Tax Status (X5)   = FL for Florida Tax Logic.  On Top Line.
                    
                    O-B-1 via O-S-5 will have new FLORIDA tax calculation per Invoice Line item for any one item that
                     is more than $5,000 if Tax Status = FL.   The Dollar Threshold will be in the Tax Table.
                    For example, the 1st 5000 is taxed at the rate of all tax codes in the tax table i.e. 7%.  1st Ta
                    x Code = county (in our case it is 1% but some counties are 1.5%. )  The 2nd Tax Code is the Stat
                    e Code of 6%.   The remaining cost over the $5000.00 is taxed only at the State 6% state rate whi
                    ch will be the 2nd Tax Code in the Tax Table.   ASI Tax file allows up to 3 tax codes per Tax Gro
                    up.   Florida needs just two Tax Codes.  If an item is taxed and new Tax Status is FL then the Do
                    llar Limit will be utilized in the Calculation.
                    
                    Logic would be:
                    Charge both FL rate of 6% and TMP Rate of 1% up to $5000
                    After $5,000 we apply only the 1% FL tax after $5000
                    
                    For example, If you sell them 1000 boxes at $6.00 each it adds up to $6000 but is not eligible.  
                    
                    If you sell them 1 stretch wrapper machine at $6000.  It is eligible for tax.  It will have code 
                    = FL, 
                    In the case of the pallet wrapper sold here in Pinellas County with a 7% sales tax, the 1st 5000 
                    would be taxed at 7% and the remaining $1000. Would be taxed at the state rate of 6%.
                    All of Florida has a 6% rate, counties have the jurisdiction to add additional.
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 186

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    
                    See ASI Order 204101.
                    FG Item TAPE MACHINE = Logical Value STEP = YES.
                    Tape machine is $7500 x 2 = $15,000
                    The Tax File = FL1 has two tax rates.
                    The Last Tax Line for FL shows the Threshhold Dollars = $5,000 
                    Calculation is as follows:
                    1st $5000 x all tax rates + Invoice Total less Threshold x Tax Rate for 1st Tax Code Only.
                    ie.
                    $5000 x (FL tax of 6% + TMP tax of 1%) =  $350 + ($15,000 - $5000 x FL Tax of 6% = $600).
                    Total $950
                    Jeanne Abbo
                    Melco
                    727-573-1822 x107
                    727-572-8705 (fax)

O-S-5-   03071207 E Post BOL / Create Invoice  (Round Down Invoice Qty for Unassembled Set
                    Invoice Qty for Unassembled sets is currently.  You ship each component separately.
                    Our system automatically creates invoice for the minimum number of sets.
                    For example   ASI Order 203608 is a 24 Pack Beverage Set
                    See Attached Example.  For 1 RSC ,  5 Length Partitions,  3 Width Partitions
                    We produce and Ship 1100 RSC?s, 5298 Widths and 3500 Lengths.
                    Max sets is 1100 /1 = 1100 or 5298/5 = 1059.6 or 3500/3 = 1166, Thus can only make 1059.6
                    We cant make less then 1 full set so we create invoice for 1059 Sets if we Round Down.
                    However, system is currently rounding Up.
                    Invoice for  1060 is  possible because the smallest overrun is the 5300 over 5000 ordered. 5300/5
                    =1060. 
                    
                    But if we shipped 5298 Widths then 5298/5=1059.6 Sets. 
                    The software should round down to 1059. 
                    
                    Qty / Set for each item determines the number of completed sets.
                    RSC Qty/Set = 1  , thus 1100 / 1 = 1100
                    Length Partition Qty/Set = 3, thus 3500 / 3 = 1166.67 Round Down = 1166
                    Width Partition Qty/Set = 5, thus 5298 / 5 = 1059.6  Round Down = 1059
                    
                    So Max Number of Set is Part with Least Number = 1059
                    Note the Estimate shows 1060
                    
O-S-5-   04161205 E N-K BOLTransfer    YES will Post BOL for Transfer to Create Backorder
                    New N-K-1 BOLTransfer for Release Transfers.  
                    Please note, a transfer release has a release type = T.  
                    See Attached Order 204303 which creates a backorder for the unshipped quantity.
                    Attached Order 204304 is for a transfer however, no backorder was created.
                    
                    Logical Value = No.  This is the existing logic which will not create a backorder release.
                    
                    Logical Value = Yes.   When the bill of lading is posted, if the bill of lading quantity is less 
                    then the release quantity then the program will create an extra release (a backorder release).
                    For example if we create a Transfer and we shipped only 25,000 of the 35,000 boxes, then the prog
                    ram would automatically create a backorder release for 10,000 with a release status of Ship Only 
                    and Transfer.    New Option would receate this every time.
                    Once the backorder is created, reports such as O-R-2 would print this automatically.
                    
                    
                    Please note, the bill of lading posting creates a transfer transaction under I-U-2 finished goods
                     transfers.  If this transaction is deleted, the program moves the record back to the bill of lad
                    ing.
                    If the N-K-1 BOLTransfer logical value = YES,   then the program must also DELETE the newly creat
                    ed release when the I-U-2 record is deleted.
O-S-5-   05301401 E N-K OEShipToRep    Transfer Sales Rep to Estimate and Order?

                    TacoBell has a Sales Rep = 001.
                    TacoJoes is a Shipto Code for Taco Bell with a Sales Rep = CMB.
                    
                    Logical Value = NO.    This is the existing Logic.
                    This willl transfer the Customer Sales Rep Field to the Estimate and to the Order.
                    And this will also transfer to the Orders ITEMS tab.
                    
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 187

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    Logical Value = YES.   New Database Field will be aded to the Shipto File.
                    This willl transfer the new Sales Rep Field from the Ship to File to the Estimate.
                    Therefor, this  transfers the new Sales Rep from the Estimate if order has an Estimate.
                    This will transfer the new Sales Rep from ShipTo file when FG Item on Order has no Estimate.
                    Once ITEMS tab has new Sales Rep, Commissions Logic will calculate for that Rep.
                    Existing Logic will then transfer the Sales Rep from Order Line to the Invoice when BOL is Posted
                     so that the invoice will be sent to TACO BELL but for TACOJOES sales Rep.
                    
                    Please note,  This will not handle multiple shiptos on a single order.
                    Program will only transfer 1 Sales Rep to the Items Tab.
O-S-5-   06211301 E BOL Post - Bill of Lading Number is not Saved
                    Bill of Lading Number is Not Saved.
                    Many Clients default from 1 to 99999999.
                    However, this is no longer saved by User Id.
                    
                    
                    Also,  Posting is much slower with new Patch.
                    When Clicking YES to Post.
                    Add Line at Bottom to show the BOL# that is posting.
                    Currently this shows message Not Responding when in Reality it is still working.
                    The status line will let users see that program is progressing through BOL numbers.
                    Similar to I-R-2 Report that shows Items in Process.
                    
                    We must speed program.
                    Updating Actual Qty appears to have slowed software.
                    Process of updating Finsihed Goods should be evavualted.
                    
                    
                    
O-S-5-   06241304 E BOL Post - Speed is Slow  (Send Entire Patch)

O-S-5-   08301102 E N-K BOLTime   New Parameter to post Time of Invoice Creation
                    N-K-1 BolPostTime.
                    
                    The purpose of this modification to to make sure that the bill of ladings posted each day are the
                     last transaction of the day.  The customer may create and post the bill of lading before they re
                    ceive and post the finised goods receipts.   By forcing the time as the last second of the day, t
                    his will ensure that all receipts will show in history prior to the shipment.
                    
                    Character Value = BolCreation is the existing logic.   The date and time the bill of lading was c
                    reated displays on the O-S-1 Screen when the invoice is created.   If the bill of lading was crea
                    ted on August 1 at 11 AM.  the Finished Goods History would retain that date and time.    The bil
                    l of lading screen would retain the original creation date and time when the bill of lading is po
                    sted.
                    
                    Character Value = Fixed Time.   
                    The decimal value will house the time of day such as 2359:00.    The bill of lading posting progr
                    am will downlown the time as 23:59:00 .  The date will continue to be the same date as the bill o
                    f lading.   The finished good history folder will show the date on the bill of lading by the time
                     will be set to the time on the decimal value.

                    This message pops up to print the exception report.

O-S-7-   10220904 E TruckLoad Program to Prompt when Over MSF and Tonage
                    Prompt on Truck Summary Work Table when exceeding the 
                    New Table Called Truck as child of Carrier Table
                    New Fields in Truck Table Max units: 99, MSF and Weight Limit: 99999
                    
                    1) Add new fields to the OS7 truck summary table.
                      Item MSF, Item Wt,  Truck Load MSF,  Truck Load Wt
                         Add Items MSF by Release Qty which is the quantity of the items times the FG Item Totals Squ
                    are  Footage / 1000
                    2) Add items Weight in Tons.  This is FG Item file Wt/100 times (qty / 100)
                    3) Add  Total Truck Load MSF  
                    4) Add Total Truck Load Weight in Tons.  
                    
                    When the MSF for all deliveries exceeds the Max MSF in the truck file,  Prompt Warning.
                    When the total Tons exceeds the Max Tons in the Truck File, Prompt Warning.

                    This repeats the Main and Floor Location for every Tag#.

                    The issues is that they are now creating pallet tags for each receipt.
                    The current Release Ticket does not print tag Numbers but prints the location of each tag.

                    ges.

                    Please note, Advantzware allows multiple line items.
                    It is possible to have a separate customer PO for each Line item.
                    Hence, you may need to add Many Purchase Order Attachments for one order.

                    Must Ship All Order COD will not have an Order Number

                    -1.

                    Release for the same item may ship from different warehouse locations.
                    In addition, there may be 2 releases for same FG item, however,
                    Release Line 1 may be set to ship from Premier Manufacturing Plant.
                    Release Line 2 may be set to ship from Premier Warehouse.
                    Regardless of scenarios, the releases will only combine items with identical Shipto, Ship Date an
                    d Ship From Warehouse.

O-U-1-   03031108 E N-K OEPrepTaxCode?    Use Unique Tax Code for PREP ?
                    New fields in customer file called cust.spare-char-1= tax prep code & oe-ordm.spare-char-1= tax p
                    rep code
                    
                    Logical Value = No will not transfer the Tax code from the Customers Tax Prep Code.
                    
                    Logical value = Yes will use the Tax Prep Code? in the customer file.  
                    When Customer File has Tax Prep Code defined, this Tax Code will transfer to the Orders MISC fold
                    er and set the MISC taxable field to YES regardless of Customer Shipto Taxable Toggle or Customer
                     View Taxable Field.   If this is Blank, then the Orders VIEW screen Tax Code will display on MIS
                    C Folder.
                    
                    Prep (Misc Folder of Order) such as plates are not shipped to the customer but normally used in t
                    he manufacturing plant for making the boxes.  Thus when billing customers for PREP, the tax code 
                    should be based on the Tax Prep Code on the location of the manufacturing plant.
                    
                    The Customer and Shipto Taxable fields are used for Finished Goods Items.
                    Customer could be set as Non Taxable for FG Items, but Taxable for PREP.
                    The TOTALS folder of the Order will be increased by this taxable dollars.
                    The O-S-5 Invoice Creation will calculate the Invoice based on Prep Tax vs FG Item Tax.
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
O-U-1-   03071204 E New Credit Hold Status
                    Need new SPARE field for Customer Order Status Hold.
                    We have a status field at top right of the order screnned.
                    This is automatically changed to H for HOLD for credit hold when credit or invoice due dates are 
                    exceeded.   Customer wants new status for HOLD that they can manually change.
                    New HOLD Button at bottom of View Order Folder which will change the status to HOLD.
                    
                    AO = Active Order = Order is open, everything good to go
                    PA = Price Approval Needed= everything including shipping is allowed except for                  
                                                                       invoicing, price must be approved first
                    OH = Order Hold = nothing can continue with the order due to any reason other than credit
                    CH = Credit Hold = nothing can continue with the order due to credit
                    MH = Manufacturing Hold = order can be entered, 
                                                                          purchasing can be done but cannot be conver
                    ted
                    SH = Shippiing Hold = order can be entered, purchasing can be done, 
                                                                     product can be converted but not shipped
                    FO = Finished Order & Closed = order is complete, shipped and invoiced
                    CA = Cancelled  Order = order is cancelled
                    NC = Non Compliance Issue Reported  = there is a NCR issue with the order
                    LO = Late Order =   Information Only.
                                                            Used by the expeditor to indicate that the customer has b
                    een called 
                                                              and informed that the order is late.
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    Perhaps we should use the N-C change User Group Field.
                    New Group called 
                    ORDER STATUS HOLD
                    Then they can enter the Status Types
                    P = Sell Price Hold, C = Credit Limit Hold, O=Order Limit Hold, S= Shipping Hold, I = Invoice Hol
                    d, etc.   This will be available on an F1 Lookup.
O-U-1-   03111308 E N-K OECustPart#    Integer Value = 1 to Update FG Item View Part#
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 198

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    N-K OECustPart#.   
                    When creating a new Finished Goods Item, the Customer Part # from the order is always copied to t
                    he View Items Tab.   However, adding existing items to an order the logical value and integer val
                    ue will dictate the update method.  
                    The I-F-1 Totals/CP# tab can house uniquie part numbers per customer for the same finished goods 
                    item.  Orders may exist for a customer with an old customer part#.  When a new orders is added, t
                    he customer part number will import from the items Totals/CP# tab for that customer or from the I
                    -F-1 View Item Tab.  If the customer part number is changed when adding the item to the new order
                    , the logical value and integer value dictate how to update the part#.
                    
                    Logical Value = YES.  ADD button in Order Entry and change the Customer Part#.  If a part# exists
                     on the Totals/CP# tab for this customer, THEN the program will update the Totals/CP# tab for tha
                    t Customer's Part Number and will also update all the existing orders customer part number   The 
                    net result is that the customer's part number will be the same throughout all open and closed ord
                    ers.   Please note, a unique part# for this Customer must exist on the I-F-1 Total/CP# for existi
                    ng orders to be updated.   
                    
                    Logical Value = NO, the Update button in Order Entry will NOT update the Customer Part# on the To
                    tals Folder for that Finished Goods Item Code.   Therefore, existing orders will not be updated e
                    ither.   The net result, the new order will have a different Part# existing orders for the same f
                    inished goods item code.  This allows customer service to change the Part# on an order without im
                    pacting existing orders. 
                    
                    Integer Value = 0 Will NOT Update Customer Part# on the I-F-1 Finished Goods  Items View Folder. 
                      
                    
                    Integer Value = 1 WILL update the Customer Part# on the I-F-1 Finished Goods Item View Folder.  T
                    his will synchronized the customer part number on the order and the finished goods item file.
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
O-U-1-   03111404 E Release Button Logic for Orders on Credit Hold
                    See Attached O-F-2 Order Control File.
                    When O-F-2 Field called Print Release Ticket is Checked.
                    Current Logic will allow printing a Release Ticket when the Order is on Hold. 
                    Current Logic will not allow creating the Release when the Order is on Hold.
                    
                    New Logic when Order is on HOLD
                    1)  Change Lable O-F-2  Release/Print Pick Tickets.
                    2)   When Order is on Hold and O-F-2 field is Checked.
                           New Logic will allow printing a Release Ticket when the Order is on Hold. 
                           New Logic will allow creating the Release when pressing Release Button.
                    3)   When Order is on Hold and O-F-2 field is UnChecked.
                           New Logic will NOT allow printing a Release Ticket when the Order is on Hold. 
                           New Logic will NOT allow creating the Release when the Order is on Hold.
                    In Summary, 
                    If Order is on Hold,  
                    If Field is Checked, the Release Ticket can be Printed, It can also be Released.
                    If Field is Unchecked, Release Cannot Printed and Release cannot beCreated .
                    ie.  Release Buttons will show message.  Sorry Order is on HOLD.

O-U-1-   04011103 E N-K RelType Release Type Default by Customer  (Cont Servive  PO# 26529
                    N-K-1 RelType    Default Release Type by Customer when pressing the ADD BUTTON.
                    Also, then N-K-1 OERELEAS Logical Value = YES, creates release when adding an order.  this must s
                    earch new N-K-1 RelType if Logical = YES.
                    
                    Logical Value = NO will not use this logic.    This will use existing logic for new orders.
                    Releases are currently automatically created with the status of "B" (Both, Ship and Invoice).  
                    When N-K-1 OERelease the release is automatically created during order entry.
                    This is via adding order with an estimate or without an estimate and when adding items on the ITE
                    MS folder.
                    
                    Logical Value = YES will use the character values in the View Form to set the release type by Cus
                    tomer and View Control  to set Release Type as Default.
                    
                    VIEW CONTROL & VIEW FORM Character Values =  Valid Types are Ship Only,  Transfer,  Bill &Ship,  
                     Invoice Only.    When value is Ship Only then the letter S will transfer to the Release Folder. 
                     When value is Invoice Only then the letter I will transfer to the Release Folder.  When value is
                     Bill & Ship then the letter B will transfer to the Release Folder.  
                    When value is Transfer Only then the letter T will transfer to the Release Folder.  
                    
                    VIEW CONTROL Character value will be default for all customers not defined on the VIEW FORM  when
                     logical value = YES.
                    
                    VIEW FORM Character value will allow adding CUSTOMERS to set a release type such as SHIP ONLY.  T
                    his will be the priority when Logical Value  is YES.   If customer is note defined, thent he VIEW
                     CONTROL character value will set the release type.
O-U-1-   04071010 E Sell Price Toggle Box for $ 0 Sell Price   ($75/Hour via Task# 0331101
                    1)   Add new toggle box next to SELL PRICE on release folder. 
                          (reftable "oe-rel.sell-price" val[2] 0 is no 1 is yes)

                              invoice.

O-U-1-   04171308 E N-K OEFGADD   Logical Value = YES to Creating New FG Items
                    Control Parameter called N-K-1 OEFGADD 
                    Security Program named OEFGADD under Program Master
                    
                    Advantzware will always create new finished goods items from estimates that do not have an Item c
                    ode on the estimate.   However, when adding orders without an estimate number, order entry allows
                     creating new  finished goods during order entry.  This may result in customer service creating f
                    inished goods items by mistake.    For example, the user may type an order quantity in the Finish
                    ed Goods Item Code by accident.  The Program Prompts to Create and Item.
                    
                    Logical Value = YES   Program will prompt to create FG Item Master in the I-F-1 Item File.
                    However, message will only display the Prompt to add a new FG item if their USER ID is on the Pro
                    gram Master Security Program name OEFGADD.
                    
                    Logical Value = NO,  Program will not Prompt to create a new FG Item i f this item does not exist
                     in the finished goods file.

O-U-1-   06141008 E Pallet Position Field as Maximize Allowed Pallets in Warehouse
                    I) Add Toggle Box in customer file called " Pallet Positions" (9999) are assigned to a customer
                    II)  When adding an order (changed to add or update order)
                        A)  If  Pallet Positions (9999) box in the customer file = zero, 
                              then continue with order as normal
                        B)  If  Pallet Positions (9999) box in the customer file greater than zero
                             1) and Inventory Item File Field "Stocked" is not checked continue with order as normal
                             2) and Inventory Item File Field "Stocked" is checked THEN
                                  a)  System calculate total pallets on hand for this customer for "Stocked items"
                                  b)  System calculate total pallets for open orders for this customer "Stocked items
                    "
                                  c)  If the total number of pallet positions for  "Stocked items" for this customer
                                        exceeds (total number of pallets in inventory + the total number of open orde
                    rs)  
                                        Then, Order will be placed on hold, with following message.
                                         Customers Total Pallets for Stocked Items exceeds Approved Pallet Positions
