O-U-1-   07091302 E N-K-1 JobCardC = TriLakes2 to Print New DB Field On O-U-1 Items Tab
                    New Logic is for   N-K-1 Schedule   Character Value = NoDate
                    
                    Currently Job Tickets print the Production Date from the View Order Tab.
                    The Production Date prints on the Job Ticket.
                    However, many orders do not have an estimate or job on the View Order Tab.
                    Each Estimate on the ITEMS tab may have a unique Job Start Date.
                    
                    Solution.
                    1) New Job Start Date Field  (See Attached)
                    2) Updating Job Start Date on Items Tab WILL NOT update Job Start Date in J-U-1
                    3) Updating Job Start Date on J-U-1 will search Order Number and Update O-U-1 Items Tab.
                    4) Updating Production Date on O-U-1 Production Date will Have new Prompt.
                         Update All Items?   Yes will update Job Start Date on O-U-1 Items Tab 
                    5) O-U-1 Items Job Start Date will Update All ITEMS simultaneousely that are on the Job.
                         For example, sets, tandems, combo jobs and 2 piece boxes will update all O-U-1 Lines.
                    6) Job Ticket will be modified to print Job Start Date from J-U-1 in Place of Production Date via
                          O-U-1 View Order Tab.
                    
                    
                    J-U-1 Job Start Date and Route Tab Tab will not be updated via this Task.

O-U-1-   07151010 E N-K OEFGItem#  Character Value = Hughes
                    Current logic is to increment ending numbers for each new item by customer.
                    This creates an item number such as BIBM1000041A99
                    B represents the first letter of the product category.
                    The next six to eight characters is the customer code.
                    The next digits are sequential number.   (This will end at all 999999)
                    Next Letter is a Default of the letter A.   (New logic when number is A999999 to change to B)
                    The last 3 digits are A99 for a single item estimate or A00 and A01, A02 for set and set parts.
                    
                    Therefore, if all numbers after customer code and before the letter A are 9's.
                    There change letter to a B and start sequence with 00001.
                    
                    
                    Please note, customer code size determines how maximum number of sequential numbers.
                    
                    ESP - BJ said not to do it that way because A,B, etc. represent revision #s.  Discussing with the
                    m how to solve problem.
O-U-1-   07181203 E On Order and Allocated Quantities for Components  (Cust Part# Miller 6
                    ON ORDER = Jobs or PO Quantity on Order Less FG Receipts.
                    QTY ALLOCATE = Order Qty Less Shipment.Button
                    O-U-1 and I-F-1 the Quanitites Components must explode the components of  Sets.
                    Each set has a tab called PARTS which has the Qty/Set and FG Items required to build a SET.
                    The components Allocated Qty Allocated must be exploded by multipling the Set FG  Items Order Qty
                     times Component Parts Qty per Set.   
                    
                    The Components ON ORDER quantity is not currently working because the Job File only shows the Set
                     Header.   This should work for both Assembled and Unassembled Sets.
                    Each components Jobs On Order must be exploded by multipling the Set FG  Items Job Qty times Comp
                    onent Parts Qty per Set Less Jobs Receipts.  Purchase Orders for Sets will also multiple by the Q
                    ty/Set for each Component less the PO Receipt of the Set.   Purchase Orders for Components will n
                    ot multiply the qty/set.    
                    
                    Find ASI Order 204800. for UnAssembled Set item Matt21-8853  (Cust Part# Miller 64)
                    This has 1 RSC, 2 Length Partitions and 3 Width Partitions.
                    The Order is for 5000 sets with 10% overrun.

                    value.   Save will not allow saving a customer code to view form unless Character Value = SamePO#
                    Only.   This logic will be work exactly like View Control logic however, program will check by sp
                    ecific Customer,Shipto and Date.   Thus certain customers will only allow combining releases for 
                    the same PO#, therefore, if the customer code is defined on the View Control and View Control Cha
                    racter Value is SamePO#Only, then release will ONLY be combined for this customer if the same PO#
                    , same shipto and same release date exist.     If the customer code does not exist on VIEW FORM t
                    hen the existing logic will be used on the View Control Screen.

                    YES will trigger the prompt to add to printed release.  NO, will not prompt or merge to printed r
                    elease.

                    t with the same customer and shipto address with the same date.  If an actual release exists unde
                    r O-T-1, the system prompts to combine this release regardless if the PO#'s are different.

O-U-1-   09131306 E Release Unassembled Set to Automatically Create Component Releases
                    See Attached.   New Logic for ADD button for UnAssembled Sets.
                    User cannot add Release for Unassembled Sets.   Only Components can be Releases.
                    ADD Button will prompt Message?
                    
                    Set Quantity to Create Component Releases?  YES
                    Shipto Code            XXXXXXXX
                    Set Qty                       999,999
                    Set Release Date 99/99/99    
                    Customer PO#        ABCDEFGHIJKLMNO   (15 Characters) 
                    Replace Existing Date ? Y/N
                                                                                 Proceed?  YES,  NO   CANCEL.
                    
                    Yes will automatically, create a new Release for Each Component.
                    Each Component Release Qty will be Set Qty x Qty per Set from Set Parts Tab.
                    For Example, Release 1000 Miller Sets Above will create the Following: 
                    Release for 1000 RSC (Qty/Set = 1)
                    Release for 5000 Width Partitions   (Qty/Set = 5)
                    Release for 3000 Length Partitions (Qty/Set = 3)

                    e Release and Add new Release for new Release Qty for Each Component.

                    1) New Job Start Date Field  (See Attached)
                    2) Updating Job Start Date on Items Tab WILL NOT update Job Start Date in J-U-1
                    3) Updating Job Start Date on J-U-1 will search Order Number and Update O-U-1 Items Tab.
                    4) Updating Production Date on O-U-1 Production Date will Have new Prompt.
                         Update All Items?   Yes will update Job Start Date on O-U-1 Items Tab 
                    5) O-U-1 Items Job Start Date will Update All ITEMS simultaneousely that are on the Job.
                         For example, sets, tandems, combo jobs and 2 piece boxes will update all O-U-1 Lines.
                    6) Job Ticket will be modified to print Job Start Date from J-U-1 in Place of Production Date via
                          O-U-1 View Order Tab.
                    
                    
                    J-U-1 Job Start Date and Route Tab Tab will not be updated via this Task.
O-U-1-   10031407 E N-K OEPriceMatrixCheck    Log Value = Yes will Confirm Quantity
                    Logical Value = NO will not prompt.
                    
                    Logical Value = YES  will prompt warning message.
                    Quantity Ordered by Customer does not Match Quantity in Price Matrix for this Customer.
                    Please Press Matrix Tab to Confirm Pricing.
                    
                    SAVE button on Item Tab for Orders without Estimates.
                    Will search O-F-3 Price Matrix for FG Item matching the FG Item on the Order.
                    If quantity on order matches a quantity on the matrix, there will be no warning.
                    If quantity on order DOES NOT match a quantity on the matrix, the warning will display.
                    
                    "Quantity Ordered by Customer does not Match Quantity in Price Matrix for this Customer.
                    Please Press Matrix Tab to Confirm Pricing."

                    the item code defined in the N-K-1 FGMASTER character value when creating a new FG item code when
                     adding new orders from an estimate.  Also, when adding a new finished goods item from I-F-1 or v
                    ia O-U-1.
                    
                    Logical Value = YES   will use new logic to find the Freight Class.
                    The A-F-7 must have all the possbile Freight Classes for all truck companies. 
                    The A-F-1 customer file must have the appropriate carrier defined such as FEDX.  
                    The delivery zones in the truck matrix tab under A-F-8 Truck/Carrier file must be be defined with
                     the Freight Class codes for each trucking company.  For example, the Truck Code = FEDX will have
                     delivery zones for each zip code defined as 55, 70, 100 and 150. In addition, each zip code must
                     be defined under the appropriate delivery zone with the freight rate cost.  When adding an estim
                    ate, the delivery zone and zip code will transfer to the estimates Inks/Packs Folder and used to 
                    calculate the cost of freight. When adding an order from an estimater, a new finished goods item 
                    code will be created and the estimate will transfer the delivery zone to the new items Freight Cl
                    ass Field.    
                    
                    
                    POSTING releases will create a bill of lading and calculate the freight based on freight class.  
                    When updating a bill of lading and changing the quantity on a bill of lading line, the freight co
                    st will be recalculated.

O-U-1-   11021216 E N-K OEAutoPO & AutoPrep Security ($20,000 Contract)
                    New Security P rogram for each of the following N-K-1 Parameters.
                    
                    N-K-1 OEAutoPO -   Board PO
                    Option to secure this program by user ID.  Currently, when Character Value = Auto or AuotRM, the 
                    program will prompt the order entry person to create a purchase order for board material.  This i
                    s a useful option that will save time.  However, only purchase agents should have this option.  N
                    ew security will only allow Buyers to see this prompt so that they can create  PO in seconds.   S
                    imply find order line, click update and save and system will prompt to create PO.
                    
                    N-K-1 OEAutoFG - FG PO
                    Option to secure this program by user ID.  Currently, when logical value = YES, the program will 
                    prompt the order entry person to create a purchase order for finished goods items below the reord
                    er level.  This is a useful option that will save time.  However, only purchase agents should hav
                    e this option.  New security will only allow Buyers to see this prompt so that they can create PO
                     fro finished goods in seconds. Simply find order line, click update and save and system will pro
                    mpt to create PO.
                    
                    N-K-1 OEAutoPrep - PREP PO
                    Option to secure this program by user ID.  Currently, when logical value = YES, the program will 
                    prompt the order entry person to create a purchase order for preparation materials such as plates
                     and dies. This is a useful option that will save time.  However, only purchase agents should hav
                    e this option.  New security will only allow Buyers to see this prompt so that they can create pu
                    rchase orders for prep materials in seconds.
                    Simply find order line, click update and save and system will prompt to create PO.

                    Logical Value = NO will not create Transfer Order.

                    Create Transfer Order for Components of Set ?   NO will Cancel,

                    All FG items will have Release creates with Release Type = T for Transfer.

                    All Component for Assembled Sets will be added to new Order.
                    The quantity of each Component will be the SET Order Qty x Components Quantity per Set

                    another Order identical to ASI Order  205613 as follows::
                    10,000 RSC item MIller Lite S01
                    50,000 Width Partitions Item MIller Lite S02
                    30,000 Length Partitions Item MIller Lite S03
                    When Creating the Releases for Components, the system will prompt for SHIPTO Location.

                    r, the order will not have an estimate or job created.  
                    Southpak will create new jobs as each release date approaches.   On the release screen, add new b
                    utton called ADD JOB will create a job with the release line highlighted. Only releases with stat
                    us of "L"ate, "S"cheduled, "A"ctual, "B"ackordered or "I"nvoiceable will create Jobs.   The ESTIM
                    ATE number on the finished goods file will be used to the create the job, however the job quantit
                    y will transfer from the release quantity.   Purchase Orders for material will be generated as no
                    rmal via the N-K-1 OEAUTOPO.

O-U-1-   12070905 E Add Freight payment method to release screen on order
                    Freight payment method modifiable by release.  See attached fields
                    1. Add new database fields on the release folder called Freight Pay and FOB (Origin or Dest).
                    2. User may change this field to "P"repaid, "C"ollect, "B"ill or "T"hird Party.
                    3. The Release Post OT4 logic must be modified to transfer the new database field if changed.
                         a. Only if this field is defined will this transfer from the Release folder to BOL.
                         b. If this new field is blank, the Freight Payment will continue to transfer from the VIEW F
                    older.
                    4. The system will transfer the freight payment code from the first item on the bill of lading.
                         Please note, there is only 1 freight payment per bill of lading.
                         However, there may be many line items on an order or a bill of lading.
                         Therefore, multiple items exist may have different freight payment status.
                         When a release is created with multiple items from 1 or more orders and multiple 
                         freight payment codes exist on the release folders, 
                         For example, bill of lading is created with 2 orders and 3 line items.
                         Order 100 has item 6x6x6 and the release paymen is BILL 
                        And order number 100 has item 7x7x7 with a release payment is PREPAID.
                        And order number 200 has item 8x8x8 and release payment is COLLECT.
                      . System will prompt,  Transfer Freight Payment Code as ?????????.  
                        Default to 1st but user can change.
                    4. Bill of Lading Post will update the Freight Payment Status of each Posted Release. 
                    5\ Please note,  When changing BOL Number for multiple BOL's This will combine BOLs into 1      B
                    OL.  Release should not combine unlike Freight Terms
                        Must be same shipto, customer and freight terms
                         Prompt is Freight Terms are not the same.
                    8. The freight Payment defined on the Bill of Lading will transfer to the Invoice.
                    
                    *** Changes to Inquiries and Forms are not included in this quote.

O-U-4-   08131411 E N-K AckMaster - Char Value = 3CPack
                    N-K-1 AckMaster.  
                    Logical Value = Yes will enable a radio button choice 
                    A) Top of the OU4 Order Ackknowledgement Print Parameter Screen 
                    B)  OU1 "Acknowlkedgement" button at the top).  
                    
                    The choice will be "Acknowledgement" or "Order Master".
                    When Acknowledgement is selected -> N-K-1 AckHead will Print.
                    When Order Master is selected, the Range parameters will still be active.
                    The Print options will be disabled since they don't apply.  
                    When Printing, the attached Order Master page will need to be printed for each item for the order
                    s that pass the selection criteria.
                    
                    N-K AckMaster  Character Value  = 3CPack".
                    The format of this Order Master will be defined by the 
                    The 3CPack format is attached.
                    The color coding in the attached is for information purposes only. 
                    Output should be all black & white.  Do not print the color coding key at the bottom.
                    Although only 4 slots are shown, the report  needs to print all misc charge and all releases for 
                    an order item.  The report can go on to a second page if necessary.

                    Job Ticket to print Net Sheet W and L and Sheets Required equal to Net Sheets Required.
                    See attachments.
                    
                    Sheets required should be like Delta's job ticket.  
                    Example on our system job/order 201729.
                    Required sheets should be 5500 (2750 x 2) (# sheets x gross # out).
                    
                    Corrugators estimate with maximum out for lowest cost for corrugator run speeds.
                    However, the corrugator scheduling software may change this number out.
                    Therefore, the job ticket must show the number of sheets after the corrugator and net sheet size.

O-U-5-   02071302 E N-K JobCardF = Prystup   Toggle Box to Print Releases on Page 2
                    Prystup Job Ticket Sample is Attached.
                    Currently, the job ticket prints 1 line per finished goods item.
                    The yellow highlighted lines were manually copied for each release line.
                    Add New TOGGLE Box called:  Print by Release Lines  on Print Selection Screen.
                    When checked, this will print a line for each release for each finished goods item.
                    The Qty will print the Release Qty.
                    The PO# will be the Release PO#
                    The Lot# will print under the Control#.
                    The Control# field will be renamed to RFQ#.
                    
                    Currenlty, the Advantzware O-U-1 Items tab has an Item Name and 3 Description Fields.
                    Currently, Prystup enteres the RFQ# in the 2nd Description Field.
                    This RFQ# prints on the Prystup Job Ticket under the field called Control# on Page 2.
                    There are General Mills orders that require a separate RFQ# per delivery release.
                    The O-U-1 Release Tab Field called LOT# will be used to enter the RFQ Number.
                    Robin can enter the unique PO# and unique RFQ# in the Lot Field.

O-U-5-   10111203 E N-K JOBCARDC - Trilakes2
                    N-K-1 / JOBCARDC - TriLakes2
                    Job Card  shows overrun and under run as a percentage %. 
                    This percentage is based upon what we set up the in customer files, but can be changed on the ITE
                    MS tab of O-U-1 during order entry.  Change the over/under run % be changed to show maximum, mini
                    mum pieces for the order.
                    
                    Change the percentage to Quantity Field.
                    1)  Change lable from Underrun to Min.
                          Data will be the Job Qty from J-U-1 x percentage on the Items Folder.
                          Underrun Qty Formula is Job Qty x (1 -  (Underrrun % / 100)
                          If perentage is 5% this is divided by 100 then Add 1 
                    2)  Change lable from Overrun to Max.
                          Data will be the Job Qty from J-U-1 x percentage on the Items Folder.
                          Formula is Job Qty x 1 + (Overrun % / 100)
                          If perentage is 5% this is divided by 100 then Add 1 
                    
                    Example;  ITEM Folder is changed to Overrun 5%, Underrun 5%
                    Job Card will show :  Minimum 950 / Maximum 1050.
                    Min = 1000 x .95
                    Max = 1000 x 1.05

O-U-5-   10131407 E N-K JOBCARDF = CentBox - Pop-up messages for QA Notes
                    N-K Jobcardf=Centbox.  See ASI Job for FG item ATT-2297
                    This mod will add the following functionality when a user prints a Job Ticket using the format "C
                    entBox":
                    1) The system will display a pop-up window for each Spec Note 
                         (ie notes accessible from the book icon) 
                         For each Finished Good item on the job with the "Spec:" category = "QA".  
                         If there are 7 items on a job and each of them has a QA note, the user will see 7 pop-ups.
                    2)  The message will contain a message on the first line.  
                          On the second line, the label "Note:" will print followed by the contents of the QA Note
                            (wrapping lines if necessary).  
                          There will be a single "OK" button to dismiss the pop-up. 
                    3) For the 1st job for a given FG item, with a Job Created date that is later than the date of th
                    e note, the message will be a warning message.  
                    The first line will read: "Warning: Quality Defect on Previous Run!".  The message will display a
                    n "info" icon (blue circle with lowercase i).  The title of the message window will be "QA Warnin
                    g"
                    4) For all jobs with a created date later than that of the first job identified in #3, the messag
                    e will be an Alert message.  The first line will read: "Alert: Please Verify That Previous Qualit
                    y Defect Has Been Resolved."  The message will display an "alert" icon (yellow triangle with excl
                    amation point).  The title of the message window will be "QA Alert".

                           the Item Name from estimate (see attached).

                           Quantity + Overrrun).

                    Height/2 + .125
                    We need to make the following changes.
                    If the height of the partition is 1.5 or lower calculate the slot depth by Height/2
                    If the height of the partition is over 1.5 calculate the slot depth by Height/2 + .0625

O-U-7-   02071305 E New Toggle box called  ___ Transfer Lot# to Pallet Tag
                    O-U-1 Loadtag Icon and O-U-7 Loadtag Menu Option.
                    Click Print PO#  From  =  ___Release
                    
                    1)  Add new Toggle Boxed called:    Xfer Release Lot#  
                    (Which in reality will be the Generai Mills RFQ#)
                    The O-U-1 Release Tab has a field called Lot#.
                    The O-U-7 LoadTag program creates pallet tags.
                    The print selection screen is used to download data to a worksheet prior to creating loadtag.
                    The Worksheet has a field called FG Lot#.
                    When Xfer Release Lot# is checked, this will transfer the O-U-1 Lot# to the O-U-7 worksheet Lot#.
                      
                    
                    2)  ADD new Field to Worksheet, PO# to the Worksheet as a Display Only.  
                          This already downloads to the TEXT File.  
                    
                    
                    Please note,  (No programming needed for following)
                    The existing logic will then automatically transfer the Lot#  to the I-U-1 Receipt screen.
                    Then when the receipt is posted, it will be transferred to the Finished Goods I-F-1 History tab. 
                      
                    The net result, the RFQ# will follow the Pallet Tag# thoughout the system.
                    This will appear whereever the Tag number is displayed.
                    Bottom line, adding the RFQ# to the Lot# is a far more dynamic option for the RFQ number then typ
                    ing the RFQ# to the Orders Descripiton 2 field.

O-U-7-   07101301 E Add Tag Counter# and Total Tags for Run
                    O-U-7 and Loadtag Icon on the Order Entry screen (O-U-1, items tab) 
                    The worksheet allows defining number of units, unit count and total number of tags.
                    Create the following new Text File Fields
                    1)  Tag Counter#     (This will always start at 1 and end at the number of tags created)
                    2)  No of Tags         (This will be the number of tags defined on worksheet)
                    
                    For example, 
                    Customer service types unit count of 2000, units per pallet = 1 and Total Tags = 10.
                    The program will create 10 tags numbered 1 through 10.
                    Each line in the text file will have the Qty of Tags = 10.
                    The first line in the text file will have Tag Counter# = 1 and No. of Tags = 10
                    The 2nd line in the text file will have Tag Counter# = 2 and No. of Tags = 10
                    The 3rd line in the text file will have Tag Counter# = 3 and No. of Tags = 10
                    The 4th line in the text file will have Tag Counter# = 4 and No. of Tags = 10
                    The 5th line in the text file will have Tag Counter# = 5 and No. of Tags = 10
                    The 6th line in the text file will have Tag Counter# = 6 and No. of Tags = 10
                    Etc.
                    Etc.
                    Etc.
                    The Box Plant will creates labels that Print 1 of 10,  2 of 10, 3 of 10 etc.  So the Plant knows 
                    how many tags to run for this job batch.

O-U-7-   08301203 E LoadTag to Downlaod User Selected Shipto Address
                    Currently, shipto information is downloaded from the release folder.
                    However, orders may ship to multiple locations which require printing multiple load tags for each
                     delivery location.
                    
                    Add new field on the O-U-7 Print Selection Screen.
                    Toggle Box called  Shipto  Y/N which will be a toggle box   
                    Also as field called Shipto Code ________  
                    If Shipto is Checked, 
                    then the user can press F1 on the Shipto Code to select a Customer File Shipto Code.
                    Once the Code is defined, this will OVERRIDE, the current logic.
                    Thus the shipto information will download the shipto code defined on the O-U-7 screen rather than
                     download the shipto from the Release Tab of  OU1.
                    
                    IF the toggle box IS NOT checked, the shipto data will continue to download from the O-U-1 Releas
                    e Folder. 
O-U-7-   09151408 E Load Tag prompts by Spec Code = UN (Unitization Notes)
                    New Spec Group = UN  for Unitization Notes
                    
                    O-U-7 Loadtag Creation will search for I-F-1 Book Icon for Spec Note = UN.
                    If the Fishished Goods item has a Spec Note = UN, then the Spec Notes will Popup.
                    
                    When creating the loadtag, the program immediately executes an UPDATE funciton.
                    Priop to the update, the program will search the FG item for the Spec Note.
                    The User will press OK on the Notes to proceed to type the unit counts.
                    If an order has multiple finished goods items.
                    The UPDATE button will be used to change each Finished Goods Item.
                    Likewise, when the UPDATE button is pressed, the program will search for Spec Note = UN.
                    If this exists, the Notes for the Spec Code UN will display before the Counts can be updated. 
O-U-7-   10051104 E N-K RFIDTAG   Change RFID Format to 24 Digits Number
                    Change the O-F-2 Control Next RFID number to be a 24 digit number.  Also, change Loadtag file to 
                    house this 24 digit field.   The RFID tag value currently created will have the zip code then lea
                    ding zeros, then the actual number of the tag at the end.   
                    So a tag might look like:  608030000000000000001234
                    
                    Just increment by one for every new pallet.   For example:
                    Pallet 1 = 608030000000000000001234
                    Pallet 2 = 608030000000000000001235
                    Pallet 3 = 608030000000000000001236
                    Pallet 4 = 608030000000000000001237
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 229

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    Pallet 5 = 608030000000000000001238
                    Pallet 6 = 608030000000000000001239
                    Pallet 7 = 608030000000000000001240 (notice how I did not roll to 123A which is a Hex digit)
                    
                    If you just increment numerically, our system does not care.  Your system never has to do any con
                    version from HEX to Binary or ASCII and it saves on your development effort.  Your Foldware field
                     in the Foldware database essentially becomes a 24 digit numeric field.
                    The prefix on the RFID sytem filter tags at the read points.  Its not necessary for the system to
                     operate but helps eliminate erronous non-Accord tags from being seen.  In 5 years, we could see 
                    lots of products and assets being used or purchased by Accord that this system does not need to t
                    rack that have RFID tags embedded.  The prefix helps the system filter those tags.
O-U-7-   10081202 E New Pallet# in Customer File as Counter for Bar Code on LoadTag
                    New database field in customer file called Pallet# representing a Pallet Counter.
                    Add F3 Help logic to document field.   This will be numeric 9 digit field counter number of the l
                    ast pallet.   Customer will type the last pallet number such as 111000200.
                    The loadtag program (O-U-7) will import the pallet number + 1 and download to the text file.
                    The loadtag program will sequentially number each pallet loadtag.
                    For each loadtag created, the pallet# will be increased by 1.   For example, if the customer file
                      Pallet# is 111000200.   If loadtag program is run and the user makes 10 pallet tags.
                    The program will download the pallet numbers 
                    111000201,
                    111000202,
                    111000203,
                    111000204,
                    111000205,
                    111000206,
                    111000207,
                    111000208,
                    111000209,
                    111000210,
                    The last number 111000210 will then be the number displayed in the customer file.
                    If they run loadtags for another item the next pallet tag will be 111000211.
                    PLEASE NOTE, when the last 6 digits are 999999 PROMPT,  Reset Pallet Number to 1.
                    The customer must then reset the number to 11100000.

O-U-7-   10161306 E Popup Warning When LoadTag Qty Exceeds Allowable Overrun Qty
                    Loadtag Worksheet can be printed via Advantzware and Sharp Shooter.
                    See Attached.
                    
                    New Popup Warning Message when typing Number of Tags.
                    " Number of Tags x Count  exceeds the Order Qty + OverRun% Allowed! "
                    Continue?  Yes will Allow.   NO will Force Changing the Number of Tags.
                    
                    On Attttached Example.
                    Order Qty = 75,400
                    Overrun = 0%   (This equals multiplier of 1)
                    Count = 2900
                    
                    Hence Allowable Overrun = 75,400 x 1.00 = 75,400
                    
                    75,400 / 2900 = 26 Pallet Tags
                    
                    If he types 27 or greater, he will get Warning TAGS Exceed Allowable Over Run ??
                    
                    
                    PLEASE NOTE.  This will prevent user from typing weight of 2000 in the number of tags field.

O-U-7-   11221003 E N-K RFIDTAG   To Create New Sequential Number
                    Deploy this task with deploying P:\asi_gui10\db\asidelta_rfidtag.dfN-K-1 RFIDtag.    
                    Create and use RFID Tags?   New database fields called RFID tag in the Sharp Shooter Loadtag File
                    , LoadtagText File, FG Receipt File, FG Transfer, FG Cycle Count and FG Control File and FG Histo
                    ry File.    Order Entry Control File (O-F-2) field called Last Bar Code Label used will be change
                    d to Last RFID Number Used.   This will be expanded to 12 digits.   
                    
                    Logical Value YES will create an RFID tag number for each LoadTag number created.
                    The SS Finished Goods Loadtag File will have a new field called RFID Tag Number.
                    This will also be downloaded to the Existing Text File.    When creating load tags our system cre
                    ates a loadtag number equal to the FG item code plus a 5 digit number.  This is too many characte
                    rs for the least expensive RFID tag number.  This new RFID tag number will be used as a cross ref
                    erence field to the existing loadtag number.    
                    
                    The O-U-7 program exists.   You simply need to create a new field called RFID Tag#.
                    This will require a delta / schema change.
                    This will require a utility to update the customers database.
                    Please note, 
                    Current Logic uses Label Matrix.
                    Accord will change to BAR TENDER software which encrypts RFID tag numbers.
                    The O-U-7 program downloads the Label from Advantzware File which have been in Label Matrix forma
                    t.
                    This assumes Bar Tender Format can be used.

                    I-U-1 Finished Goods Receipts SET PARTS Tab.

                    5 Width Partitions Item MIller Lite S02
                    3 Length Partitions Item MIller Lite S03

                    Program creates -2000 Receipt for RSC item MIller Lite S01
                    Program creates -10000 Receipt for Width Partitions Item MIller Lite S02
                    Program creates -6000 Receipt for Length Partitions Item MIller Lite S03
                    
                    
                    MOD IS AS FOLLOWS:
                    The O-U-7 LOAD TAG program creates a Load Tag under I-U-1 but does not build the Set Parts.   Cop
                    y logic from I-U-1 and build the Set Parts Automatically.

                    Unattending import of either Excel or XML formated orders.
                    The N-K-1 OEIMport will house the needed information to define the format and where to store the 
                    incoming data.
                    
                    View Control Character Value  = House the DISK DRIVE LOCATION for incoming files 
                    View Form Character Value      = House the Customer Code and File Format = UPS.
                    
                    Therefore when theView Form  character value = Premier this will be the UPS that will be stored i
                    n the View Control character value.  This will dictate the Login, FTP and Order Import format.  
                    
                    YSK:  This task imports all Excel(CSV) files from NK-Oeimport folder in batch mode.
                                And create orders same as task 11041107

                    ms in the O-F-7 Tabel that ARE NOT Locked.  If the FG item is locked in OF7 then the cost will pu
                    ll from O-F-7.

O-Z-8-   09151416 E N-K CustomerList- New Hots List (OZ8) Customer List Selection
                    New N-K CustomerList
                    Logical Value = Yes, activates new toggle box option within OZ8 called "Use Defined Customer List
                    "
                    This will disable the customer range parameter (Begin Cust to End Cust).
                    When run, the report will be printed, only for those customers that are specified within the Cust
                    omertList ViewForm with:
                    1) Character Value = "OZ8" or Character Value = <blank> (applies to all reports)
                    2) Logical value set to YES.
                    
                    Additionally, if the customer field in the View Form is left blank, the User's Customer List will
                     be included in the defined list (N-U, Customers Tab).

P-R-1-   08191305 E PR1 Report - New User Selectable Fields  Job#
                    P-R-1 Sheets Ordered Report User Selectable Columns by User ID.
                    Add Following New Fields:
                    
                    Order#        = This is listed on the P-U-1 Items Tab
                    Job#            =This is listed on the P-U-1 Items Tab
                    Job's Due  = Print J-U-1 Due Date which is a Database Field for Jobs without orders.   
                    If Job has a Customer Order# then Print the O-U-1 Items Due Date for the Finished Goods Item
                    
                    If Job does not have a customer order# then the J-U-1 Due Date is Used. 
                    However, a Job may be for customer Order with many Finished Items and the job may require many Pu
                    rchase Orders for each Sheet / Form on the job.  Therefore, the Job# and Form# on the Vendors Pur
                    chase Order on the Items Tab of P-U-1 must be used to match the Form# of the Finished Goods Item 
                    on the Jobs Browser of J-U-1.  Once the FG item is matched, then the program will find the Due Da
                    te from the O-U-1 Items Tab for that FG Item.

P-R-1-4  03211102 E Copy PR2 (Schedule Receipts) and Re-name
                    NEW REPORT:  Scheduled Receipts with Outstanding Orders  Copy PR2 
                    Example report was done in Excel - see attached.  
                    Add Beginning and Ending Receipt Date to Print Selection Parameters.
                    Add Toggle Box called Posted which will also print posted receipts for the receipt date .  
                    (Currently, they drop-off of the PR2 once they are received and posted unless another shipment is
                     due).
                    
                    COLUMN HEADINGS:  (In Capital Letters).
                    
                    ITEM NO/FG ITEM - For RMs, this should list the RM# with the FG# for the corresponding job below 
                    it (there may be more than 1 FG).  For FGs, this should list (just) the FG#.
                    BIN:  Use the Bin Location from MF1 or IF1.
                    
                    ITEM NAME/ON ORDER FOR - Print Item Description and the customer names with open orders for the i
                    tem listed below the item.   "Board Only" For RMs, list the customers with open orders that requi
                    re the RM to manufacture the resulting FG product: (Board Only)  Or; for FGs, list the customer n
                    ames for those with open orders that the item is on.  
                    
                    VEND#/CUST# - Print the Vendor# for the PO and list the Customer # for the Orders.
                    
                    PO#/ORDER# - Print PO# and list Customer Order#s below.
                    
                    UOM - Unit of Measure
                    
                    BALANCE DUE - Balance due on POs and Orders (PO quantities not yet received and Order quantities 
                    not yet shipped. Order quantite not yer shipped - This would need to look at open orders for the 
                    item being shipped.  Take order quantity - release quantities with a status of "Z" or "C" and lis
                    t the remaining quantity to be shipped.  PO's simply list the amount not yet received.
                    
                    QTY RECEIVED - PO Quantity received.  This should show any quantities received against the PO for
                     the parameter received dates indicated?whether PO is open or closed..
                    
                    REQ DATE:  Required Date from POs or Orders.
                    
                    CARRIER:  Carrier on PO.
                    
                    JOB NO/SIZE:  Job# on PO with board size (when applicable) below it.
                    
                    
                    COLUMN HEADINGS AND VENDOR INFO SHOULD NOT BE IN ITALIC AND SHOULD BE IN A LARGER FONT THAN CUSTO
                    MER INFO.  CUSTOMER INFO SHOULD BE ITALICIZED.

P-U-1-   01181011 E N-K AP GL# = Expense/Vendor
                    N-K AP GL# = Expense/Vendor
                    Add PO to Import GL Expense GL# from FG Product Category
                    RM Board Expense GL#   (raw materials expense general ledger account number) 
                    This field is used for Finished Goods with Jobs.  
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 240

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    The purpose is to have the same board material have different GL expense acccounts based on the p
                    roduct category.  Therefore, stock boxes vs. custom boxes vs. displays vs partitions may have uni
                    que expense accounts.
                    
                    The software will find the finished goods item on Job, then find the Product Category for that it
                    em.  When new RM Board Expense GL number exists, this will transfer to the purchase order line fo
                    r the board material.
                    When adding a Purchase Order for raw material type B (Board) or P (Paper) or F (Foam), the new RM
                     Board Expense GL# will transfer to the PO Line.
                    For example, when the Buyer creates a PO for 200 C for Job 201750.
                    The program will first search the FG item on this Job for this sheets form.
                    The program will then search for the new RM Board Expense GL# in the product category file. If a 
                    GL number exists, then this GL# will become the default GL# for this PO Line for this board.
                    
                    If this RM Board Expense GL# is blank, then the existing logic will occur.
                    The existing logic is based on the N-K-1 AP GL# character value.
                    Most often this is defined as expense account.  This will then find the raw material expense acco
                    unt from the raw material material cost type file under M-F-3 and then this GL# to the purchase o
                    rder.  If the character value is Vendor, then the GL# from the Vendor File will transfer to the P
                    O Line.
                    
                    FG COGS Expense GL# 
                    (finished goods cost of goods sold general ledger account number)  
                    This field is used when adding purchase orders for purchased finished goods items.  If the FG COG
                    S GL# expense number is defined, then this number will transfer to general ledger account number 
                    of the purchase order.  If this account number is blank, then the software will pull from the gen
                    eral ledger account number from the vendor file.

P-U-1-   11021206 E Delete PO Line 4 Real Material to Update RM On Order Qty ($20,000 Cont
                    New prompt to renumber the internal line number of each PO Line.  
                    For example, an existing purchase order with 3 items may be copied, however if the first and thir
                    d items are deleted, the remaining item has a line number of 2.  
                    If PO has not been printed, 
                    Delete button will prompt to renumber, which would change this to line 1.   
                    Emphasis on NOT PRINTED.
                    
                    Please note, a printed PO most likely was already sent to the vendor.
                    Therefore, the vendor may have entered the order with the existing LINE number.
                    That is a critical number for bar code receipts and CAN NOT be changed if the PO had been printed
                    .

                    COPY button on PO currently copies all data from existing PO including the old Order number.
                    The Order Number and Old Customer Code are listed on the ITEMS tab.
                    New logic will show list of open Customer Orders for this FG Item Code for Customer listed on the
                     ITEMS tab.  This search will only shows open orders for the existing customer.
                    For example,  Copy ASI Purchase Order Number 101705
                    This has FG items 6x6x6x and 8x8x8.
                    The PO Line shows the Customer and Old Order Number on Each PO Line.
                    If we copy this PO we want to select new open order numbers.
                    
                    Please note, an existing PO may have many FG Items that must be copied, therefore the 
                    popup must show all FG Items on PO that have existing Customer and Order Number.
                    
                    Logic is only invoked when
                    Existing PO is for FG Item and Item Tab has an order number.
                    Then, the a popup selection box will show Open Orders for same Customer for that FG Item 
                    Popup will list
                    Finished Goods Item, Customer Code, Open Order Number, Order Qty.  
                    They will select one of the Order numbers on the Popup.
                    Once this is updated and saved, this will be transferred to the new Purchase Order.

P-U-1-   11031104 E N-K POFARMOUTSCORES  Download Scores for Farm Outs
                    N-K-1 POFarmOutScores.  YES will download Scores to the PO Item Scores Button.   
                    Old Logic, the Score Allowances for Farm Outs Finished Goods Boxes is not automatically downloade
                    d.  It logic only exists for Raw Goods Board Material for a Job.
                    Once the Scores are downloaded to the PO, they will print on the PO Form.
                    Logical Value = YES then ADDING a new FG Item will check the I-F-1 Item file to see if an  
                    estimate exists for the item.  If an estimate exists, the program will transfer the scores to the
                     Scores button of the PO Item Screen. 
                    
                    If the logical value = NO then the scores will not be downloaded when adding a PO for a finished 
                    goods item.   
                    
                    In addition, the P-U-1  SCORES Button must be modified.   
                    If the Scores button is clicked the program will prompt to import scores from estimate?   
                    This logic will be modified for finished goods items on the PO so program will verify esitmate ex
                    ists for the item then import the scores from the estimate.
                    
                    The exising logic looks in the job file to find the estimate.
                    This new logic must look in the finished goods item file to find he estimate.
                    Add PO for Item 8x8x8  (See Email).
                    Estimate is defined on the finished goods item screen.
                    The Scores for this esimate are on the SPEC folder.

P-U-1-   11261401 E New Toggle Boxes   ___Open  ___ Closed  and  ___ Paid ___ UnPaid
                    See Attached for PO# 102766.
                    The View PO Status = U,   There are 2 Items and 1 is Open and 1 is Closed.
                    
                    1)  Change  Label from  Open PO   to    ___ UnPaid
                    2)  Change Label from   Closed PO to   ___  Paid 
                    3)  Place the  ___ Paid    ___ UnPaid   toggle boxes on the top.
                         The existing Open PO and Closed PO looks at the Status on the View PO tab.
                         Changing the Labels to Paid and Unpaid is a better description of the logic.
                    
                    4)  Add new Toggle Box called  _____  Closed
                         This will display  only Line Items with a status of C for Closed.  
                    5)  Add new Toggle Box called  _____  Open  
                         This will display  only Line Items with a status not = C for Closed.
                          For example, status N for New,  Open,  U=Updated,  etc are all Open.
                    6)  Put the  ___ Open   ___ Closed   toggle boxes directly under the ___ Paid  ___ Closed.
                    
                    All four Toggle Boxes will work together to Limit the Lines that are displayed on the PO Browser.
                      For example, on the browser
                    Type PO# 102766, Click Unpaid and Chick Open    and only Line Item 1 will Display.  
                    Type PO# 102766, Click Unpaid and Click  Closed and  only Line Item 2 will Display.  
                    Type PO# 102766, Click Paid and Chick Open    and nothing will Display.  
                    Type PO# 102766, Click Paid and Click  Closed and nothing will Display.

                    Excel Icon.

                    Save Print Parameters by User ID.
                    
                    
P-U-1-   12131304 E Purchased FARM OUTs for Jobs
                    Purchase Orders for FG Items that are Components of a SET.
                    For example, Estimate 11623 for Job 207419 has 1 Farmed Item and 2 Manufactured.
                    For example, Estimate 11524 for Job 207197 has 1 Farmed Item and 2 Manufactured.
                    Add PO for Item Miller 44 which is a Farm Out.
                    Job# will validate against FARM tab on J-U-1 File.  (F1 on Job# will show Valid Job#)
                    S/B will validate against FARM tab on J-U-1 File.
                    PO Quantity will Transfer from Farm Tabs MRP Qty
                    PO Line Item will write Customer Code from Job File SET Item
                    PO Line Item will transfer Cutomer Order Number from Job File Set Item.
                    
                    
                    SAVE on PO LIne will update the Job File Farms Tab including:
                    Vendor PO#,     
                    Vendor PO Qty, 
                    PO UOM,             
                    PO Cost               
                    PO Setup              
                    Total Actual Cost,   (Extended PO Cost)
                    Actual Cost/M          (Extended PO Cost / 1000

                    See Attached:

                    Integer Value = 0   The Current Logic that forces the user to Manually COPY attachments to the PO
                     from the attachments defined in the paper clip icon in finished goods file via the I-F-1 menu ke
                    ys.  This requires more steps, however this provides the option to select specific attachments.

                    ttachments defined in the paper clip icon of the finished goods file via the I-F-1 menu keys.  Th
                    is will copy ALL attachments defined on Paper Clip.  Automate and force the system to attach file
                    s to any PO created if the item has an attachment.   We will eliminate 5 steps and this will insu
                    re if there is a file attached to the item it gets sent every time to the vendor.

S-F-8-   01021301 E N-K SSPOSTFGCONTAGS Automaticly Posting when Consolidating Tags
                    Copy existing logic from N-K-1 SSPOSTFG  is used for Finished Goods Receipts when Logical value =
                     Yes.
                    
                    N-K-1 SSPOSTFGCONTAGS
                    Logical Value = Yes will Post To Inventory History Immediately.
                    Character value and Integer Value is not needed for this new Logic.
                    
                    When Pressing the Consolidating Tags Button.
                    When saving Post inventory after completing each line.
                    This allows moving inventory from one tag and consolidating to an existing tag.
                    Example:
                    Tag# 10x10x10    0081 Move inventory to tag# 10X10X10       00140 
                    SAVE Button will post same as POST Button.
                    This will allow reusing this TAG to consolidate again and again as soon as one line is entered th
                    is should be posted.

                    SS Raw Material Issues
                    New ADD Button Logic.
                        Automatically Import Job# and other Data fields via ADD BUTTON 
                    
                    Character Value = Spaces or JobRequired.   This will be the existing logic whereby the user will 
                    be required to enter the Job# and Quantity after scanning each raw material tag the program will 
                    move cursor to the Job# then to the Quantity field, then save the record and prompt for next tag#
                     and repeat this sequence.
                    
                    MOD Follows:
                    1)  Copy POST button from Sharp Shooter Receipts  to Sharp Shooter Issues.
                    2)  New Character Value = ScanTagOnly    When issuing raw material tags to job, the users must sc
                    an the tag then manually enter the job#.   Once this line is saved, the system prompts for the ne
                    xt raw material tag#.    The new logic will only require scanning the tag number for successive p
                    allet tag.   The job number will transfer from the previous line.   Scanning the tag will import 
                    the Warehouse, Bin Location, Job Number and Quantity for the scanned tag, then SAVE the line and 
                    prompt for the next Tag.      This process will repeat all pallet tags are scanned for this job t
                    hen the user clicks CANCEL to exit the Update mode.

S-S- -   03091003 E FG MOVE Button - POST Button to Post by LAST User ID only
                    SHARP SHOOTER POCKET PC ICON.
                    N-K-1 FGReceipt Character Value = LoadTag.
                    N-K-1 SSPOSTFG character value = Blank and Logical Value = NO.
                    The above parameters create the FG receipt when the loadtag label is created.
                    This is normally done by the user at the banding machine, for example JOE..
                    Next, another user on a forklift will move the pallet to a warehouse location, for example TOM.
                    
                    The SS finished goods receipt and move menu buttons update the same data file.
                    The SS Receipts or Loadtag Creation update the Entered User ID.
                    The SS MOVE MENU BUTTON currently updates the last user id of the file.
                    The SS POST MENU button uses the user ID that entered the transaction.
                    The SHARP SHOOTER POCKET PC Icon has a POST Button on the MOVE MENU screen that MUST USE the last
                     user ID.   
                    
                    Currently the forklift man has trouble posting because the user ID is wrong.
                    Tom only wants to post his transactions after the MOVE.
                    He does not want to post Joes receipt transactions because the inventory is a bin location yet.

                    This currently skips the warehouse and bin location.  
                    Add new logic to scan both fields   (This will be combined field)  identical to SS Receipts.
                    This program will reduce the quantity on the return line from the existing warehouse and bin.
                    So, if we overwrite the warehouse and bin, we must make sure we reduce the correct warehouse and 
                    bin.

                    Customer creates 10 Loadtag Labels for item 10x10x10 with 500 boxes per pallet.

              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 255

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview

                    The Tag numbers would be 10x10x100001, 10x10x100002, 10x10x100003, 10x10x100004, etc.
                    Each tag is represented by a bar code representing the tag#.
                    However, the finished goods receipt is entered as Job XXX with 10 Units at 500 Qty per Unit in wa
                    rehouse MAIN, Bin Location A100... This results in 5000 boxes in Job XXX in Main A100.
                    The tag number is blank.

                    inventory.  Each tag scanned MUST prompt to scan warehouse and bin.  (This will be combined field
                    )  Lets assume new locationi is (MAIN B101 will be scanned and program will load 1st 5 characters
                     into warehouse and remaining characters into bin location.   
                    
                    When SS Return is posted.
                    System adds each new Tag of 500 boxes/ pallet into MAIN B101 with new Tag#,.  Simultaneously, the
                     system reduces 500 boxes from MAIN A100 with Blank Tag#.

S-S- -   06231012 E Create zero qty on bol if not scanned in Create BOL ($50 per hour)
                    SS BOL Creation -  if item is not scanned and answer no to delete from release.
                    YES, should remove the item not scanned from release and NOT move to Bill of Lading.
                    NO, should move item not scanned to Bill of Lading with Ship Qty of Zero.
                    When the BOL is posted, this will create a backorder BOL.
                    1)  O-U-1  Create Order (202270) with Two Items
                    2)  O-U-1  Release both FG Items with No Tags
                    3)  Sharp Shooter,   Create BOL button.
                    4)  Sharp Shooter,   Scan Tags for Only one Item.
                    5)  Sharp Shooter,   Press Create BOL.
                    6)  Sharp Shooter,   System will prompt, 
                          "Release/Order#/FG# - Do you want to Delete it from Release?"   
                                    Yes will Not Create BackOrder.
                                    No will Create BackOrder.
                    
                    Original Notes Below
                    If customer does not scan an item on the Pick-Ticket, there is a question:  "Release/Order#/FG# -
                     Do you want to Delete it from Release?"  If they choose "Yes" it allows them to process the BOL 
                    and Invoice the customer (no backorder is created).  "Yes" seems to work as it should.   If they 
                    answer "No", a backorder should be created and they should be able to continue through billing fo
                    r the shipped items.  The backorder is not being created and they cannot proceed through invoicin
                    g for the shipped goods (see attachment).

                    This question is being cut off on the screen.  "Release/Order#/FG# - Do you want to Delete it fro

S-S- -   07121302 E N-K SSPostVendorTags  (Post Immediatley)
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 256

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    New N-K-1 SSPostVendorTags?
                    
                    Logical Value = YES will automate this process in one step.  Scan and Post Vendor Tags immediatel
                    y.  SS  Raw Materials Scan Vendor Tags to Post to Inventory Immediately.
                    For estimated materials such as 200C with job numbers attached to the purchase this will create b
                    oth a receipt and an issue transaction for that job.   This is the perfect setting for 
                    a fixed bar code scanner attached to a conveyor belt that reads the pallets bar code as it passes
                     the scanner.    Each tag will be posted directly to inventory so that no human intervention is r
                    equired.
                    
                    Logical Value = NO will continue to require each step.  Meaning the vendors tag must be scanned t
                    hen the Receive Tag Button must be Pressed which creates the Receipt Transaction.  Then, the POST
                     buttun must be Pressed to Post both the Receipt and the Issue transactions.   
                    
                    Please note, any Errror Message in retrieving the PO#, Pallet Count, PO Line#, UOM, etc.
                    Will Stop Automated Process.  Error will display and User must correct and Proceed Manually.
                    
                    Tested with 1022480010089900001  (This creates ASI RM Tag and stores the Vendor Tag#)
                    When Click Receive Vendor Tag Button.
                    PO# is 102248    Line#  is 001   Qty is 00899  Pallet# changes with each Scan.
                    So change to 1022480010089900002 then 1022480010089900003, etc.
                    Please note SS Icon does not work for Scan Vendor Tags.
S-S- -   08081113 E New RFID SS Consolidate Tags  (Must use new 24 hex format)
                    New Sharp Shooter Button called Consolidate Tags.
                    This will allow transferring units from 1 tag to another tag and post transaction immediately.
                    Once completed, PRINT button Copy from SS Loadtag File will reprint the LoadTag Lable.
                    
                    Copy existing TRANSFER button and make following changes.
                    Existing Transfer Button only allows transferring from one location to the next location.
                    This new button will allow transferring units (Cases) from one Tag to Another Tag.
                    Screen will prompt  FROM TAG# ____________     TO TAG# ___________   Cases ______
                    The user will scan the FROM TAG# ______Bar Code Number or RFID tag number which will import the e
                    xisting LoadTag Number.  Then Transfer Units?  _____ The user will enter how many units to transf
                    er.   Then scan the TO TAG# ______  as the next Bar Code or RFID tag number which will import the
                     cross referenced LoadTag Number.
                    
                    For example if we have 3 pallets and each pallet has 50 cases of 500 per case.
                    The RFID tags are numberd 000000000001 as LoadTag FATT-2297      000001
                    The RFID tags are numberd 000000000002 as LoadTag FATT-2297      000002
                    The RFID tags are numberd 000000000003 as LoadTag FATT-2297      000003
                    
                    They will Scan transfer RFID Tag  000000000003 and transfer 25 units to Tag  000000000001
                    They will tranfer 25 units to LoadTag FATT-2297      000003 to LoadTag FATT-2297      000001
                    They will Scan transfer RFID Tag  000000000003 and transfer 25 units to Tag  000000000002
                    They will tranfer 25 units to LoadTag FATT-2297      000003 to LoadTag FATT-2297      000002
                    NET Result Tag 3 wil have ZERO units and Tags 2 & 3 will have 75 units.
                    REPRINT Tag will reprint tags.
S-S- -   08131303 E N-K SSBOLSCAN - Integer Value to Able or Disable F1 on Tag #
                    Sharp Shooter. - BOL Create Button.
                    Both Sharp Shooter Icon and Addons Icon must be modifified.
                    
                    Integer Value = 1   Will Disable the F1 Lookup on this Field.
                    This will force the Forklift Driver to Scan the Pallet Tag.
                    
                    Integer Value = 0   This will enable the F1 Lookup on this Field.
                    The Tag Number should be Scanned on a Pallet.
                    This will allow the Forklift Driver to attach a Pallet Tag via the F1 Key without scanning.
                    
S-S- -   08171106 E N-K SSRMIssue  New Parameter to Post when Saving Line
                    N-K SSRMIssue  New Parameter to immediately post Sharp Shooter Raw Material Issues when Issue lin
                    e is saved.    This parameter will be created when clicking the Sharp Shooter ISSUE button.
                    
                    Logical Value =  NO,  When scanning a raw material bar code to issue the material to a job, the S
                    AVE button WILL NOT post the transaction line.   The POST button or POST menu option must be used
                     to post the issue tranaction.
                    
                    Logical Value = Yes    When scanning a raw material bar code to issue the material to a job, the 
                    SAVE button WILL post the transaction line immediately, which will reduce the on hand quantity.  
                    The POST button or POST menu option WILL NOT be needed.   For example, once a raw material tag nu
                    mber is scanned and the user types the Job#, the program saves the line.  If logical value = Yes,
                     then the system will POST that line and that line only.  Essentially, this will execute the logi
                    c in the POST button with the UserID, tag#, item code, job#, defaulted. 
                    To Test 
                    Click Addons and / or Sharp Shooter Icon.   
                    Click Raw Materials.
                    Click Issues.
                    Scan a raw material item SBS18-24 tag 01014060010000001 to Tag# 01014060010000009 for job W2297-1
                    1.  This will import 20,000 lineal feet.
                    Save or Tab will save record then post directly to History.

S-S- -   10181210 E N-K FGPost Integer Value=1 Update Release Qty if Run & Ship ($20,000 C
                    Sharp Shooter Post Button and Post menu  will be changed for FG Recipts Integer Value = 1 
                    Integer Value = 1, when Posting Finished Goods for Receipts will update Release Quantity when Tot
                    al Receipt Qty exceed Order Quantity.  This new logic will provide visibility to ship and invoice
                     overruns that otherwise will become waste and lost revenue.
12/10/2014             Advanced Software Services, Inc.               4:24 PM
              Completed By Date & Programmer    Customer Report      Page: 258

Hot Keys Task#    T Overview
-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    
                    Releases not processed will be overwritten with the Total Receipt Quantity.  
                    Releases that have been processed, then a new release will be created for the Receipt Qty less (O
                    rder Qty-Actual Released).
                    The Order Qty, Produced and Actual Release Qty quantities are displayed on the O-U-1 browser.
                    The following must criteria must exist to update the Release or to Create a New Release
                    1)  Job# exists on the Finished Goods Receipt Screen and
                    2)  Total Receipt Qty for Job# exceeds Order Quantity  
                    3)  Run & Ship Toggle Box = YES 
                    then 
                    If Release Status = "S", "I" or "L" or (A and not Printed) or (B and not Printed then) 
                    Total Finished Goods Quantity will replace the Quantity on  O-U-1 and O-T-1.
                    or
                    If Release Status is P, Z or C or (B and Printed) or (A and Printed) then
                    Program will create a new Release on the O-U-1 Release Folder for Total Receipt Qty less Total Re
                    lease Qty.
                    
                    Please note, O-U-1 Produced Qty is total Qty for all Receipts for all Tags for that Job.   
                    For Example. Job Qty = 14,500 and Order Qty = 12,000.  
                    The release will be automatically changed to 14,500.  
                    This will also update the O-T-1 release if the release is not printed.   
                    If the O-T-1 release is printed or if  the  Bill of Lading is created and Printed for 12,000, the
                    n 
                    FG Posting will create a new release. Qty = Total Produced less Actual Release. 
                    Please note this logic will use Actual Shipped Quantity to determine overrun quantity not shipped
                    .  
                    As another example.
                    
                    For example, a run and ship order for 12,000 has a release created for 12,000.  
                    As production stacks 4000 per pallet, a truck driver may be waiting at the dock for the boxes.  
                    Once 3 pallets of 4000 are created, the skids are loaded on the truck and the driver leaves the d
                    ock.  
                    However, the machine then loads another unit of 2,500 boxes that are an overrun are received into
                     inventory.   
                    At this point the system will create a new release for next day.
S-S- -   10201403 E N-K SSBOL Creation: Add qty difference warning and email
                    Logical Value = YES  triggers the Email.
                    
                    New email  notification when creating a BOL through Sharp Shooter.  
                    1)  A warning message already exists to warn the user that the scanned qty is less than the      
                    released qty.  The first change is to enhance this message to warn if the qty is different.      
                    (over or under the original OT1 qty).
                    2) An email notification process already exists if a BOL is created when:
                         a) an FG Item is added to an existing release
                         b) an FG Item is removed from an existing release
                         c) an order is added to an existing release
                    This mod will add a 4th reason to generate an email:
                        d) Creating a BOL with a total scanned qty for a given item that is greater than
                             or less than the qty originally on the OT1 release. 
                    
                    If the user continues to process the BOL after receiving the warning message,
                     then an email will be sent using the same process that already exists for the emails generated f
                    or criteria a, b or c above.

S-S- -   11221302 E N-K SSTRANSF  Character Value = ItemFle
                    See Attached.
                    
                    Sharp Shotter-Finished Goods Transfer Button
                    When transferring a Partial Pallet Tag, the program automatically creates a new Loadtag for the P
                    artial Quantity being transferred.
                    
                    Sharp Shooter-Finished Goods Transfer Button will automatically popup a Print Message to print th
                    e loadtag that is automatically created when transferring a partial pallet tag.  
                    
                    Partial Pallets are only possible when the quantity transferred is less than the existing loadtag
                    s quantity on hand.  When the character value = ItemFile and the finished goods field ship method
                     = case, program will prompt for the number of units.   When the tags Bill of Lading quantity is 
                    less than the current on hand quantity, the program immediately creates a new loadtag for the Par
                    tial Tag by copying the scanned loadtag.  Only the transferred partial units and count are listed
                     for the new Tag. 
                    
                    After creating the new loadtag, the program will display immediately display a LOADTAG Print Scre
                    en prompting to print the Loadtag.   This screen will mimic the the existing logic from menu keys
                     O-U-7 with the REPRINT TAG toggle box checked. 
                     If the User Clicks OK, the loadtag will print immediately.

T-D- -   06141004 E N-K TSFINISH Mod Request - Char Value = "NO"  Default ($75. an hour)
                    N-K TSFINISH to determine default for machine completed field per operation.
                    
                    Character Value = All Machines, 
                    This will be the current logic of defaulting the COMPLETED field to YES when ending any MR, RUN o
                    r Downtime charge code.
                    
                    Character Value = NO 
                    Will always defualt the completed flag to "NO", on all machines.
                    
                    Character Value = Last Machine, will default all operations to NO for not completed except for th
                    e END of the last operation.   The last operation is dictated by the last operation under the 
                    (T-F-8)  Machine Assigned charge codes sequence folder if defined, else via (T-F-6)  Job Sequence
                    .  Once the last operation is completed, all prior operations will also be set to Completed in th
                    e job's routing file.

T-D- -   11291004 E N-K TSKEYBOARD Log = no to Remove On-Screen Keyboards
                    N-K TSKEYBOARD 
                    If you are using a real keyboard in the plant, the operator may not want to see the virtual keybo
                    ard during touch screen.   The logical value will turn this on or off.
                    
                    Logical Value = YES 
                    This will display the on screen keyboards to the plant personnel to type user ID, job number, was
                    te and production quantities.
                    
                    Logical Value = NO   
                    This will not display the on screen keyboards to the plant personnel to type user ID, job number,
                     waste and production quantities.  This option will require a keyboard and mouse at each data col
                    lection device.

                    Find Bank Balance from GF4 and Subtract Check Balance.

                    Find the Cash General Ledger Account is defined on V-F-6 Control File.   
                    The Find the Bank under G-F-4 matching that GL Account Number.
                    See Attached.
                    
                    As each AP Invoice is applied, the CHECK Balance displayed will reduce the Cash Balance.

                    Vendor Payment Selection.  New Mod is to ensure that they save money on the payment discount by p
                    aying invoices before the expiration of the discount date.
                    See Attached for new Fields and Toggle Box

                    4)  New Toggle Box will work opposite of the existing Due Date Logic that shows Invoice After    
                          Due Date.    New Discount Date will show invoices Before the Due Date.
                          For example,  We have 3 invoices dated 1/1/2013.
                          1st Invoice has payment terms of 2% if paid within 5 days, hence Disc Date = 1/05/13
                          2nd invioce has payment terms of 2% if paid withn 10 days, hence Disc Date = 1/10/13
