-------- -------- - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          3rd invoice has payment terms of 2% if paid within 15 days, hence Disc Date = 1/15/13
                    We run checks each Friday which is 1/4/2013 and next week on1/11.2013.  Therefore we want to Show
                     all invoices with discount before the next check run of 1/11/2013.    The user will enter the DI
                    SCOUNT date of 01/04/2013 and next 6 days.  This is 1 day before next check run.  Hence, the calc
                    ulated date is 1/9/2013.  So all invoices with DISC Date before 1/9/2013 would also appear on the
                     worksheet when the TOGGLE Box Show Invoices available for Discount is Checked.   They want to pa
                    y invoices before Discount date, but not too early.If this toggle box is not checked, then the ex
                    isting logic will run and Only Invoices PAST due will appear.

V-F-1-   12031408 E New Browser Logic for Vendor File
                    Current Behavior:
                    If the user searches for an Record and that Record is not found:
                    For Example, Search for State = PA and  Buyer = Sewa
                    1)  An error message is displayed.
                    2)  All of the search fields are cleared
                    3)  All items are displayed in the browse
                    
                    NEW LOGIC:
                    For Example, Search for State = PA and  Buyer = Sewa
                    1) "No Items Found, please update your Search Criteria" 
                    2)  Seach Fields are not Cleared and Remain as entered, 
                         with the cursor active in the field last used
                    3) No estimate records will be Displayed in the Browser

V-R-7-   06031403 E New Tax report instead of old one.
                    See attachment for setup.
                    
                    Tax Code      Tax Rate         Gross Sales $       Taxable $          Exempt $              Tax $
                    
                    ______________________________________________________________________
                    
                    
                    Tax Code = Tax Code
                    Tax Rate = Tax Rate from tax code file
                    Gross Sales = Gross sales including Credit/Debit memos from AR
                    Taxable Sales = Total taxable sales billed from invoicing
                    Exempt $ = Gross Sales minus 
                    Taxable $ = Total Tax billed from invoicing

V-U-3-   03161104 E N-K GLPOST - New Parameter - Do not Post AP Invoice Out of Period
                    Create a new Parameter = N-K-1 GLPOST.   
                    Description = Post AP Invoices within current period only?   
                    Logical Value = NO as Default.
                    Character Value =  User Defined Password to be entered when Logical Value = YES.
                    
                    If logical value is set to YES, then this feature will be turned on. 
                    This will check the invoice dates entered in VU1 against the corresponding 
                    "CURRENT" period set up in the company file for TODAYS Date.
                    If the invoice dates are not within the same period as the post date entered then pop up a messag
                    e that says 
                    
                    ***CAN NOT POST OUT OF PERIOD, ENTER SECURITY PASSWORD OR  ENTER TO               RETURN***
                    
                    If a password is entered, validate it against the character value. 
                    If correct PASSWORD is typed, then allow to post.
                    If no password is entered and they hit return, return to post date field to re-enter.
                    
                    
                    To verify that the invoice and post dates are within the same period use the GF1 (Company File, O
                    pen periods tab)

V-W-2-   09271107 E N-K AuditDir - Change logic for VW2 to save to disk
                    The N-K-1 AuditDir  parameter is used to save the AUDIT TRAILS to Disk Drive.
                    For example A-U-4 already has this logic.
                    This replaced the files being saved to the RCODE directory.
                    N-K-1 AuditDir Character Value houses the name of the Folder to save the data files.
                    For Example, ASI stores other posting reports know as Audit Trails to the following Disk Drive.
                    P:\ASI10Test\Rco1010\Audit 001\AUDIT TRAILS

                    he character value when posting = Yes.  
                    Program name is ap/r-dbcrap.r
                    
                    This is ONLY Save to Disk when the user clicks YES to Post !
